Have you hade to solve several works together in the same time?
Have you felt upset or anxious at last?
I have met this problem and was anxious at last because all things messed.
Therefore, I agree that people do very few things well, because they are busy doing many different things.
There is a couple of specific facets why I think in this way.
Initially, the physical function of humans' brain only allow people to solve one thing at one time when there are many things have to be solved.
When people are solving one thing, their brain will regard other things as distractions and will ignore them.
For example, when I am reciting essey, I cannot solve the math questions at the ame time.
When I try to focus on math work, I forget every thing about reciting.
At last, I do not solve math problem or recite the essey.
Thereby, people can just focus on one thing.
If we want to solve several things at the same time, we may get nothing back.
Moreover, the pressure of the burden of many things will make us anxious.
The anxiety will let us be unwilling to solve those problems.
For instance, when I was a child, I needed to do chores to earn money.
I had to watch outfit, sweep the floor and clearn the windows.
I wanted to finish these works as soon as posible, so I decided to do all things at the same time.
When I was sweeping the floor, I brought a bucket of water with me and tried to clean the window.
Nevertheless, I messed all things.
The water in the bucket spread out
Taking account all the factors mentioned above, we may safely arrive the conclusion that people do few things well, when they are too busy to manage many different things.
Once upon a time, I attended a lecture and listened to an expert talking about the planet.
He said there are nine planets in our solar system.
How ever, in the year 2006 Pluto was actually classified as a drwaf panet.
That time, I was anxious and had no idea about whether I should correct the mistake he made.
Now, I think correcting the mistake immediately will be a good choice.
Firstly, not correcting the mistake will lead professors or leaders to make more mistakes.
If the leader's later decision is based on his previous incorrect assertion, more false decisions would follow.
Tke my boss as an example.
In a metting, my boss proposed to invent a new product to attract people's eyes.
While he did take the cost into account, the cost is  too large to cover the profit.
So, he improve the price of new product.
Although I knew the truth, I didn't pint out in front of employees, because none of employees stood out to correct him.
When the new product came out, few people bought it because of the high price.
The company eventually went bankrupted.
So, it is obvious that it was a wrong decision to not correct the mistakes.
Secondly, correcting the mistakes untill the meeting ends will bring bad influences on listeners.
The reason is that people always are curious about things that they are unfamiliat with.
If the mistake is not corrected immediately, it would go with a person for a long time.
For instance, my maths teacher introduced a new formula which can help our students to calculate easily.
He spent so large amount of time to talk about it that I learned it by heart.
However, after the class, a student pointed out that what professor said was incorrect.
In the final exam, I could not recall the corrct formula because I could only remember the formula that I recorded on my professor's class.
Admittedly, it seems reasonable that correcting the mistakes in front of lot of people is rude and impolite to the professors or leaders.
They might be so embarrassed and awkward that don't how to go on with the topic.
Whereas, the persson who correct the mistake can use careful words and manners to gently remind the professor or leader to maximize the advantage of correcting the mistakes.
To put it in a shell, rather than waiting ubtil the class or metting is ober and talking to teacher or leader later or saying nothing, the best way is to interrupt and correct the mistake right way.

I don't think parents' offering their school-age childen money for each high grade they get in school is a good idea.
Initially, offering their school-age children money for grade will make their children study just for pursuing the money,not for the desire for knowledge.
It's not good for the mental development of the children.
When there are no money after achieveing the good grade,children will lose the enthuisam for studying.
One of my classmates used to study so hard and achieve good grade just for the money, which to some extent encoureages him to study.
But after the parent stop the offering,he became not interested in learning and drawn himself in computer games.
He believed that studying is meaningless since good grade had brought no money.
secondly,offering school-age children money for grade will destroy the purity of achieving knowledge.
We have the desire for studying just because our curiosity to the world and our desire for exploring the secrets of our world.
offering school-age children money for grade would destroy those desire of the students.
thirdly,offering school-age children money for grade may help develop a terrible outlook of money.
Children may get their money so early in their life and they don't know how to manage the money.
They may spend it casualy and even grow disporpriate desire for money.

They may first just use the money for some cheap toys,but gradually they focus on more expensive toys or something and they will ask for more money,which may make them hard to live on themself after stopping this offering.

Last but not least,offering school-age children money for grade will increase the burden of the family finance,and some parents may increase the money each time just for keeping encouraging the children to make progress.
And this worsen the financial burden.
Based on what i discuss above,i don't think parents' offering their school-age childen money for each high grade they get in school is a good idea.

It's clear that teacher plays an significant role in society since this job has great influences on every peoson.
Therefore, views differ when it comes to the problem whether the teacher is appreciated and valuable by society in the past than today.
In my eyes, I agree with this proposal that ancient people valuate teachers more.
The first resaon is that the teachers are rare in the past.
There's a saying"A thing is valued if it is rare."
Considering the past, only few people can be educated because of the hierarchy and the fund.
Teacher is a job that required deep knowlegde acquisition, so it's hard to become a teacher in the past.
It's the poor-educated situation in the ancient time that led to the appreciation to the teachers by society.
Contrary to the past, every person has the chance to go to school in the modern society, which means the amount of teachers increased.
Teachers and educational equipments become virious, so people no longer consider teachers as an unreachable position.
As a result, they doesn't respect teachers as they did in the past.
In addition, the modern society overly emphasis the quality and the independence in the class.
This educational idea causes the phenomenon that people pay less attention to the respect to teachers.

In the past, teachers such as Confusis in China, Socrates in Ancient Grace, they are respected teachers because people in the past have a strong grade consciousness, they wouldn't offend teachers easily and they considered teachers as the central leader of the class.
However, the present students tend to study on their own, which reduce the importance of the teachers.
Imagine that students all study without the guidiance of teachers, they are their own teachers, so they won't appreciate "the real knowledge-initiator" any more.

To briefly sum up, the ancient society is more respectful to teachers that today because not only the number of teachers but also the educational notion in the class impact people's respect awareness to teachers.

Few school-aged children enjoy learning and having tests, and sometimes they really need a motivation to do so.
As a result, some parent offer their kids money for each high grade or mark they get in school, hopong to stimulate their passion to learn harder.
However, from my point of view, even if this way can be stimulative, I still disapprove this method for several reasons listed as follows.
First of all, we learn for broadening our horizons and improving ourselves, not just for getting money.
It might be hard for parents to make their kids fully aware of the true meaning of learning, especially when they are young and naughty.

However, if parents use money to stimulate them at the beginning, rather than gradually let them know the reason why they should learn hard for themselves, the kids might think that they learn for money and prizes.
When they grow up and find that no one will pay for their studying hard, they might stop studying, which is not a good news for their parents.
Besids, some kids might be cheating during their exams to get praised and awarded.
If this bad manner becomes a habit, it will badly influence their chracteristics and their future when they grow up.
It is OK to get a not-so-good grade as long as you try your hard to learn, but it is shameful to get a high score by cheating.
The kids' mind is pure and we should not destroy thier honesty by money.
In addition, the score does not mean everything.
Some students might have already tried their best to learn, but they still can not get a very high grade or mark.
In such occasion what the parents should do is not to scold thier kids, but to encourage them to keep going and believing themselves.

If you give them money when they get a good mark and scold them when they get a low mark, the kids might think you like thier high grade rather than themselves, which will hurt their soul and influence their minds.
All in all, I think it is inappropriate to offer the kids money when they get high scores.

Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate: whether your job has more effect on your happiness than social life does.
Opinion varies from person to another.
Some claim that you job occupies most of your daily time, so that it could have more influence on your mood than other social life.
However, contrary to their view comes my perspective that there are various social life which are atrractive and could bring about much more happiness than your job.
My points are elaborated as follow.
Firstly, traveling could make a significant contribution of the happiness.
As we all know, if a person feels tired becasue of the heavy burdon from his work and family, he usually choose to travel the beautiful scene.
Under this situation, he could pay more attention to the beautiful scene, the interesting story shared by other travelers and the delicious foods with local freature.
Therefore, it is easy for him to forget the different problems, such as the arugements with classmates, the failure in an exam or the difficult Math problem.
By contrast, if he doesn't contain this traveling, he could be upset and tired all the time, which means the social life could have a considerable effect on people's happiness.
For example, last semester, after the final exam, I chose to take a trip in national forest park in Hunan province in order to release my stress.
On the way to there, I met a humerous visiter who had the same destination with me.
I saw many beautiful scenenary, such as the clear river, the relection of the sunlight, the very tall trees, which I never saw before.
Meanwile, the humenous man explain a lot of backgroud of this park.
Under this situation, I felt refreshed and was full of energy to another turn to work.
In addtition, attending a party could also play a vital role in keeping happy.
It is an effecitve way to extend your social network.
With more friends, seeking for a help is more easier when you are face to some difficulty.
It is also necessary for you to share your stress and upseting experience to them, which makes you keeping a positive attitude easily.

By contrast, if you seldom join the party, leading to a limited number of friends, you could not find even one person to share you stress and failure, which apparently causes a negetive condition to you.

In conslusion, I must repeat that although your job could be partly associated with your happiness, social life, such as traveling and attending a party, could play a more important role in the contribution of the happiness.

Currently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate: which one is better for people, following their dreams even if the dream are ambitious or focusing on achieving realistic goals.
Opinions vary from people to people.

Some claims that people should follow their dreams even if the dream are ambitious, since such dreams means a unprecedented success which have not been exploited and it is more likely for people to success.
However, I hold an opposite view that people should concentrate on achieving realistic goals, because it is easier for us to success and perservance.
First off, the realistic goals means there are more experience and cases we can take to ensure our success.
To illustrate, when achieving realistic, even if we confront with some thorny problems, we can ask some predecessors for help, which can help us to overcome these problem more quickly and effciently.
In this case, our ultimate success can be guaranteed.
By contrast, when people persue the ambitious dream, there are usually no predeccessors.
When they face the unsettled problems, they have to struggle with it by their own and they even don't have people who understand their depression.
For instance, My professor MS. Zhang sparses no effort on resolving the problem of the technology of restoring electricity tremendously, which is thought to be extremely hard and ambitious.
Besides, he had no coworker or students who work in the same field as him, which made him feel very lonely and isolated from the society.
Additionally, the realistic goals is easier to perservance.
To elaborate, when we chase the realistic goal, we can perview the result of each section.
After complete each part of our schedule, we can get a great sense of satisfaction.
Under this circumstance, we are encouraged to complete the whole goal.
By contrast.
the ambious dreams means that the result is uncertain and unclear.
Therefore, in the long process of pursuing their dreams, time will gradually gnaw away their ambition.
For instance.
my cousin dreaming of earning 1 million dollors when he was 30 years old.
Such abitious goal make him live a hectic life.
Since this dream is far-touching, he suffers from a lots of failture which makes him lose their confidence and  long time failure make him overwhelmed by depression, anxiety and even insomnia.
Eventually he decided to give up.
To put it in a nutshell.
It is more beneficial for people to pursue the realistic goal step by step, since relistic goal can guarantee our final success and perser

So when government invest on the old building and street, native people may have a more active passion to talk and introduce their city to tourists.

Since the requirements from kids are higher and higher each time.

When it comes to making mistakes, many people consider it as a terrible experience in their lives.
So do numerous parents who go out of their way to prevent their children from making mistakes.
However, as far as I can gather, I firmly contend that parents should allow children to make mistakes and let them to learn lessons from their own faults.
The reasons are manifold.
First and foremost, in some degree, mistakes can be considered as precious personal treasures.
What's more, if we can learn from them, we can make use of them to the fullest.
When we make mistakes, it apparently reveals our shortcomings and our inabilities in some fields.
Therefore, not only can we have a better understanding of what we are uncapable of, but also offer a guidance of how to improve ourselves.

Parents shoulder the responsibility to bring out the best in their children, so it is of great significance that they encourage their children not to be afraid of making mistakes and tutor them to gain from their own mistakes.

For examples, when I wanted to make a birthday cake for my best friend, my mom didn't make a cake herself for fear that I might make many terrible mistakes because it was the first time I made a cake myself.
Instead, she stood right beside me and only offered help when I asked.
During the process, I indeed made a lot of mistakes, but her smile encouraged me to adjust the proportion of the ingredients and explore my own flavour of chocolate cakes.
My DIY skills improved dramatically after this incredible experience.
Secondly, allowance for mistakes during parenting can relieve the stress on children.
Mistakes are unavoidable and they are sure to occur in children's life.
However if parents keep pushing on children and forbid them to make mistakes, their mental health is at stake.
Too much strain will come out of the fear of making mistakes.
And children may end up going to extremes to avoid making mistakes or rather prevent their parents from finding out that they are making mistakes.
All in all, I'm convinced if parents let children make mistakes and teach them how to learn from them, the advantages outweigh the disadvantages.
And it will guarantee a promising future.

It is been said that young people know how to make life choices wisely better than those in the past.
I agree with the statement for the following reasons.
To begin with, young people nowdays have better access to education.
The amount of people that have post-graduation degree has increased significantly.
While in the past, many young people did not have high school education.
Some even had no chance to go to school.
When people are equiped with knowledge, they tend to make decisions effectively and efficiently.
They are more clear about what they actually need in their typical stage of life.
What's more, technology has been developed dramatically over the past decades.
Young people are now living in the environment surrounded by new inventions.
Internet and electronic devices provides enormous amount of oppornuties for young people to boraden their eyes.
By looking at more, they know how to make choices for their own.
However, young people in the past posed limited resources.
Their perspectives were restricted.
In this case, they would ask other people, like their parents, for adive in their live paths.
Lastly, as the term "global village" is spread out, countries become boundless.
Yound people can easily go travel around the world, and exprience all kinds of culture and religions.
With rich expriences, they see what they like and what do not like.
When they make decisions in their own lives, which direction to go becomes quite clear.
In contrast, yound people in the past could not go abroad so easily.
They did not have the chances to explore and experience.
Above all, young people today know how to make wise decisions in their own lives becasue they are better education, access to technology easily, as well as increasing travelling opportunities.
In this fast developing society, people usually won't pay much attention to what happened in the past.

And when asked about the attitude towards whether all the students in the university should be asked to take history classes without concerning what their field of study is, people always exist an air of uncertainty.
However, when the question comes to me, I wholeheartedly agree that all university students should take history classes.
First, taking history courses can give chances to university students to gain more friends.
Since university students may have a lot of pressure, they would like to have friends with who are interesting while they are also helpful.
And people who know a lot about history may be more interesting to communicate with.
Moreover, people who take history courses will know many history events, so when their friends have some trouble, they can give their friends many constructive suggestions.
In this way, students who take history classes can be helpful and interesting.
So they will have more opportunities to make friends.
Then, many history events and historical heros should be remembered.
People today have happy lives because of their ancestors who devoted themselves to their countries.
Their ancestors did a lot and even sacrificed themselves to gain happiness for their offsprings.
How can people forget about them and forget how they fight to defend their countries with gratefulness?
So, no matter what field the university students study in, they are always a member of the country.
In this way, they have the responsibilities to remember their ancestors and pass on the events that their ancestors went through to the next generation.
Last but not the least, taking history classes can make people love their country more.
In the history classes, people will get to know what was their origin, how they developed, and what their ancestors went through.
Take my own experience as an example.
When I was in junior high shool, I took a history class.
And during the class I got to know a lot of tragic events that happened in the past right on the earth where we are now.
And I know that our nation paid a lot to win the battle.
Although it was tragic, we have a happy life now.
So I thought that I should love my country just like my ancestors did, and devote myself to the country in order to make it better.
To conclude, I personally think that it is necessay for all the university students to take history courses no matter what field they are study in now.
As a rookie in teaching, i strongly believed that doing the same or similar tasks all day long would be much easier and more satisfied than having many different types of tasks.
Because you don't have to be trained with so many different complicated  tasks, especially when  you are a rookie.
However, after experiencing the same job for 3 years with the similar tasks all day long, i think totally differently from before.
I think workers are more contented when they have different kinds of tasks to do than when do the same tasks all day long.
First, doing the same tasks in a day is very tedious and quite boring.
And you can imagine that you will be pretty frastrated after you lose interest in the cliche work.
But having different tasks would be very interesting and your interest and curiosity would last for long.
For example, i was asked to the only task by washing dishes in a  restaurant.
After i finished the job, i felt bored and wanted to quit.
So i was asked to do more tasks like cleaning the teables, sweeping the floors, offering menus to customers.
Finally i persited in it and got a promotion and i was very satisfied about the job.
Second, having different types of tasks to do will increase the job effectiveness.
Your brain will be cleared when shifting from one task to another.
Moreover,  in this way, your all kinds of marketing skills are trained and improved.
Hence, you will be a well-rounded talent for the job maket.
If you do the same task, you don't have a chance to strengthen  other skills other jobs required.
For example, if your job just requries you to be an assistant in teaching, your public speech skills would not be developed as a teacher.
Your knowledge on academic aspect also can not be improved so quickly as an assistant doing the same thing.
Consequently, you would not improve yourself and get promoted so quickly that you will not so satisfied.
To sum up,  workers would be more satisfied when they have many different types of tasks to do during the workday than they do similar tasks all day long.

Admittedly, workers are more satisfied when they are doing different kinds of tasks in during the workday than diong the similar tasks all day long.

Firstly, workers would finish their tasks more efficiently and effectively when they get accostomed to the pattern of multi-tasking, and this would result in the improvement of their working efficiency and acceleration of the daily schedule.

Take my work as interpreter for example, a qualified interpreter should be able to finish varied tasks and difficulties at the same time, including reading, listening, taking notes, tranlating and speaking simultaneously, it is actually more fulfilling than doing the single task one by one.
During the process of decoding and encoding, the interpreters feel satisfied when tackling these probelms simultaneously.
It is hard to say whether finishing the similar task all day would be much more fulfilled, but doing different types of tasks can definitely enhace the sense of happiness.
What' s more, getting satistied and work effeciently are not the same thing after all.

Saticfaction means the enjoyment when altering the working pattens and thinking patterns, one can get totally relaxed and relieved, this would in turn, make themselves feeling more easy, thus boosting the speed of their working and enable the employees to finish the tasks efficiently and feeling satisfied.
A worker who are diong the similar tasks all day long can certainly not feel the sense of fulfillment of taking breaks when altering different types and patterns of tasks.
In all, diong multi-tasking enable workers to enjoy themselves than doing the same kinds of task all the day.

Whether the worker would feel much more satistied when doing the same tasks or doing differnt kinds of jobs can be a controversial question, the only undeniable point is that the more efficient and perfect they finish their tasks, the more satisfied and fulfilled they would feel during the work.
Both changing different means of work and altering the thinking patterns can make the workers get relieved and relaxed down.
Though, finishing the same kind of work may seems more boring and tired, it can enhance employees' working skills and learning ability after all.
Everything is two-side sword, regardless of multi-tasking or doing the single task.
People are influenced by their families a lot.

I agree on this idea.

Besides, the society today is changing rapidly, making parents' experience less useful.

However, today's society changes a lot.
The
At last, young people have more resources to help them make decisions besides their parents.

Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among the public: whether the paid for the teacher should equal to the paid for doctors, lawyers or business leaders at least.
Opinion vary from person to person.
Some people claims that the paid for teachers should not be increased.
However, I would stand on their opposite side and I believe that the salary for teacher should at least as much as doctors, lawyers or business leaders.
First of all, increasing the paid for teacher is conducive to improve the quality of education.
It is primarily because the teachers will do their best to teach the students with a high salary.
If they do not make progress on education, they would feel sorry about a increased paid.
Thus they will try to improve their teaching skills and the quality of presetation for class.
The quality of education will rise.
For example, my math teacher used to teaching class only by obelity and his class is tedious.
When the government decided that the paid for teacher would be improved.
My math teacher began to teach us with more energy and the quality of class was improved.
Further, a rising salary for teacher is helpful for increasing the number of excellent teachers.
This is largely since the high paid attracts more people to become teacher.
So the competition for the occupation will grows.
And the winners who the position by defeating other rivals are more excellent.
For instance, when our city decided to increase the salary for teachers.
A lot of people from different fields tried to seize the chance becasue if they succeed they would got a profitable paid.
So some professors gave up their research and choosed to be teachers.
To put it in a nutshell, I firmly believe that the teachers should be paid at least as much as other high-paid jobs.
This is not only increasing the quality of education but also attracting more excellent people to become a teacher.
For a long time, television as a public medium for human beings, has entertained people with various programs.
Without any shadow of doubt, whether or not we accept it.
Television, specially advertising , change the principal of human kind's contemplation.

With this in mind, some believe that it stands to reason that television advertising directed toward children aged from two to five need to be banned due to its negative effect, while others hold the opposite view.
As far as i am concerned, the first attitude three of the most substantial are discussed below.

The most compelling point is that advertising companies often prosent their products in an exaggerated manner, which leads to mislead kids due to the fact that children under the age five lack the ability to inderstand what is good and what is bad.
They believe everything they see around them; hence, they think whatever they watch on television advertising is true.
For instance, i had a cousin who is four year old, one day when he watched a television advertisin in which a small child managed to fly thanks th wearing a coat.
He, immediately put on his coat and started to try that stunt on his room window.
As a result, promotions have a dirct effect on children owing to the fact that kids are not able to extract the gist of advertisements, they believe what they just believe what they say.

Another interpretation why i do not concur with the latter perspective in the introductory paragraph is that promotions may cause waste money and emotional torture for parants when they fail to fulfil their irrational demands of their children.
Regardless of what is children's true needs, commercial companies aim to only sell their products, which are mostly useless or unsuitable for children.
They use colorful and fantasy promotions so as to attract children to demand those items from their parents.
If parents consider the products and find them kind of meaningless junk, they cry and insist on purchasing that things, which can make parants crazy.
Consequently, commercial messages may not only be unsuitable for children, but also bother their parents.
Last but not least, television advertising promulgates bad habits among children.
For example.

in order to promote junk food products, advertising companies often exhibit a fat child who starts eagerly devouring unhealthy food such as burger and pizza, which inclines children to unhealthy food rather than healthy one, changing their eating pattern, thus endangering their health.

To put it in a nutshell, having considered all of the aforementioned ingredients discussed above, i do endorse my point of view that the demerits of commercial messages directed toward students are more than its merits.
Therefore, i think that there is an essential need to revolutionize the legs regarding advertising and parents sjould keep their eyes watching what their kids seeing.

As the development of the society, celebrities are exposed to the public more completely than ever before.
Some people thinks that those famous people have to be so because it is an essential part of their work--- they choose this path and they must sacrifice something for the wealth they get.
However, as for me, I strongly believe that famous entertainers and athletes deserve to have more privacy for following reasons:
First of all, being too exposed may make the celebrities go astray.
It is true that they can gain much money, but they cannot be content because they are always worried about being followed by others.
They need to be very suspicious and care about everything around them--Are there any reporters?
Am I Peeped?
Everyone has his or her own secrets, if they are all known, the person must be anxious, uneasy, and gradually will develop some mental illnesses.
More than everything, they may take the drug or do other illegal things to release the preesure.
For example, there was a very famous actress in China.
She was brilliant and should have won the oscar.
Unluckily, because she could not bear the little privacy she had, she drank tons of wine, took drugs and did many things that broke the law.
At last, she became a prisoner which was totally a tragedy.
If her privacy was well-protected, she would have be a winner of life.
Admittedly, their work makes them to have less privacy than common people.
However, they are also a person, they still have feelings like common people.
They also should be somewhat protected.
Only then will they devote themselves more into acting and bring more joy to the audience.
In a word, famous entertainers and athletes deserve to have more privacy than they have now considering the bad influence on their lifepath and the basic feelings they have like the common people.

Many peopel will say that it's not very important to know the big events which are irrelevent to you because they don't influence your daily life.
I agree that you don't have to learn much about them and be a expert if you don't major in them.
After all, whether Trump will be the next president or not does not influence my life directly.
However, I still agree that we should art least know about it.
Primarily cause, we all live on the planet, earth.
When the Internet and technology develop more and more advanced, it's unlikely that things happening on the other side of the world don't have impact on our life.
However, the flap of a butterfly in Brasil can cause a tornado in the U.S.
Therefore, those international big events cannot totally be irrelevent to us.
For example, ISIS, the most evil organization nowadays, is a big danger for people in mideast.
It looks like whether it's been destroyed or not don't have direct link with my life in China.
But if the ISIS finally rule all of the mideast, it's obvious that the internation oil price will skyrockets.
We drive cars to work or school.
Thus, our cost on the petro will increase sigificantly.
If we learn about the international news, we can easily figure out what is happening now.
Even if the ISIS concurs the mideast region, we can prevent unnecessary cost properly.
Secondly, we all want to communicate with others.
If you care about everything and know what the big events now, you can talk happily with all kinds of people and become a magnet to all people.

And if you care about the movies, you can talk with movies fans about the recent best sellers like the War and Warcaft and X-men.
Those materials can help you to become the shinest one in the parties.
Admittedly, there are too much information nowadays.
We can't deal with the overload information even with all of our time.
Hence, it's significant to filter the useful information for you.
You can only concentrate on a few limited fields which may be relevent to your life or increase your range of experience.
Though the news are too much and distrubing.
You will still benefit from it and spend the least time.
You have more time to deal with personal things and live a better life.

To sum up, whereas the big events happening around the world can be not relevent to your daily life, the advantages of saving unnecessary money, coupled with more material for chatting, makes a strong case that we should care about the great events happening on the other side of the world.

With the development of the society and the economy parents pay more attention on their children's eduction than before.
This is because nowadays our life become better and better so parents will have more time and ability to involved in their children's education.
Moreover, education of the children in nowdays become more important than before.
So I think nowadays parents are involved in their children's education than were parents  in the past.
Firstly, with the develpoment of the commmunity, parents have more time and vigor to involve in their children's education.
In before, for example, my grandparents did not have enought time to involve in my parents' education.
This is because, the life during this time was very hard; they should spend more time to feed this family; and provided enought school fee to their children.
But this situation was not similar to nowadays because the development of the economy and the life of us became better and better.
So my parents, for instance, always helped me to solve some academic problem and they always communicated with my teacher to know the representation of mine in the school.
Moreover, nowadays parents gained very well education so they were more capable than parents in the past.
My parents were all colleage students but by the contrary my grandparents were just gained high school education.
Clearly, my parents were more ability to provide some useful advice and involve in my study than my grandparents.
So parents today are more involved in their children's education than before.
Secondly, the education of the children become more important than before.
In the past, people in our country did not need too much level of education and if one person have very clever mind and good opportunity, he will be successful.
But nowadays people must went to a colleage only by that we could have the opportunity to find a very satisfying job and gain a very brillian future.
I disagree with the following statement.
When students work together to make a project, it might be less effectively than they work on their own.
They could spend a lot of time on chatting things that are not relative to the topic and waste their time unconsciously.
In the contrast, working alone will raise their spirit and ambition to finish their job and gives them a sense of satisfaction.
First and foremost, the conception of time will fade in team work.
The efficiency is about time-saving.
But when we are talking with our friends or teammates, we just enjoy the time we spend together and ignore its running off.
For instance, when we are discussing about where we are going to have lunch, as a team, we will have lots of fresh ideas to think about.
Then we need to conclude them into one conclusion, which will consume a lot of time and we do not seem to be aware of it.
By the way, the union of the team may be unstable.
We can not suit everyone's need and favor, so there must be some disputes and even fights.
Then we need to deal with these things and waste the time which we could have used to complete and embellish our work.
The difficulty to find everyone in our team kind and cute is too serious.
In addition, the responsibility assignment.
It is usual that you will not want to devote that as much as you do in personal work than in team work because there are someone else who will share your responsibility.
And it turns out that only a few of the partners in the team are working while others are just slipping their mind.
It is not only unfair to the burden but also to individual development.
According to what is set above, I am strongly against the statement that team work will have more efficiency.
Actually it is the sense of responsibility that matters and determines the efficiency.
Either team work or individual work, we just all need to shoulder our own responsibility.

it is difficlut for parents to sit back and allow their child to make mistakes , so there is a heated discussion about should parents let the children make mistakes and let they learn from the mistakes .

iy is reasonable for parents to do that because their are definitely love their own child and they do not want to see their child be hurted by their stupied mistake , while some mistake can be extremly dangerous.

however , no matter how much they wants to help their child , children need to have the freedom to make mistakes and learn from  them one reason why i am in favor of my perspective is that errors and mistakes can be the  greatest lessons for the cildren.

this is because children can experience what  it feels like to do the silly things so they learn that making poor decisions  leads to things that are not going to have positive influence to them and these mistakes can leave a lasting impression on children , so they will never make that mistake again . a good example odf this is when i was studiying  in the middle school  i always forgot to bring the key of  my home , but my mom was always staying at home so i never worried about it .

so i waited nearly 3 hours in the cold wind until my mom came back .
since that i learn a lesson that always remember to bring your key with you.
in adiition the mistake can be the best way to free the creativity of the child .
anyone who ahs never made a mistake has never tried to make anything new .
albert einstein said so.
indeed the mistakes offer us the opportunity to explore the new stuffs , they will introduce the chance to our life .
to sum up , if we wnt children to develop a sense odf resonsibility , make good choice and become more daring , we have to let them go and make mistakes.
Perhaps nothing in this world is as important to our life as the environment.
Some people aclaim that one of the main issues for the government is to protect wild animals and the wilderness areas for our offsprings.
However, I disagree with them.
I advovate we needn't pay too much time and resources on the protection of the wild animals' habitat and the wilderness areas.
Firstly I want to say that the protection of the wilderness areas are really a heavy cost for the governments in the world.
Most of the wilderness areas are covered by the asian, african and latin american countries.
And we all know that there are hardly any deproved countires in those areas.
So the people in those poor countries really need to use those resources,.
Controversely, the protection of those areas are conflicted to the use of them.
So, it's a hard choice for those governments choose not to use or sell those resources.
Use them can get those governments much money, but the protection needs them to cost money.
For example, an latin american country have a tropic rainforest.

The government couldn't afford enough food for their people incase it cust the wood and uses the area for agriculture, but if the government choose to protect the rainforest, that means it not only can't get a coin form the resources, but they need to pay a lot to employ forest keepers.
I believe that none of the governments would make such decision when their people are  hungry.
Secondly I don't think we need to keep such large area for our off springs.
The mainly reason fo the endanger animals' protection is they are endangered.
But every wild animals can be feed at the zoo.
So we needn't to leave huge such habitats for them at all.
We only need to catch them and keep them artificialy.
Some people may argue that our offsprings may complain about us when they could only appreciate those glorious and mysterious scene by videos and photos.
However, I advocate that the human's life is more important than the enjoyment.
I can't accceptounterless people will die for the hunger if some of our offsprings
All in All, for the reason above, we can safely conclude that it's not so important for the governmant to protect the wild animals and wilderness areas.

Currently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among parents, should children be rewarded money after getting high grade?
Opinions vary from person to person.
Some claims that children may waste money on  some bad things.
However, contrary to their view comes my perspective that children should be offered money for each high mark, which can be fully elaborated by the following reasons.
Firstly, rewarding money enables children to study better.
As we all know, we are more likely to be encouraged by the things we are longing for, which is the same to children.
If they have some money, they can buy whatever they want without permission.
This happiness will urge them to make more efforts to study and win the reward next time.
Take my own experience to illustrate it.
When I was in the middle school, I was so eager to buy a newest pencilcase.
I told my mother about my little wish, and she promise me if I can obtain high marks in the coming math test, she would give me money to buy that pencilcase.
Thus, I was so hard-working that I won the money.
Moreover, having money could develope children's confidence.
As many psychologists says, childhood could determine one's personality and innership.
Imagine the students in school all have lots of pocket-money, but a child have no money.
He may be laughted by his classmates, and become low desplined.
On the contrary, if he owned a sum of money he earned, the boy is less likely to admire others, but form a healthy personailty.
Admittedly, children have not form mature values, so they may spend money on viedio games, or junk foods, which would make bad effects to them.
Nontheless, parents can adujust the quentities  of money they give to children.
Maybe ten yuan a week is suitable, and children cannot use this buy the bad things.
To put it into a nutshell, children should be rewared money.
On the one hand, money is a good incentive to children's study.
On the other hand, having money is an essential part to constitue children's personality.
Whether group works can help students to learn more efficiently is a purely personal questions.
Some people like to work in a group while others like to work in individuals.

In my opnion, I disagree work in a group cna help us leanr mroe efiicient because when are learning in a group, we will have a lots of distractions from others or sometimes we are trying to get a free-ride from others and then we can learn nothng.
Firstly, in a group projects, we are going to get a lots of distractions from others.
There are people who like to keep talking to their friends in the group or there are someone that lways force others to accept his or her opinion even he or she is wrong.
However, if we are working in indiviuals, there will be no distractons from other people.
For example, once I was doing a group project in my middle school, at that time we were asked to analyze a Chinese poem.
At the beginning there were two people that kept talking loud which freuqently disturb my from my own work, and even if we asked them to stop, they did not stop and talked even louder.
It took a long time for us to complete because of their loud conversation.

Later on, when we were sharing our ideas, there was one person kept talking about his own opinion and used stupid reasons to dismiss others opinion even his point was wrong and that mislead all of us and we submitted a very bad projects and I barely learned anything about the poem.
Therefore, group study cannot always outweight individual studying.
Furthermore, sometime when we feel lazy when we are participting in a group project, we just want to get a free ride from others and then we cannot learn anything.
On the other hand, when we are doing things by ourselves, we are forcing to finish the work individually and there is no way for us to depend on others to finish te work.
For instance, one of my friends was working with me and two other group member to do a research about of an article.
He was really reluctant to work on this project at first so he just letting the resting of our group to finish the job.
On the other day there is a test about this research, because my friend did not work on this research at all, so he eventually failed the test because he did nt learn anything from these group work.
So, group project are not always the best choice for students to learn effectively because when we are just depend on others to finish the project, we cannot learn anything from it.
Comparing the disadvantages that study in group have to the advantages that individual work has, group project are not always the bet choice to help students learn effectively.

In this demanding society, it is not easy to make friends because of the fast pace that people socialize.

Whenever asked whether the ability to maintain friendships with a few friends over a long time is more important than the ability to make new friends easily considering happiness, people usually exhibit an air of unertainty.
However, I totally disagree with this statement.
To begin with, people do change, so they need new friends from time to time.
During the process of working and studying, people can change a lot that their old friends may not remain the same as they were.
So when people are exposed to different environment for a long time, they may have totally different opinions toward one thing.
Apparently, this will cause awkwardness or even conflicts.
Then, when they stay together, they may not be as happy as before.
In this situation, people need to make some new friends who they can talk with without misunderstanding easily.
In this way, they will still have some friends that can make them happy in time.
Isn't this a good thing?
Then, people need to socialize with different kinds of people instead of staying in their comfort zones connecting with just a few old friends.
As people grow older, they will meet a lot of different people, they have to make friends with these people may be because their daily life or their career.
Anyway, if people can make new friends easily, then people around them may consider them very friendly and are more willing to help them when they are in need.
In this way, people who can make new friends easily can go more smoothly when they enter the society.
Last but not the least, making new friends easily can also give people a sense of happiness, which is not less than the happiness they gain from maintaining old friendships.
When people explore for new friends, they can always meet some interesting people they never expected to meet.
If they can make friends with these people, it can be very surprising and can also give people a different sense of happiness because they don't have this kind of friends before.
Because a feeling of freshness always can bring a feeling of happiness.
To conclude, I admit that the ability to maintain friendships with some old friends can be important, but the ability to make new friends easily can never be less important.
There're plenty of methods that parents encourage children to study harder, such as oral praise, sending presents, taking out to have a fun and so on.
Many people think offering money can be a good choice for its convenience and feasibilityâ€”â€”chiledren can buy whaterver they want and parents needn't to waste time in picking presents.
However, in the ultimate analysis, I contend that we parents shoulden't offer children money for high grades, from the consideration of children's healthy frowth.
In the first place, the main aim of students is study, and its thier natural suty to get high grades.
If behavior well in school can get concrete material rewards, students' purpose will lack purity and the complexity will decrease their motivation on study.
What's worse, when one gets used to being praised by money, once withdraw the rewards, students will not work as hard as before.

Second, giving too many rights to student and letting them dominate thier money randomly may forster some bad habits such as extravagance, waste, being wilful and arrogant, which do harm to childen's growth.
And since the habits developed, it's hard for parents to correct.
Last but not least, indeed, student can gain sense of money from taking charge of thier own property, however barely had students have abilities to control themselves properly.
And gaining money from parents may dim the original function of thier parentsâ€”â€”they may treat parents like bank rather than kinsfolk, and it's not benificial for a whole family's unity.
There's a popular proverb in America that says: A boy lured by candy won't be grateful.
To encourage children, there are many methods better than giving money directly.
Using more wisdom and being careful can contribute the growth of one's kid a lot.
Currently, there is a widespread view that success is the most important.
However, from my perspective, it is more important to remain happy and optimistic when you fail.
At first, remaining optimistic increases the possibility that you could succeed in the next time.
To be specific, you will be upset and frustrated when you fail in something.
If you are eager to solve that problem, you need to have a positive attitude.
That is to say,  having an optimistic attitude, you are calm enough to analyze the mistakes made in the past so that you could come up with some practical methods.
In this way, you are able to try again with experience and confidence, leading to success.
On the contrary, if you get confused and sad when you fail.
Without doubt, you could not come through it and make it worse.
Set myself as an example, Once I failed in my math test which others think it is too easy to pass.
I decided to keep happy and optimistic and find out solutions myself.
Quickly, I found that I just did not understand some math equations.
I learnt them again and again.
As a result, I passed the test.
Secondly, a happy mood prevents you from dealing with the mental issue.
As we know, modern people are stressed out and nervous all the time, leading to an unhealthy mental condition.
And you may fail many times when you try to do something difficult.
If you cannot get yourself relaxed under the overwhelmed pressure, you doubt yourself whether you could finish your job in time.
That may cause further concern.
Finally, when you cannot stand that level of pressure, you have to stop all your work and go to see a doctor.
That is not worthwhile.
Set my friend as an example, he is the most understanding person in my generation.
But he is afraid of failure to an incredible extent.
When he doesn't win the championship in a competition, he even cries in his bedroom.
Now, he is in the hospital and cannot work with his colleges anymore.
All in all, keeping happy and optimistic when you fail is more important.
In this way, you can not only get prepared for next trail but also be happy

In my opinion, I believe it is a good idea that parents give their school-age children money for great performance on study.
This is a good method to encourage students to work hard at school and also save money for parents.
At first, young age students mostly do not understand why they need to work hard to get good grades.
They feel like parents are force them to study and I blieve most of them would like to play instead of study.
Money reward is a good reason for them to set goals for themselves and tell them what they can get if they achieve good grades on exams.
Once students have goals, it is easier for themselves to understand the importance of study; although is for money at that time, it still help them improve their grades.
At least they are studying for themselves instead of their parents.
And they are able to buy the things they want.
Secondly, I think this is a good way for parents to save money.
I usually ask my parents to buy toys for me when I was young; there were a lot of toys that I like, so I begged them to buy it everytime I saw a new toy.
My mother relaize that it was too expensive to buy so many toys, so she decided to let me buy it for myselve.
She told me that she would give me 5 dollars if I get 90 out of 100 on a exam and I can save those money to buy toys.
I tried hard to achieve the goal, so I can buy my favorite things.
Also, I started to think about save money, so I can buy the one toy I like the most.
I understood how difficult I got those money, I should think carfully about which toy I want most instead of buy them all.
In this way, my mother did not need to spend a large amount of money for me to buy toys.
I improved my grades and also got the toys I want.
It is a  win-win situation.
Money reward provides parents a good way to give out spend money to their children.
Children need to use their effort to earn money instead  of ask for money without doing anything.
Also, parents will have excuse to say no when their children ask for something becuase now their children have the ability to buy it by themselves.
Overall, Money reward to school-age children based on their grades is a good idea.
This method helps student to know that they are studying for themselves and they have to work hard if they want to achieve the goal.
Also, parents can gain advantages from this method by let their children to use the money reward to buy things they like.
If I meet a mistake made by my teacher and the meeting leader in a classroom or a meeting, I will choose to stand to interrupt and correct it.

Because some meeting, such as a acadmy or a meeting in the company before the new products getting into the market or even an ordinary class, are so important that we cannot just let the mitake continue.
We may not have enough time to correct it or the mistakes may just become a truth in some people's brain.
First, some people argue that we can just wait until the meeting is over.
But in some conditions, time won't permit us to do this.
For example, before Apple announced it products, the Mactonish to the market, it held a meeting in the company, in the meeting the manager repeated the most important things of the products.
But a technical employee found a mistake in tyoe of the product but he didn't choose to metnion that right away.
Then, when the meeting was over, everyone was busy with announcing the products to the market tomorrow and the manager almost had no time to listen the suggestions of the worker.
So the products sold very badly and this became a disaster to the Apple.
The time was so important that  we must say this mistakes to the meeting leader.
Secondly, some meeting are held once a year or even longer.
If you missed the chance to mention the mistake, the mistake will be a truth for others.
Take Newton for an instance, when he entered a meeting of all physical scientists around the world.
He found a mistake in the calcultion of a famous scientist.
But he thought this is not that important so he chose to say nothing.
But when Newton returned to his lab and continued his own research.
He found out that the calcultion mistake existed in all embassy wrote by other physical scientists because they didn't find the mistake and they just seemed the mistake as something right.
And it took Newton much time in the next meeting which is held three years later to explain it to other scientists.
Lastly, we must noticed that class and the meeting are places that we learn knowledge.
We cannot just let the mistake go because this is disrespect to knowledge.

In some university, students can talk and discuss as a group, and if you don't mentions the mistake which is made by another teammate, they will think this is your fault, because you don't respect knowledgeand your team

Concerning to the situation mentioned above, some people hold the view that parents should not offer their children money for high grade, while others in favor of it.

We have many leisure time with nothing to do.

To sum up, it is obvious that it is vital to know about the events happening aroud the word.

I disagree with the statement.
It is a consensus that human beings today are losing their convictions as well as their humanity.
Individuals attach more and more importance to themselves than anything else which unfortunately isolate each other from being united.
People are no longer willing to help the struggling strangers as they would do before.
When I was in high school, I once read on the newspaper that a baby girl named Xiao Yueyue were somehow left on the street where cars as well as other transportations ran on.
The baby was there for several hours before someone came to aid.
And at that time, she was breathing weakly, almost dead.
Indeed, there were a few of people passing by, about 18 in total.
Nevertheless, none of them stopped by and checked whether the baby was okay.
They just walked straight on as if they hadn't seen the baby at all.
What struck me most was that the newspaper said that some of the cars just run over on the baby girl without feeling anything unproper.
Cars are heavy, especially for a baby like Xiao Yueyue.
Those drivers shouldn't have passed over her like nothing happened whether in an ethical point or in a legal perspective.
Those passers-by just cared about themselves and didn't want to get involved in other people's life even if it's just a few minutes for them to call an ambulance.
I couldn't help signing when I read this news.
People are getting colder to others.
Admittedly, with the rapid development of science and technology, we human beings seem to live a better life than any other period in the history.
But that is just for the material life, what about the spirital life.
Considering the spirital life, we seem to be poorer even compared to the ancient people.
They didn't own much in materials, but they created civilization as they passed through generations.
They knew how to respect the old as well as care for the young, they also knew to offer food to the weak.
Look back into ourselves, we are not willing to help the struggling strangers anymore since we focus on our own interests.
If that is not sad, I don't know what is.
Nowadays, many parents offer money as a way of acceletating their children to get good grades.
Here I would like to say something about my own opinion towards this phenomenon.
First, the benefits are obvious that children will study harder in order to attain good grades which also means more money.
One the one hand, the enthusiasm of students are inspired which is beyond doubt, on the other hand, children get money will realize their small hopes using the money from parents.
It seems to be a proper cycle that children will always try hard to get high marks to get money thus buying something they want.
However, not all children are willing to sacrifice the time to play for studying, and in fact a large number of children can usually get what he wants making the way not so attractive.
Children themself might form the idea that they just do not want to get money when they are supposed to study as usual.
That apparently lead to the wrong road.
From my own perspective, I am not favour of the idea to use money to force children to study harder.
As a matther of fact, children should know the significance and necessity of studying instead of being passive.

Just as the old saying goes "interest is the best teacher", what parents should do is gradually leading children to realize the beauty behind the knowledge which will constantly attracts them to know more and learn more.
At that time, good grades are for sure when the children are not forced to do the thing he dislikes, even without the money for good maks.
Giving money to make children study may come into effect in a short time, but it will actually confuse the children what study means to them.
For children, they are supposed to understand that getting good grades is secondary and knowing the seneries behind the grades is much more fasinating.

Have you ever been in a classroom and there is a teacher who made an incorrect point while teaching in front of everyone.
Last month, I face this situation.
There are three ways to deal with this situation.
Interrupt and correct the mistake right away, tell the person who is talking after the class or meeting is over, and say nothing to them.
For me, I chose the first one without a doubt.
Firstly, I think the speaker who makes public speaking have to make sure the information he/she serves is accurate.
Otherwise, the audience may be misleading.
In my situation, I found out a mistake that my teacher made.
I know the thing she said must be wrong.
And this incorrect point may not be realized by others in the classroom.
So I just called out and point out the mistake.
By doing this, the whole class will know this is wrong.
In another aspect, what if everyone can point out the incorrect point that teacher made.
In this way, the possibility of acquiring incorrect information could be dramatically decreased.
In addition, I think to call out and correct the mistake right away is a way to make the teacher or the meeting leaders less likely to make mistakes next time.
Consider this, during a meeting, the leader made a big mistake and no one reacts.
This mistake may happen again next time.
Even though some people might tell him/her after the meeting, the impression degree is different.
Pointing out by others is obviously more impressive.
So this mistake may be aware next time.
Admittedly, everyone will get shamed if someone points out an incorrect point he/she said in front of the public.
Most people do not want someone to say I'm wrong in front of the whole class or meeting.
However, I think if someone makes mistake.
They have to take the responsibility of that mistake he/she makes.
If no one says anything during the situation.
I think others in that situation may not know the teacher or team leader is wrong.
Even though someone tells them after that.
I think they won't mention this mistake in the future meeting or class.

All in all, I think to interrupt right away and correct that mistake is the best approach to solve this problem because it helps others aware that and it helps the teacher or meeting leader aware that.

There are some viewpoints argues that if workers are more satisfied when they have many different types of tasks to do during the workday than when they do similar tasks all day long.

Some people suggest that doing the similar mission is beneficial for working efficiency, because when we finished the same thin, we would be familar with the tasks, we can finish the tasks without thinking too much time.
For example, students practice the same kind of problems can improve their rapid and tasks's score in a short time.

Conversely, as far as i am concerned, i really believe that taking different types of tasks to do can not only improve the efficiency of working but also promote the workers' passion of working and give them a better motion.
There are some reasons.
First of all, the latest researchs show that working at the same tasks in a long time must lead to the feeling of tired.
About more than eighty percent people of the survey indicate that they could not focus on the same thing more than three hours in one day.
In addition, an experiment comparing two kinds of people, one group were required to work at the same task without stop, another were admitted to have a rest or doing other work.
The finally result indicates that on the same long time the work effects of the latter group is better than the former.

We can draw the conclusion that doing the same task in long time cannot improve the working efficiency, on the contrary, workers are more suitable and willing to work in different types during the workday.
Moreover, works would feel unhappy and dissatisfied if they were required to work the same tasks all day long.
For example, in my laboratory, the same simple tasks always have different pesons to do so no one have the intention to finish the same thing to many times in a day.
That because we feel down if no fresh thing to do, also we do not have the feeling of achievement.
Last but not the least, doing different tasks can help people obtain the ability to resolve different problem.
Tht is very important to the confidence of the workers.
What's more, more confidence can promote workers working motivation and make workers satisfy their work and themselves.
To sum up, i think working in different tasks is better for workers.

Contrary to their perspective comes my opinion that young people today do not influence the vital decisions making about the forward of societ.
Firstly, young people's decisions cannot be adopted by society.
It is acknowledged that the decisions determining the society's future are made by the government and companies.
It is because they have the authority to make compelling decisions which people would like to follow.
Besides, the professional knowledge and longer experience of dealing with serious issues makes them make correct desicions possible.
By contrast, most of young people are still attending schools, so they do not have enough work experience and social experience.

Their world values have not established, which means many of them can easily make wrong desions or be mislead by other people, thus the decisions made by young people always cannot be adopted by the society.
Secondly, few young people is willing to make decisions for the society.
To be specific, the young are busy in accomplishing their education, establishing friendships and dreaming their future career.
While many people may have the idea that it is a good way to relax oneself by waching a movie or reading a book, I find doing physical exercise can relax me better than doing the former two things.
As a college student, I have a big burden of studying, which means I have to read a lot of books and to watch a lot of teaching videos during my schooltime.
If I continue to do the samething for relaxation, I will fell it boring to watch and read again.
Besides, modern people spend more time sitting in desks inside the room and this is also needed for watching a movie or reading a book.
Lacking physical practices could bring some serious health problems,but it can be eliminated by going outside and do physical exercise instead of staying inside the house.
If we keep practice regularly, we can relax ourselves by sweeping in the field.
When I was in my last summer holiday, I started took yoga class everyday to kill time and relax myself.
After two month latter, I lost two kilograms in weight and have a better figure with more energetic.
Besides, Doing physical exercise can not only build your body, but also it can strenthen your sychology health.
I made a few friends in my yoga class and one of them become my best friend.
We often stay together to exchange the skills and opinions of yoga, and we organized a trip to do yoga at outdoors in different places including platus.
After one-year yoga exercise, I become more enthusiastic about my life and I can make myself fully concentrated on my academy project.
So physical exercise can bring one the inner peace and  relaxation both in body and mind.
However, doing physical exercise can be a tough job because it needs to be taken regularly.
But if you keep the habit of doing phsical exercise to relax yourself, you definitely will benefit from doing it.

Education is always a hot and important topic because everyone's growth is accompanied with education.
When it comes to how to educate children, some people will say parents should edify their children for everything and put the way for children.
However, from my perspective I think parents should let children learn from their own mistakes.
In this way, children can have a long time impression and they will know they have some defects so that keeping a honest attitude.
First of all, learning from their own mistakes can make a deep impression in children's lives so that they will avoid making the same mistakes forever.
If children improve themselves in this way, the experience of correcting the mistakes will have a profound effect.
For example, when I was a kid, I used to lick my fingers if I have nothing to do.
Then I was ill when I take an important examination.
I was diagnosed with chronic enteritis.
There were so many bacteria in my stomach because of my bad habit.
From then on, I never licked my fingers.
I think it is an important role for my healthy body.
I learn from my own mistake so that I can remember it in my whole life.
Besides, the children can keep a honest attitude if they know they are not prefect.
Everyone can make mistake, even the saint.
Like one of my roommates is very honest, He always note the mistake problems in a notebook and check himself everyday.
He is a very good student and friend with everyone.
Addimittedly, teaching their children directly form their examples can work, too.
I think learn from themselves can be more efficient.

In this example, Amy's situation is appeared in many other children, children need passion to do a thing instead of just the results, Futhermore, give the money to children can make them more careful to the test.

My mom came up with a idea that  can let me aviod these careless in the test time and that was giving the extra money to become a prize so that I will own a goal for getting high mark.

Finally.
parents give children money can improve their relationships.

Issues ralated to studying have never failed to attract people's attention.
When it comes to taking courses, recently a hotly debated topic has arouse among the public: whether students should take history courses even they are not major in it.
Some may indicates that every students need to know the history and take the courses.
However, as far as I am concerned, I trongly agree with that not every students should take the history class.
My point of views will be illustrated as follow.
First of all, students whose major is totally different from history need more time to focus on their own major.

To be specific, history, a kind of lierature courses as we all know, needs people spend a lot of time memorying, which means that if students want to learn it well or get a good grades, much time will be occupied.
However, some other kinds of subject such as physics or chemistry which nearly have no connection with history also need much time to trailing and exploiting.
To a great extent, such kind of experimental disciplings require more time from students.
For instance, I am major in chemistry.
One of my classmates chose history as elective course last term.
However, the period of our important experiment is also the time of history course final, which the both part need him to take great efforts on time.
As a result, he did either do well in the experiment nor the history exam.
Consequently, if students' field is not relative to history, they do not have to take history courses.
On top of that, it is useless to take the course for those students who are not interested in history.
In details, if the students are not interested in history, even they go to the class they will not concentrate on the teacher, which is a waste of time for them.
Additionally, it is better for they need to use these time to take some courses they like or do some entertainment.
All in all, juding from all above, I strongly insist that not all university students have to take history courses even they are not major in it.

But the ambitious dreams are always too far from the reality that people even do not know how to make their first step.
So the dreams remain the dreams even many years later juat because it is unrealistic to be closer to them.
For example, one of my classmates in high school always dreamed of earning one billion dollars in the future without thinking of how to achieve it.

But then the teachers talked to him that he can set simple goals such as going to a good university or finding a good job first.
And from then on, he began to work hard to be closer to his favorite university gradually.
Furthermore, because realistic goals are easier to achieve, people can gain confidence and happiness from them.
People who always set realistic goals for themselves are more likely to feel satisfication from simple achivements like getting good grades in an an exam or learning a new skill.

Parents like their child to be successful in school.
They know that doing well in school can have many future benifits for the child.
That's why they give their chidren financial award when they get good grades to spark their passion for studying.
However,from my perspective,giving money as an award is not so good.
It may have some short-term results,but ies destructive effects on the child's life are enormous.
First and foremost ,giving money as  an reward probably make kids mamminish.
Money is just a kind of reward of hard work or good grade.
Knowledge and other things you could get from school are actually more significant.
Many students of mine now are showing off their clothes,sneaker,bagsand so on but pay little attention to study.
This may be the result of giving money to child.
Secondly,a soon reward after getting a high score may make children relaxed.
Every time I get a good grade ,I want to relax myself such as playing computer games or others.
Giving money may lead to a more serious consequence.
Instead of giving money ,taking your children to travel or giving them reward like books are better choices.
Not only can they relax themselves in a healthier way ,but also be aware of the ahcievement og high score.
By and large ,giving money to a child for high grades have many negetive consequences on his life.
I agree with the statement mentioned in the question.
Someone may argue that doing physical exercise appears much better for our health than watching a movie or reading a book.
This is indeed the case.
However,the key word in the statement is 'relax',not 'fit'.
In regard to 'relax',I will reason the topic in two aspects.
The first aspect of 'relax' is to relax our body.
Obviously,watching a movie or reading a book while seated in an armchair beats perfectly doing physical exercise while straining our muscles and being exhausted.
The former hits the goal of relaxing,whereas the latter rushes to the contrary.
The second aspect,and the more abstrat one,is to relax our mind.
In this realm the former also wins the competition.

By watching a movie or reading a book,we delve into a wonderful world of stories where we hand our mind completely out to the author,and need not think harshly on ourselves (we could not have books of hieroglyphs or difficult maths descriptions to relax!).
The former method will have our sight and mind led by the ongoing process of the story without losing too much of  our brain cells.
Doing physical exercise,however,drags us into a challenge.

Even if we avoid fierce,competitive sports which George Orwell once stated as 'provoking hatred',we are faced with the battle of our mind and our sore muscles in jogging,consistent requirement of willpower in yoga,etc..
In that case,the former also performs much better in relaxing our mind than the latter.

In summary,watching a movie or reading a book is indeed a better choice instead of doing physical exercise when it comes to the key word 'relax',and in both flesh and spirit aspects I agree with the statement.
