Without doubt, Internet can provide plenty of information about almost everything.
However, now whether acessing so much information creates problems is controversial.
As for me, I think Internet indeed provide us many valuable information.
Firstly, the information Internet can provides is about varities of aspects and almost about everything, which is richer than books or newspapers or other printed things can provide.
As we know, because of the limited length, we can hardly see a book can contain much knowledge, however, this problem is easy to be settled by Internet.
If we use Internet to learn things, we can find many websites have almost everything we may be would like to know.
That's because Internet has unlimited capacity.
For example, if we want to know something about the whole history of humans, there are two methods we can choose.
The first way is to read books and other literature, which means we have to try to find as many books as we can and also only we go to mnay libraries can we find enough books we need.
Sounds we need to pay lot attention.
However, if we can choose the other way, using the Internet, we can easily get many information we want.
Secondly, using Internet means easier way to learn knowledge.
It's widely acknowledged that Internet made our lives more infficient, rapider and more convenient.
Nowadays, people don't have many free time to do what they want.
Most of us just have some break time, and because these time short and limited, it seems hard to make it useful by reading.
If we read during these time, we may even cannot find what we want when we need to go back to work or study again.
However, using Internet is a fascinating way to use these time.
By using the search engines, we can find the information we need faster.
Then we can receive those information everytime and everywhere if we want, just like when we wait for the bus.
It seems better to learn a little instead of doing nothing.
Internet indeed provide us many different information consists of valuable, practicle information or some boring and useless things.
However, it's our duty to indentify what we need and choose the best things to absorb.
Though there are so much information on the Internet that someone may feel confused and puzzled, it is not hard to learn to only learn what is beneficial.

All in all, though the Internet provides so many information may makes someone worried about it, I really believed that what we get whether valuable is up to ouselves, and most of us can get practicle information on the Internet.

Nowadays some parents offer their school-age children for each high grade they get in school.
I do not think it woukd be a good idea for the following reasons.
First and foremost, using money to stimulate child to learn might do harm to his learning habits.
As is generally acknowledged, learning is one of the elementary thing for every school-age child, and thus it is of vital importance to for a child to develop a good learning habit.

If learing is strongly connected with money, they may not be able to concentrate on learning and may focus on the monely solely, which means that the purpose of their learning may be directed to a wrong direction.
Second, money may lead to envy among the children.
For some children with poor grades and strong desire for money, it may finally result in their cheating in the exam.
And for those with good grades, they may be isolated and hated by others for the envy for the money they have.
It also increases the chance that they are bullied for money.
Last but not the least, the effect of encouragement to children may soon wear out after several times of , and the children may desire for more.
And once such desire is developed, it would be hard to wipe the influence off from a child.
It is dangerous to make a child too desirable for something that is normally used in the world of adults.

Some supporting the method may argue that money is a good encouragement to children with good grades, however we should recognize that exposing children to money too early may not be such a good thing.
Doing so might contribute develop their money persuing characteristic at a early age, which is definitely bad for their future development.
Over all, I do not think it woukd be a good idea.
Parents should think up better ways to help their children to learn better instead of simply giving money to encourage children.

He worked in a company which has low salary.
His friends can not help him because he do not know many skill.

In this day and age, with the advancement of science and thecnology, the world has greatly changed.
The inventions of Internent, smart phones and so on make our lives much more convinent, but in the meantime, they bring us many troubles.
This phenomenon has aroused a heated debate on whether our grandparents' suggestions are useful or not.
Somebady says that since they are too old to get in touch with the electronic devices, they do not know the world as much as we do, so we should not follow  their advices.
As far as I am concerned, I strongly disagree with the this kind of statement due to the following reasons.
First and foremost, grandparents have many life experiences, we can still learn from them.
Our grandparents do have experenced lots of historical moments, and they have already faced many essenal choices in their lives, it is needed for us to learn from them.
Just take my grandparents for example.
when I was still a freshman in my university, I lost my direction, did not know whether I should go abroad for further study or just find a job after my graduation.
I turned to my grandpa, who was already eighty and went to university at his time.
He told me since I was still young , I needed to broaden my horizons first.
That helped me to determined my mind.
Furthermore, grandparents are our closest relatives who know us well, they know what we really need.
Many of us were brought up by our grandparents, they spent lots of time in breeding us, we all had enjoyable memories.
They can put forward the suggestions which we really want.
One of my roommates  once broke up with his girlfriend and fell into great sorrow.
No matter how hard we tried to comfort him, it didn't work.
At last we called his grandparents since he was brought up by them.
His grandparents soon visited our dorm and told him to cheer up.
My roommate cameover  it in the end.
Admittedly, I am not denying that it will be difficult for our grandparents to catch up with this era.
However, they still have their own wisdoms we can learn from.
Their suggestions are still valuable for all of us.

Secondly, as far as I remember, we have great amount of new types of jobs so that it is more possible for us to choose an ideal one.

But luckily, as the time goes by, there is a new type of job named "math modeling engnieer"  becoming popluar.

In a nutshell, it is because of more ways to obtain the information and more new jobs nowadays that it is easier to identify a good job now.

There is a common thought that if the student can score high in exams, it means that they have a decent command of the knowledge and it can also promise them to enjoy a bright future.
As parents are aware of the importance of chidren to get a high mark in the school, they are trying a large sum of methods to stimulate their children to study harder and better.
Some parents recognize that it may be a good idea to offer children money for each high grade they get in school.
I definitely agree with it for its influential benefits: a stimulus for children to study better, and a good chance to cultivate children to save money.
As a start, although it makes the parents feel stressed for the reward costs a lot,  a reward for children can inspire them to spare no effort to study and it's worthwhile to pay the money.
When I studied in primary school, my parents always promised to give me sufficient money to buy the latest pretty doll.
Consequently it became the motivation for me to review for the exam every day before the exam.
Finally I got a good mark to rank the first in my class and I was given money to buy my favorite doll.

Secondly, rewarding children by using money can cultivate an excellent habit of saving money, as they recognize the difficulty of earning money by working hard and they will cherish the money the earned themselves.
To illustrate, if I was given the money for my great score, I often accumulate it until it was time to use.
I realized the hardship of struggling to get a nice mark so I would not waste them.
And I often made use of them to purchase some precious gift for my parents as a return for their love and care on me.
To put it in a nutshell, a reward by money is really excellent idea to motivate children to learn harder.

Getting to know a person is important in our daily life when we want to communicate smoothly with him or her.

And it is also the first step to develop friendship.
Tthere are several ways to get to know a person.
Some people prefer to judging a person according to  his appearance, while others may learn about a person from the activities that he participates in.
As for me, I think observing the books and movies that the person likes is an efficient way to understand him.
First and foremost, the person's favorite books and movies reflect his personality.
Reading books and watching movies can satisfied the emotional requirement of a person.
So the preference of books and movies show the characteristics of the person.
If a person is outgoing and humorous, he may prefer to watching comedies, for this sort of movies are relaxing and can make him feel happy.
While a serious person are likely to read books related to politics or some serious themes.
In addition, books and movies provide information of the person's hobbies.
Usually, we prefer to reading books or watching movies related to what we like to do.
For example, a person who like sports may favors movies talk about football or basketball activities, while a person who like play the instruments may like movies related to classical music.
Last but not least, according to the books and movies he likes, we can know what he is going to do.
Some books can serve as tool books because they include related information about one specific field.
People usually only read these books under special circumstances or before certain events.
For example, many books talk about travel and there are numerous images and information related to the architecture, food and customs in different countries in those books.
If a person likes reading this kind of books, it is probable that he is planning for his trip in vacation.

The topic that whether it's better to relax by watching a movie or reading a book than relax by doing physical exercise has aroused various arguments and debates.
Arguments are varid thanks to the different opinions come from diversity backgrounds.
When it comes to me, I have a tendency to support the idea that I disagree with the statement the topic shows and I consider physical exercise is better than wathcing a movie or reading to relax.
My view derives from a close examination from the perspectives over the physical and psychological health.
Firstly, doing physical exercise can improve one's physical health.

Take me as an example, when I was doing exercises after work or study, I could feel my body released and strengthen in that when working and studying, I need to sit on the chair for a long period of time.
And also, via exercising, I could also feel my fats was burning, through which I overcomed obesity at the same time.
Also, through the process of exercising, one can feel mentally relaxed.
One must concentrate on their own work or class during work time.
During this process, one's brain must be very tired and need to relax.
compared with watching a movie or reading a book, physical exercise can liberate one's mental in that exercising can drop one's pressure and totally relax.
As for watching a movie or reading, brain still needs to join in this process and cannot be totally relaxed.
Someone claims that doing physical exercise is not better than watching a movie and reading a book to relax because doing exercise can hurt their bodies.
However, their opinion can be proved pale by the following arguments.
First, doing exercise is fundamental to a person's healthy dailly life.
It's normal for one person to get injured when doing sports, but these injuries are usually not severe.
Second, nowadays people have many tools to protect their bodies such as helmets can protect heads.
One can avoid injuries once he or she have enough protections.
On balanced, I stand for the opinion that It is better to relax by doing physical exercise than by watching a movie or reading a book.
In the 20th century, technologies made our life more beautiful.
People have many different types to relax, especially the teenagers.
Like watching movie, playing computer games and reading books, these are normal things we do in our spare time.
But someone will say that it is just somethings suit to lazy guys, those are unhealthy ways to our bodies; as a healthy and powerful person, weshould do some sports and exercise to relax ourselvies.
Of course, there will be different views to the ways to relax.
someone think we can do some relax things, some one think we should do some exercise to keep fit.
But in my opinion, do some sports will be better to our life.
Some times, we will want to watch movies or do something quiet to relax.
Yes, it will make you relax well and put you in a peaceful world, make you happy and clear the tiredness.
However,you stay there and never move, it will hurt your phisical health, your weight will increase,and many diseases will come to you.
Believe me, it will make you uncomfortable in the future.
But, take exercise in your spare time is different.
First, it can make you have a more powerful body, your shape will be more perfect, then your can attack more eyes from others, even in the interview, you can get a higher grades from the boss.
Second, after doing sports, you will feel confortable, even a little tired, it will just make you sleep better, them you wil full of energy tomorrow.
Third, the sports are your interest,you can make more friends by this, you have more topics to talk to others.
And I believe that the interests like football, running, swimming and biking will be better than watch movie or play computer games.
So, according that, I think take some exercise to relax will better than watching a movie or reading a book.
Take exercise can benefit us many facses.

Nowadays,many parents offer their chidren money for high marks in exams.
In my opinion,it has both advantages and disadvantages.
For the positive effects,chidren can be more exited and be more interested in studying.
What's more,they can use these money to buy something they need such as some classic books and school things for their study.
Also,they can put away the money and use them when they grow up.
For example,they may use them to travel around the world in college with friends or they can contribute to the poor people.
In these ways i mention about,they can experience a lot and learn a lot.
However,chidren may use the money in a inproper way like buying a lage amount of sacks,or even worse,they may buy wine and cigrettes.
In these ways they may keep some bad habits,which can bring chidren a lot of damages.
What's worse,they may have a idea that they can depend on their parents forever and they don't have to study hard,then get into a good university,then get a high-paid job and have their own life.
Also,chidren may get an idea that they are studying for money and working for money,they are not studying hard for themselves!
In this way,they may get bored in studying and only dream for money.
As aresult,they don't have their beliefe anymore.
If parents don't give them money from time to time,they may get mad at their parents and have a fight with them.
How terrible it may be.
For those reasons i give,we can have a conclusion that it is better not to give chidren money when getting high marks.
If parents must do this,i sugget parents keep the money for chidren and give chidren when growing up.

I agree with the opinion that the youth depended too much on their parents to make decisions for them before and today they can make decisions about themsevles better.

First, we all know that in the past, since the information are not accesssed so easily as today,adults have much more knowleage and experience than the youth which leads them to make decisions for the youth more often.
If you did not know about how far away from you and your destination, how could you choose the tranportation form exactly?
BUT your parents have more knowleage and experience and they might went to your destination before and they could lift very good plan on how to get there.
That's why teenagers have to search for their parents' helps in the past.
However, as time passed, the world changed.
We could easily get worldwide information on the intelnet and people's sharing on electronic media such as APP and website.
Nowadays, lots of young people have mumch more abroad eyesight than their parents since they are much more good at mastering new technique like electronic machines, which offers enormous information.
With these, the youth have enough resources to make their own decisions.
Furthermore, as the advancement of education system, teenagers are better educated which provide good supports for them to adapt their aptitude.
For example, usually the parents would decide what kind of work the children need to do after they grow up a hundred years ago.
If they decide to send their chidren into the painting studio, their childs would be expected to be a painter.
That's how Davenci became a painter.
But nowadays, since children are easily to access lots of information, they know themselves better and have their own interests very early.
There are parents who reaward their children for high scores on their school work.
In my opinion, it may not be a good idea to use money as the tool of awarding.
It is crucial to give encouragement once children have made progress in their class, which will act as incentives for children to keep making effort in learning.
But the implement of money may foster an impression on children that they are working hard only for financial remuneration.
Gradually, they may develop an abnormal life value that life is all about money but not other purposes such as love, harmonious family relationships, friends and so on.
I see this happened on my sister's 4-year-old child.

My sister thought it would be beneficial for child to try to manage their own money from a young age, so she awarded her daughter directly with money each time the little girl got praise from the teacher in kindergarten.
At the beginning my niece behaved just as well.

But there was once my sister asked her to leave the TV and play games with her friends who came to visit her, she said like this, "I'd like 5 yuan as a compensation to my time spent on playing with her, or I'd rather watching TV."
It was so shocking to my sister that such a little girl could neglected her own friends so much just for money!
So I think it is not appropriate to use financial compensation as reward in terms of children, especially youngsters who are unable to determine what is important in their life.
Besides, giving children economical reward may also stimulate ill-natured comparison.
Children may show off their reward to others, which may lead to psychological unbalance.
Once children find out their peers get more money than they do for the same amount of progress, they may tend to ask their parents for more, which could exceed the parents affordability.
If the parents could not meet their demands, it may develop self-abasement in children for their family is not as rich as others'.
Gradually, this may lead children to develop characteristic pf low self-esteem, and this would be profoundly harmful to children in their mental-health development.
To summerise, I do not support the idea of adopting money as reward to children's scholar improvement since it may have bad consequences such as negative life values and low self-esteem.
Other approaches, such as more time spending with children, desirable presents, or simply taking children to museums or other amusement palces pleasuable to children are my recommendations.

Nowadays, many parents want their kids to get a good grades in the test  and they always do some methods to make it, some of them offer their kids money as a gift  for every high grade they gain in school.
In my opinion, I am convinced that it  can inspire their school-age children to make progress in each test.
However, parents can take this action as long as they   master properly.
It will be a good idea.
To begin with, school-age children can be more motivated in this way that their parents give money to them to reward them.
With this strong expectation appearing in their own minds, they will produce one motivated behavior to boost themselves to do better in theri study.
For instance, once I became less interested in English, and at that time I always got  bad grades in English tests.

In that case, my parents thought one fresh idea that can let me pick up the interest of this project is offering money as long as I get high mark in English test, which made me so excited that I could not wait to show my real ability about learning English.
From then on, I began to read English every morning and I just felt like every day I had countless power that could not use up forever.
Day by day, I got the highest English mark in my class, and there is no deying that I also gained money  first in such a  cool way.
In addition, I figure that this way can improve the relationship between parents and their own kids.
As you know, it is the time that children are easily quarrel with their parents because of many little things.
However, in this way, parents can get more chances to commmunicate with children through  rewarding money.
In conclusion, not only do children in school make progress, but also they can get on better with their parents at home.

Today,how to make students achieve good grades arises peoples' thinking.
In that condition, some parents try to use the way of awarding to motivate their children.
From my perspective,awarding children's high grades with money is not a good ideas.
First,money can mislead children.
Study is a thing that we should continue with or without award.
Giving good students money may leave them an impression that study is a hard thing that should be repaid materially.
They may ignore the good mental effect brought by study.
Taking math studying as an example,without considering money students may try to find the beauty of math to gain happiness.
Study itself can help them find the true meaning of study.
While worrying about the money ,they may not enjoy the process and try to solve plenty of math questions to make sure their good grades.
In the end, they may get their money but they begin to take math as a thing that is hard to learn and is needed to be rewared.
Second,money given to children is hrad to controlled.
Students may begin to have bad habits with those money which may be harmful for their future.
For example,if a student use the money to buy a PSP and play all days.
It will cause him to ruin his future.
Students are young and they don't have the ability to make judgement themselves so giving them money is a risky thing .
There are a lot of things that is better than money to give to children .
For example ,you may send children books that contains the subjects they are most interested in.
Now days, more and more teachers like to show their own political views to their students.
Some people think that is a good way to let students learn some socializing skill, but some people believe that will have some bad influence on studences.
In my opinion, it dependent on the stituation.
On the one hand,  teachers should not express their own social or political views to students, because that will mislead the students.
In the students' age, they are building their own view and independent thinking about world.
In this period, they are very easy to be influenced.
For example, if the teacher is the a racist, he does not like any people with different color.
When he express his racism opinion to his students, students probably will be infect by this idea and also discriminate other races.
Even though they know nothing about other races.
Oppositely, if the teacher never shows his cocial views to other race people, the most of students will not be infludenced by the racial theory.
Students have not finish buliding their own independent thinking, so they can not tell what is right, what is wrong.
Teacher has authority in the class, thus students will be influenced easily by their teacher.
Therefore, if the teacher has some aggressive social or political view, they should not share his views to his students.
On the other hand, teahcers should teach some life lessons to his students according to his own social view.
Students have not build their own moral concept properly, so they need their teacher to lead them into a correct road.
For instance, if a boy steal a needle form the store, and his teacher know this thing.
The teacher should tell the boy, stealing is not fit moral and law, which is according to teacher's own social view.

As we know, young children does not have their own ability of jugement, so the teacher should use their own social views to correct the students' unethical  concept, which is in order to help the students to become useful to the society.
In conclusion, personally speaking ,I think sometime teacher should show their own social or political views to the students, but sometime they shouldn not.
It is depending on the situations.

In the first place, some team members have abilities leader does not have; therefore, it is necessary for leaders to appraise advice of the team members.
For example, my father who is major in finance work in a computer company and his boss is major in computer science.

When company face some difficulty on analysing market and decide invistment direction, my father's leader must absorb his opinion and advice and he may make huge lost without the help from my father  because he has not any relative knowledge in economy.
This way, it is necessary for leaders to listen some professional advice in order to make some professinal decision, which will help them solve lots of problems.
Secondly,democrace is highly most important in a company, which will cemete all people.

For instance, when I work in an advertisement company, my boss never listhen to others' opinion and always persist do what he favor, which not only cause huge cost in company but also make lots of good employees can not find their value in work.
In this way, lots of employees who embrace mastery on advertisement work in other more democrate and fair company in order to make a splite.
Therefore, if  leaders is willing to make their company better, it is important to keep their talent employees in company.
Listening and applicating to their advice are good means to achieve this goal.
Finally, listening to the advice of the eam members can improve the personal ability of leaders.
For example,In the past I was a shy boy who had no breave to talk with others.
However, when I studied in university and managed basketball club, one of my followor suggested me that I should to communicate frequently with my team members and this will let me know others well.
I happilly accepted this advice and I always did this in my later leader job.
This ability not only help me to set up a good relationship with all of my members, but also communicate will with all people surrounding.
In this way, I never have trouble to make friends with others.
As a saying goes" different strokes for different folks".
Some teenagers may consider their parents involve in their education too much, even overweigh the parents in the past.
And I totally endorse with those people's standpoint.
And I have several reasons to back up my opinion.
First, people in the past thought highly of food rather than education.
Since most family required more labors to make money rather than consume money, they prefered to let their kids to work rather than study.
Take my father as an example.
He was born in an underpriviledged family.
He needed to help his father cultivated or water those crops every day, so he had no time to go to school.
Moreover, his family rejected himself to accept formal accademic education because they had no extra money to pay for his tuition fee and books.
So my father could study only by borrow his neighbours' books.
However, parents nowadays stick to allow their kids to learn piano, have dancing class since they do not want them to left behind by other peers.

And most of people nowadays have high education level since the live improves a lot and more people can go to school.

Granted, children in the past were more likely to obey their parents so parents can be more easily to involve their education.
However, most family prefer to allow their kids to take up a job rather than receive education since most family did not have the ability to afford it.

At present, a controversial topice has  aroused a heated debete among students: are workers more satisfied when they have many different kinds of tasks to do duting the working hours than whe they do similai jobs all the time.
Answers vary from one to another.
Some people clains that repeating the same tasks will be conducive to the workers.
However, contrary to their views comes my own perspective that workers will be more pleased when they do different types of the jobs.
My viewpoint is based on the following points.
First, doing different types of tasks can increase workers' work efficiency, which is relation to their satisfaction.
To be more specific, the worker won't get bored easily if they are assigned to various kind s of jobs.
For their attention is highly focused on the tasks, their work efficieny will be raised unconsciously.
And then chances are that there is some exta time left after finishing all the jobs and workers will feel a sense of achievement and satisfaction.

However, if they repeat doing the same thing for constantly 8 hours, they will distract attention from the task and then cannot finish the assignment on time, resulting that the boss might be unpleasant to their work performence and then they will also get upset.
For example, I once washed the dishes as my part-time job in a restaurant in summer vacation.
I just repeated the same action all the time and then I felt distracted and suddenly I broke up nearly all the dishes.
As a result, I was required to use my salary to make up for the dishes.
If I worked as a cook, it would be totally different for I need to make different kinds of dishes and I wouldn't be  distractedï¼
Second, handling various types of jobs can also perfect their working ability, which will make employees more satisfied .

Specifically, dealing with different types of work requires people to have the ability of multi-task, which means they need to handle a lot of tasks at the same time and possess the ability to tackle tha changes which might happen anytime.

In the way, the working ability will be improved and people will finally make progress in their work performence, However, if people do similar tasks all day long, they are more likely to be accustomed to this comfortable atmospehere and won't do  any positive changes in their work.
So how could they make improvement in their working ability?
Take my uncle as an example .
He works in a big Internet company.
Everyday he needs to deal with different  kinds of the tasks such as fixing the bugs, make some optimization and compile some computer programs to meet differnet requirement of his employers.
Under this circumstance, he is more and more skillful in his field and his excellent working ability makes him stand out and my uncle finally gets promotion.

In conclusion, the workers will more satisfied when they deal with differen types of work durin the workday for it could not only elevate their working efficiency but also perfecr their work ability, which will be helpful for their career development.
In this way, they will more pleased and satisfied about their work performance.
Since it is highly expected that students can get perfect marks in their examination, parents have tried many strategies to encourage their children to be engaged in their studies.
As you can imagine, a vast number of parents give money to their children as a reward for their dilligence because children seems to have many options to make use of money received.
Actually, I think it is kind of ridiculous to form a close connection between schoolwork and money.
It will eventuallyaffect children's in the future in the following aspects.
First off, we are supposed to claim clearly that students don't study for money, just like adults never lead their lives aiming at earning more money.
Money can benefit us in a variety of ways, so can it destroy us.
If children form a firm opinion that money is the most valuable substance they can't gain from success, they will not plan their future careers which they find exciting and enjoyable.
During the period of war, many soldiers gained wealth and social status because of their distinguished accomplishment.
When they rewarded their kids, they often gave them money just as what government did to them.
When their children grew up, they became to form the poin t of view that everything they did was for money.
They didn't care about what job they got, since they could got money, but they were not happy towards their lifesyle.
They eventually got dipressed and became absorbed to alcohol.
Furthermore, students can't manage money in a proper way when they are at their formative year.
The reward of their parents which contained some much money will lead to the abusive use of money, which is an unavoidable trend.
My friend always use money to buy video games and comic books, which affects his study significantly.
This is not his fault, but his parents' mistake that makes him a "bad boy".
In conclusion, we should prevent offering money as a reward for children's high grades, considering the effects it leads to their future career and their habit.
With the development of the world, almost all the families have a better living standard then before.
So in some families, when their school-age students get a high grade in scool, these parents will offer their children money.
Some people don't think that is a good way to encourage their kids, but in my opinion, I think that is a good way to let their childern become more better.
Firstly, their children can use these money to buy something they wants.
that is better for kids buy things themselives than their parents bought them directly.
I still remember when I was a primary school students, I wanted a  beautiful pen very much.
I told to my parents and wanted them buy it to me, but they refused.
They told me that if I can get a high grade in the next math exam, they will offer me some monwy and I can control the money myself.
So I used my best effot to overcome my weakness and learned math, I wake up one hour early at morning to do that complex math queations.
After a long period of time, My grade improve a lot.
I will always remember the pretty pen  I bought with my own effort, that's more meaningful than my parents bought me directly.
So in this case, I think it is a good way to offer children money as a prise.
Secondly, if we have money when we have a high scores, we will have more motive power to have a good grade.
Otherwise we may get tired about the bored study.

I still remember I have a teacher who have a high educational attainments,she told us that when she was a little girl, she was not willing to hardworking, but her parents always use different method to encouraged her, like money.
Then she gradually observed that study is a interesting thing, and finally she became very successful in her grades.
So in this story,  I think that is a good method to encoursge their children to have  a high scores.

Admittedly, some people may think these money will let their children become more and more vulgar, that is acctually a problem, but if we use optimal ways to give kids money like a small number one time, it will solve this problem.
All in all,  if sll the people use money and have a optimal way to let their children love in study, that will let our children become more greater and boost their potential power.
In such a rapidly developing society, people attach more and more attention to their children's education.
Now they care about the children's grade very much.
Some parents offer their children money for each high gread or mark they get in school.
Others think this method is not proper.
If i were a parent who has a school-age children, I would not take this method.
Here are my reasons.
Firstly, children may cheat in tests in order to obtain more money from their parents.
As we all know, honesty overweigh high grades.
However, for children who are too young to understand moral pricipals deeply, the temptation of money may lead then to cheat.
One of my cousins used to ask his parents for money when he get good greads in school.
At the begining, he left no effort to do the best.
However, he got tired over a period.
Wanting to please his parents and get the money, he cheat in tests.
In my opinion, offering money for high grade may lead bad behaviors like this.
Secondly, when children grow up, they will lose the motivation of getting high grade in furder study.
Because there is no more money offered by their parents or other people, the grown children may be unconfortable and lose their goal.
These are the reasons that I don't think the method is a good idea for children's development.

Second, the career teachers work on is one of the most great in this world.
It's universally acknowledged that the teachers  play a role of passing the most precious treasure, the knowledge, between generations.
This career make the human civilazation continue from the ancient days to today.

A well-paid salary will encourage teachers to make this career more and more flourishing.

When it comes to the issue whether it's a good idea that some parents offer their school-age children money for each high grade or mark they get in school,I should say that I can't agree more with the practice.
The reasons are as following.
Firstly, rewards for high grade can undoubtedly provide encouragement and inspirtion for children to go all out in order to acquire better accomplishment.
Take myself for example.
Once, my father promised that as long as I can reach the top of my class, he would give me a luckypaper, which excited me to great degree.
I reached the paek of my study with the passion I acquired from my father's promise.
Consequencely, we can safely draw the conclusion that proper money reward can promote children's motivation.
Second, material rewards can further children's study.
With the money they acquire they are provided the right to choose their own mathod of studying, which expanding their range of flexible chioce.
They are able to adjust their way to study according to their own personalities and characters.

Last but not least, children ubderstand the ture meaning of laber and harvest through their strive for rewards, which hence can make them not only cherish their life today, but also appreciate their parents' hard work.
The plersure children acquire from the exchange offers them the concept of fair trade, contributing to their willingness to try new things.
Above all, we reach the point that the proper rewards are of really great benefit.
Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among people:whether teacher should have the same salary as doctors, lawyers or business leader.
Opinions vary from people to people.
Some claim that there is no reason that teacher should have so much wage.
As for me, I wholeheartedly agree that teachers are supposed to be paid with the same salary as doctors'.
My points can be elaborated as followed.
First of all, teachers are so hard that they should accept the equivalent  salary.
As we all know, teaching profession means tranport the knowledge from the textbooks to the minds of children who are always too naive to understand what teachers talk in the class.

Because students' cognitive ablities cannot support them to really absorb the knowledge or observe the rules in the school, teachers often need to teach them the same knowledge by different ways or repeat to tell the students why they need to be quiet in the class, which is really boring and suffering for everyone.
For example, when I was ten years old, I have a English teacher named Jane.
I did really poor in the learing of English grammer, so Jane always allowed me to come to her office after school, and gave me extra lessons about grammer.
However, the difference between subject and verb always confused me, and Jane spent about two hours helping me slove such a easy problem.
In addition, much money can motivate teather to have a better condition to teacher students.
As we all know, we would be very happy if we have much more money than before.
So when the salary of teachers increase, teachers would be more energetic to face this job.
On the contrary, if teachers have little moeny to support their life, who can have the confidence to take their job or their students seriously.
For example, my cousin Jack is a Maths teacher, he used to felt hopeless about his job because his salary cannot afford his expense of life.
However, after the school increase his salary, he feel confident about thi, and the students' grades also higer than before/
To be include, teachers should have the same salary as high as doctors' salary.

Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among people: which is more essential, success or keep happy and optimistic when we fail?
Opinions vary from person to person.
Some people claim that the success is more vital.
However, I would stand on their opposite side and I believe that it is more significant to stay optimistic and happy when we fail.
My viewpoints can be elaborated as follows.
Firstly, keeping happy and optimistic when we fail can shape our personality.
Only if we face to the failure bravely, can we recognize our shortcomings and recover them.
The happier we remain when we fail, the stronger we could become.
Success is much easier than staying an optimistic attitude when we fail.
Everyone has both of their success and failure, thus standing up after we fall down is more great than success.
For example, my sister was a clever girl and she often got first prize in her class.
All of my family were proud of her and decided to send her to The Second Middle School which was the best middle school in Wuhan.
However, she failed in her first exam in The Second Middle School and she losed her heart and cried.
She was so upset that she cannot concentrate on class, and she went back to her previous school eventually.
Secondly, staying happy and optimistic when we fail can cultivate a mind that never give up.
Many people would feel happy when they succeed, and not everyone can stay happy when we fail.
Optimistic attitude means that we should not be afraid of failure.
We would try again and never give up.
Once we are not afraid of failure, we would become closer to the success and we would not fear anything.
For example, I started to play the piano when I was six years old and I felt very bored when I practiced it.
I never give up it and encourage myself to become optimistic even If I fail in the piano contests.
However, I was admitted to the Wuhan Controversary Of Music three years ago.
All in all, I firmly think it is more important to stay optimistic and happ when we fail.
It not only can shape our personality bu also can cultivate a mind that never give up.
I don't think that its a good idea for parents to offer their school-age children money for each grade they get in school.
I have four reasons for this.
First, offering them money for high grade can confuse them that why do they work hard.
Parents' taking money as a prize for good grade is telling children that you are working for us rather than yourself.
Gradually, they'll be used to this kind of mode and form a strong idea that they are forced to work hard rathwer than work for themselves.
Second, this behavior is unbenificial to children's personality.
A child who always recieves money as a prize for good grade will value money too much and regards money as a precious thing.
They may lbe used to using money to solve every difficulty they ecounter and using money to thank for other people's help.
Third, using money as a prize for children who get high grade may create great burden for parents.
As children grow older, their demand for thier prize can grow.
Fourth, this can also do harm to the relatiomnship between parents and children, for they don't know how to praise and love each other except giving and recieving money.
My parents always use praisement to celebrate my high grade and comfort me with thier own stories when I get not so good grade, which makes me grow up in love and happines.
This also tells me that it all depends on me whether I should work hard or not, which means that I need to be responsible to myself.
Growing up in such a enviroment, I know how to be responsible to my life and how to use love to come along with my friends.
Therefore, I disagree to offer school-age children money for each high grade they get in school, which is harmful to their study career, personality and family relationship.

Nowadays many famous people would like to express thier feelings and opinions on some essential occasion, like Emma Watson giving a speech for UN to support femalism publicly, or Leonado Dicupprio shooting a documentary to call for people to care about our planet.
However, there seems to be statement on whether these words of celebraties have more influence on younger people than older people.
Well, in my opinion, I agree with this statement.
First of all, young people are inclined to embrace things more quickly.
They are young, so is thier mind.

Young people are not so mature that already have thier comprehensive sense of  the world, like the old people, which leaves them more space to absorb information and knowledge, and more space to understand a new type of theory.
In contrast, old people are arguabley stubborn in this regard.
Secondly, young people are more exposed to TVs, Internet and other modern medias that can make them have more connections with these celebraties and hear what they say.
By contrast, old people doesn't care the tabloids too much, they may focus more on their daily lives and how to stay healthy.
Those entertainment events does not be of their interests too much.
Last but not the least, the celebrity effects also cause young people to be influnced more easily.
For example, If you are a diehard follower of a singer or an actor, you will completely trust him and embrace all the things he has said on some public occasion.
On the contrary , it would be rare to find many followers among old people, as they are mature enough to konw what kinds of things are meaningful.
The older are a man, the more sensible he is.
This trend will become increasingly clear with the increasing of ages.
In conclusion, of course I'm not saying that the celebrities doesn't affect old people at all, but I do agrree thatthe influce it had on old people are smaller indeed.

Recently, the question regards whether grandparents can give the grandchildren useful advice because the world has changed largely has provoked attention from many people.
Some people claims that grandparents cannot give their grandchildren useful advice mainly because the world of today are too different from the world of fifity years ago.
While others disagree with the idea by stating that even though the world has changed but we can still learned a lot from our grandparents.
Personally, i support the idea that the grandparents can provide useful advice for their grandchild in modern times.
First of all, some advice is just useful no matter what age you are in.
For me, i was raised by my grandparents from the age of four to eight.
My grandfather always encourage me by telling me that i am the best forever in his mind.
This encouragement is quite dominent in my later success on my study.
I feel confident all the time which allows me to achieve the best of myself.
These kind of methods are still working in modern times, while many child just don't feel confident of themselves nowadays.
Secondly, grandparents are progressing with the world beyond our imagination which allows them to give advice even useful.
When you take the subway or bus, you can easily observe that the elder people around you is diiferent from what you have imagined.
They are using cell phones and pads like the most young people do.
They are also talking about the most heating news on the Internet.
That's the reason why we cannot underestimate our grandparents of their ability to catch up with the generation.
From what we have mentioned above, we may come to the conclution that grandparents can also give usful advice to their grandchilds in spite of the changing of the world.
That also means we have to listen to our grandparents patiently instead of ignoring them.
They will get healthier and happier with your accompany.

In this generation, the students grow up in a completely diffrent enviroment differing from their parents.
And how to reward their children is a really hard nut for parents to figure out.
Hence, there is a interesting debate on the floor, whether partents use money to reward their children when they get good grades in school.
From my perspective, I strongly support this idea.
First and formost, it can encourge students to study hard.
Every one loves money, no one is exception.
Even the young children know the neccesity of the money which can let them be able to do something like playing advanced comupter games, buying equipments they eager for a long time.
These tempations are not easy to resist.
And now, there is a method which can help them reach their dream objetcs easily --- getting a high-level grade.
For students, their duty is to study hard for the higher scores and these kinds of rewards give them motivation to work hard terribly to gain both the grades and the rewards which meet their need.
Once they become aware of the benefits of it, they will be situmulated to fight for the next exams.
Go round and roung, this will become a perfect cycle for the students.
From my own experience, since I was in primary school, my parents were ordered me some money wheneve I got higher ranking in my class and my grade.
I could be able to buy some comics that I loved most at that time and was excited when I stood in front of the counter of the bookstore.
In that case, being attacted by the monthly journal, I workd hard in every mothly examinations to get money from my partents buying the comics I wanted.
Moreover, this way of rewarding releases the burden of parents.
Nowardays parents have no time to think deeply how they praise their children when the do a good job in their study.
They even have no time to get known their children in depth.
They don't exactly know what their children really want.
In addition, owing to the generation gap, there is something just familiar with the school-age children which their parents will be disordered.
As a result, if parents buy something just they think good for their children, it may lead to a bad consequence, creating a family confilict in some extent.
Therefore, giving money to their children is really covenient choice for their parents.
To illustrate, my cousin loves Taylor Swift very much, but my uncle just knows that his son loves overseas music.
So he buys his son an album from Avril, and then they have a fight between the two stars.
After this unhappy experince, my uncle decides to give money to his son directly letting him choose whatever he wants.
Admittedly, it may creates a utilitarian mind in the scool-age children which is bad for them.
However, partents have the ability to control the amouts of money that they give to their children, which will not form a unhealthy thought if the parents have the awareness.
On the other hand, children will still walk into the society.
It can help them know how to manage their money since they are in childhood.
Overall, both for children and parents, offering money directly is a good choice.

Currently, a controversal topic has aroused intense debate among the public: whether people need to get along well with new people or stay in friends with a small group of people in order to be happier.
Opinions vary from person to person.
Some people argue that keeping making new friends make them feel happier.
On contrary, I think maintaining friendship with a small group of people brings me more happiness.
First of all, the friendship will become more precious and brings more happiness, if we keep maintaining it.
The ones who keep making friends usually have so many friends that it is impossible for them to remain friends for a long time.
However, if we focus on maintaining our friendships and spend more time on a small group of people, it is not strange to remain friends for the whold life.
For example, my grandfather met his best friends 60 years ago.
When my grandfather gets together with his old friend, they laugh a lot and forget all the disappointments, as if they are as young as 60 years ago.
None of the other friends can bring such happiness to my grandfather.
In addition, the friendship will be fasten and will not break up easily, if you keep maintaining it.
Many people make friends easily because of their apperance or status.
However, if they don't maintain the friendship, once the emergency occurs, all his friends will forget them.
They actually don't have any true friends.
On contray, if you spend more time with friends and keep maintain the friendship, they will never leave you behind and be willing to help you overcome the difficulties.
A case in point is that the stars are always welcomed in everywhere, and everyone wants to become their friends.
However, if a scandal about the star emerges, everyone will start to heat him and forget him
Recently, tons of people suggest the utility of group work and the significance of the ability to work with teammates.
With this tendency, many teachers choose to assign projects that ask students to work together instead of working on their own independently.

Some people believe that asking students to work together is a brilliant idea because students can help each other, but personally, I think students should do the projects by themselves to become an independent learner rather than seeking others' help, and in this way, they could learn more effectively.
To begin with, students work on the projects together cannot make all the students focus on what they are really interested more.
In a group project, to make every member of the project feels comfortable with what they are doing, the topic should satisfy everybody in the group.
In the case, some topics that single student in the group that is really curious would be abandoned because the project is for the whole group but not the single person.
Therefore, somebody in the group might lose his or her opportunity to learn what he or she really likes and be forced to finish a topic that is hardly interested in.

For example, I was in a chemistry project with 2 other students, they would like to an experiment about burning sugars but I want to know the phenomenon when I burn different metals, plus, I am pretty clear what will happen to burn sugars.
In this experiment.
I didn't learn anything new at all but wasted tons of time to try something I already knew about.
Therefore, working together isn't a great idea in terms of everyone's learning effectiveness.
Secondly, students who work alone on the projects can learn in their method that is effective for them.
In the projects, massive of research works are needed, but everybody has different study habits that are way different to each other.
Some like to make notes on different material but others like to make a mark on the website.
With all sorts of study habits, it is extremely hard to put all the works together and therefore waste plenty of time

Nowadays, the sociaty is full of compatitiveness.

I think it is not a good idea for parents to offer money for children.
First,the children are too young to spend the money effectively,they may buy something useless and they just waste thier money.
Some kids may just buy snacks and toys.
And second,that may make them to be snobbish,and they just learn for thier parents and the parents'money.
We should let our children to know that they ought to learn for their own selves.
And the grades are not the only standard to measure if a kid is good or bad,the award may let them just aim to thier grades,and forget to improve thier other skills.
As parents,I think we can praise them when they get good mark at school,or buy some gifts for them.
When I was a student in primary school,my mother usually made novels as present for me when I got high marks in school,that made me very happy and didn't waste any money.
And she also took me to travels,that boraden my horizon.
In morden China,giving someone money for present is thought to be a vulgar action.
The parents and children are the same,if you always use money for present,that may lose all the meaning.
When the children grow up,she or he may be a person in poor taste.

So if you have children,when they do someting excellent at school,just give them oral praise,or you can give them presents,you can buy the things that they like,or take them for a meal,believe me,that may make them surprised,compared to give money to them.
The connection between the parents and the children is based on this,if you just give moneyfor gifts to encourage them,stop do that.
Hope you can have a better connectiong with your children in the future.
The method to educate students is always an issue that many teachers will think about.
In that case, whether students should work together for a project or they should work alone is of great importance to discuss.
In my opinion, I think when students work for one project together, they can learn more effectively.
The first reason is students can learn from each other in a group.
The purpose of a project is not only to let us show how excellent we have studied, but also to let us learn something.
For instance, when I have a problem about a math project, I can talk to my group members.
Everyone may have different ideas about the math problem and we can discuss it, then we can provide different solutions to solve that problem.
I learnt a lot through my group members.
Also the students who have no idea or only have one solution to that problem can learn from others.
A group can have discussion, while  one student alone cannot have diverse ideas and is lack of the chance to know better ideas, so he or she will learn less.
Second, students can learn other things like how to cooperate with each other by doing a project together, and this characteristic can help us learn more effectively in the future.
Cooperation is of great significance in the society and it is very necessary to learn it.
Take myself as an example, I had a project which need to construct a physics model in my junior middle school.
There are two solutions.
I can choose to do it alone or to do it with my classmates.
I choose to do it in a group and I make a division of the things all we need to do like searching for datas or to considerate what materials we need.
After we have done all of this, we will talk to each other about how we finished our part, so that we can do other parts next time and to learn Through that way,

Recently, there is a heated discussion about television advertising for kid who aged two to five.
Some people believe that television advertising should be allowed, because is not a big ideal for them to watch some advetising.
Howevr, others hold a dissimilar viewpoint that it should not be allowed.
As for me, I agree with the latter one.
My reasons and examples are listed as follows.
One reason why I am in favor of my perspective is that children will waste their money on those advertising.
This is becasue they just want to buy the things they want, not the things they need.
A good example of this is my little brother he is four years ago.
When he watched avertising about toys, he wants to buy these all.
My grandparents loved him, therefore, everytime he asked for the toys on the tv, they will find a way to buy them.
After a few years, his room is full of toys, but he still wants more.
As the exampl sugguest, allowed children to watch advertising are wasting money.
Another relevant reason used to supporting opinion that allowed children to watched television adevetising may lead them in danger.
This is due to the fact that when they watched something cool, they are like to imitated.
A typical illustraction of this can be seen in my brother's classmates.
He has the same age with my brother.
Once he watched a cool advertising on the tv, is about a boy climbing a tree.
Then that boy told my brother he will try this after school.
Finally, he climb the biggest tree in the garden, but he broken his legs.
Now he still in the hospital.
The example indicates that children need far away from advertising, especially not to imitation the dangrous part.
I think it is okay for parents to offer school-age children money for each high mark they get in school.
The first reason is that as teenagers, we have lots of things to do every day and somtimes we can't focus on our studying.
We would like to play outside or we just want to hold as many parties as possible.
Therefore, offering money to school-age children is a good idea to make children enthusiatic about learning and getting good grade.
The second reason is that offering children money if they get goods grades can make children aware of the difficulty to make money.
Making money is not just what only parents should care about.
Children should gradually learn how to make money and use money, too.
In recent days, we can easily pay for the bills using smartphones and we do not use paper money as much as before.
This great change makes the big problem that we don't have the exact feeling about how much we have spent.
We tend to spend more money nowadays.
Getting good grads is not very simple.
Once children notice the difficulty to get money, they will not buy what they want wihout deep thoughts.
The third reason is that offering children money if they get good grades can make children notice the importance of studying.
Parents should make their children to form the habit of studying for the whole life.
This world changes very quickly and we have no idea if we will be abandoned by the society someday.
We should study as hard as possible to get better education and get high social status.
Offering money to the children can let them face the dark side of the society.
Overall, I agree with the idea to offer children money for each mark they get in school for the 3 reasons above.
Therefore, parents should let their children experience different sides of the society.
This world is not as wonderful as the textbooks taught.
This way to offer money is very creative and parents should use this way to teach their children.
Studying in university is a precious chance for students to get accustomed to their future career.
Additionally, different people have divided opinions about how to improve the quality of education in universities.
Some people claim that the best way is to increase professors' salsries.
However, as far as I am concerned, there are several more reasonable measures.
First and foremost, universities should invest more on the schools' facilities.
That is because advanced facilities can give students a better experience of learing and living, which deserves universities' investment.
I have a case to aptly illustrate my point.
I am a postgruade, and sometimes I have to surf the internet to search for the latest papers in my field.
Formerly, the computers in my laboratory were in bad condition, which indeed lowered my work efficiency.
However, this semester, school renovated the old computers.
Thus, I can deal with my tasks more quickly with the help those new computers.
Moreover, universities are supposed to provide more financial aid for those students who are in need.
Today, students form neady cannot afford some useful study utensils, which is adverse to their learning.
Additonally, this problem is able to be solved throuth schools' financial support.
My own experience can be a salient example.
One of my roomates Jack was even  incapaple of possessing his own laptops due to his limited financial ability, bringing him lots of unconveniece.
However, two months ago, he used the loan provided by our school to buy a new computer.
Thus, he can use the computer to not only to get the access to lots of useful education resources.
Whether or not teachers should make their social or political views known to students in the classroom is an debated topic.
While some people may feel that students will pay more atteniton to society and politics if teachers share their political or social views in class, I do not believe that this is the case.

By contrary, I think that we should prevent teachers sharing their views on politics and sociey in front of students because it will take up the time originally meant for imparting knowledge as well as shape students' value system in the long run.
With the burst of population, students nowdays are faced with fiercer competition than ever before because they can never be excellent enough to be outstanding among people around them.

As a result, they are burdened with enormous education pressure such as they have more home assignment to do, they should get excellent grades and they are obliged to outstand in various academic competitions.
All of these demand a reasonable use of time during class.

Therefore, teachers ought to make good use of every single minute in the class to equip their students with better education performance that promises a bright future instead of sharing social or political views irrelavent to the topic of class.
On top of that, the students are not mature enough to tell right from wrong accoding to their own value system.
If their subject views on social and political events are shared with their students, the students may be apt to accept the teachers' views even if the views are pessimistic and harmful.
With time going by, their whole value system will be shaped accordingly.
As is reported by the media, some abnormal teachers rape their students because they think students should serve teachers.
So if this idea is frequently shared in the class, the students will regard it their duty to 'serve' the teachers by sex instead of calling for help when harmed and in turn their life will be ruined.

And most parents may offer their students money for each high mark in school .

Finally , I really got a higher mark in the school final exams .
My father offered me enough money to let me buy what I want to buy .
What is more , I found that I was interested in math and not hate this subject any more .
So I really think this is a perfect idea when parents encourage school-age children .
It can make their childre have a real goal and this goal will encourage school-age children to study more hard .
And the most important thing is that they will get high grade and fall in love with study .

In the high-speed development world, new technologies or science thriving day by day.
In order to keep abreast of the changes in society, young people have to improve themselves more or follow the higher standard.
Some people hold a view that it is too severe for the youth to comply with the rules, while for me, I hold an opposite point.
Admittedly, these strict rules or demands will be hard to young people to follow since it will add some pressure to the youth and thus lead to some diseases.
But it is not a case since it is better for individuals to suit for the environment rather than be shifted out of the society.
They have to adjust themselves constantly for a better future.
First of all, young people have to abey these regulations in order to satisfy the demand of whole society.
Since the more our world developed, the more talented people they need.
It will be abandened by the society if human beings especially the youth stop going.
A survey did a teat about a bounch of young people.
They were tested for their respounces in the same situation.
It showed a result that young people from the higher required companies represented a more quickly and more organized solution to the problems than that who were in more relaxed companies.
Through this survey I can make a conclusion that the more tempering environment ca shape talents more.
Furthermore, the rules of this society can be a way of motivaton for young people.
They are supposed to learn more and keep fullfill themselves in order to be more competitive in job hunting market.
As for me, a granduate student in collage, I have prepared a lot for my next hunting season.
From the freshman, I entered into the lab to do some researchs, joined in the students' goverenment to practice my social skills and also took part in a lot of sports game to strenth my body.
I know clearly that I have to be a comprehensive-development person or I will not get a good job with high salary.
I am wondering if the world did not develop so fast, can I have some motivation to be a talent one?
The answer is definetely not, and the same as my comtemporary.
So, strict environment is better for the development of young people.
In a nutshell, it is advisable to claim that the rules young people are required to follow are not too strict for them.
Not only for the self-development but also for the progress of the whole society.

The story of success is always fascinated and attracts many people to follow their ambitious dreams.
However, only small parts of the dreamer finally success, because they understand it is impossible to realize their dream with a single step, and only realistic goals can lead them to their dreams.
To begin with, the ambitious dream is too far to reach, but the realistic goals can help us to overcome the distance.
It is common that many passionate young people enter the society with their dreams, and find that it is almost impossible to be as successful as the ones in story.
The gap between their dream and themselves devastates their ambition, make them think it is impossible to reach the other side of the gap.
However, they don't understand that the ones in the story were once in the same situation with them, but they overcame all the difficulties by reaching one and another small but realistic goals.
Steve Jobs, the former CEO of Apple, started his company with his friend in his basement.
He embraced an ambitious dream in his mind and made it come true by achieving many realistic goals, the first CPU, the first computer and the first iPhone.
He went step by step and finally reached his dream.
In addition, always following the dream makes people lose their direction, but achieving realisitic goals remind them of their dreams.
When our dream is too far from us, we may not know what to do first.
At this time, to make some realistic plan will help us to make breakthrough.
We need the realistic goals to be the guideline to let us keep moving forward, but not lost in despair.
For example, I always wanted to study in Wuhan University when I was  young.
But I also knew it is not easy to do.
I started by making small goals, for example, reaching the top grade in class.
And after years hard work, I finally succed.
To sum up, we need realistic goals to guide us to the dreams

Having a breif glimpse at today's educational system,we can easily come out with a conclusion that high grade matters a lot in the whole system.
Schools and parents consider marks as the most direct way to evaluate the students' performance in their school studying.
Even some parents take the high grades as a standard to offer their children money,which also indicates the importance of high marks.
There is no doubt that high grade is a crucial way in estimate the perfomance of a student.
In the aspect,providing children money by judging their grade is a reasonable way,but that are not supposed to be the only thing to be concerned about.
To start with,relating money to high grade,in a sense,can stimulate students to work harder at their school work.
As a well-knowed Chinese notion goes,the more the stimulus,the more the motivation.
Apparently,everyone likes money,without wich one can not do anything.
In this aspect, money is considered the optimal choice to put impetus on students.
With the purpose of obtaining the money,the students maintained a stronger will to fight for high marks,which can facilitate their understanding of their text books and get high grade.
This seems to be a benefitial way both for students and their parents.
If a student works diligently and gets a good denouement,their parents would be pleased and offer them money readily.
Nevertheless,every coin has its two sides.
Using money as a stimuli for children to get high marks may lead them in the wrong directions.
We are definitely reluctant to see that the students care too much about money and become secular in their most innocent age.
Even worse,some students may conspire with other schoolmates to cheat in the eaxm in order to get high grade,which are bond to have an harmful effet on their future life.
Parent are never supposed to judge their children only by their marks.
There are more significant things they can concern about.
For example,mental and physical health,their relationshio with teachers and friends,etc.
If students fall into a wrong path,it will be fruitless to get high grades,no matter how high the marks are.
To conclude all the perspectio
If you are a small child, how would you feel if your father asks you to finish the math homework when you are chatting with your schoolmates happily?
How would you feel if your mother orders you to go to the gym and do some exercises to streghten your body when you are playing online games with your friends?
I would unlikely to obey these structions.
So as far as I am concerned, educating children is more difficult than it was in the past due to the presence of cell phone, onliine games and social networking Web site.
For one thing, children today can be easily addicted to online games which will cost them a lot of time on it and make them not want to study.
Of course, every child likes playing, but the easy access and easy giveback system will make them quickly addicted to the online games.
For example, owing to the fact that my mother is a middle school teacher, I get to know that many children today like to go to the net bar frequently where they can play the online games freely.
It often takes a lot of time for their parents and my mother to educate them not to go to the net bar anymore and meanwhile pay more attention on their study.
On the contrary, when I was a child, friends around me didn't have phones and computers, thus I spent more time studying because there were a lot of interests in the book.
So children today are more difficult for parents to educate.
For another, the unsuitable words on the social network media may affect the thoughts of children today and make them unwilling to listen to their parents.
You can meet any people and any different kinds of words on the internet where some children can probably see the words like "It is useless to study".
As we all know, children haven't gone through many difficults so they can be easily affected by others.
This kinds of words directly meet the unwillingness in their hearts.

However, few people had access to the internet and  the only way children in the past got knowledge is their parents and teachers, who were very responsible to their development and would do their best to educate.
That is the reason why educating children is a more difficult tasks\ than it was in the past.

Some parents claims that children should learn from their own mistake while others controdict that statement.

The disaster could have been avoided if the parents had told the child how dangerous the firework is.
