I will never forget how excited I was when the nine-year-old girl stood before a TV set witnessing her national team winning the champion of 2008 Beijing Olympic Game.
It was the first time that I realized how important it is for government to support athletics.
Although some people may contend arts should be sponsored in stead of sports teams, as far as I am concerned, sports plays a more significant role in citizens' lives.
First and formest, government spending more money on athletics enable people gaining courage to defeat failure.
There is no doubt that each person wish his or her national Olympics team would always be the winner.
However, competitive games expose us to the possibility of failing since there is not a team in the world can always win.
Having access to facing failure strengthen people's ability to deal with the unhappibess when facing failure.
As a result, when one meets some difficulties in his real life, if he can recall the failure of his national team in a international competition, he will regain the courage to move on.
Aditionally, more funds in support of athletics will enhance people's sense of health.
Nowadays, people are under a great deal of pressure from their work or their study.
In order to perform better in today's intense competition, people tend to ignore their health condition and work to hard to have a rest.
If the govenment supports more sports competitions, people will be exposed to the environment that more people are discussing sports.
Therefore, more and more people will take part in sports events to build up their bodies resulting in fitness.
Admittedly, arts is likely to help people relaxed compared with sports activities by visiting art museums.
However, only people taking art courses are more likely to enjoy the beauty of art while most of people are unable to understand what the artists are trying to convey.
Conversely, sports competition is a kind of activity that everyone can enjoy.
People with less education background can also have fun seeing intense competition on the TV screen.

To put it in a nutshell, I believe government are more supposed to support athletics rather than arts because sports events not only help people to face failure but also cultivate sense of exercising, which has stronger influnce among people.
With the development of science and technology, there are increasing numbers of people watch television.
In the modern soceity, more and more cartoon were produced and it leads more young children(aged two to five) to watch television.
There is a hot topic which is whether television advertising should direct toward young children.
Some people are in favor of the idea that television advertising should direct toward young children.
However, i believe the opposite statement for the following reasons.
First of all, television advertising have negative influence on young children's eye sight.
As we all konw that, children's eye sight are developing during aged two to five and the majority of the television advertising are too light and too fast for the young children.
By contrast, all the cartoons are easy to understad and play slowly in order to fit young children's eyesight.
Let us image, if we allow television advertising directed toward young children, it seems like nothing was happen with young children.
But you will know the bad result in the future.

Education is consolidating its status as the cornerstone to success.
However, whether it is easier to educate the children today then in the past is debatable.
Some people hold a point that it is easier to educate children in the past because at that time there was less things to distract students' attention.
As for me, I strongly believe that educating children is getting more and more easier for following reasons:
Firstly, now we have more ways for learning.
As the development of the Internet, children have various ways to study---not only by teachers' teaching,   but also by other kinds of techology such as cell phones.

Then it helps to simplize teachers work---students need not to ask their teacher every question they have, they can solve some of the tasks by looking for information online by themselves and others by discussing with their friends on social networking Website.
For example, my aunt is a teacher.
She often tells us that it is much easier to teach students today--- In the past, students ask her their all questions because it was very hard to have a tool to look up information in.
It makes her very tired and found it very difficult to educate students.
But now is totally different.
With the help of technology, students can solve most of their problems by discussing or looking up information online.
Then it enables her to  solve a few valuable question and certainly has less pressure.
Secondly, now students have more times studing.
In the past, most students' parents did not take study seriously.
They think working hard and earning money is the most important thing.
Thus, the push their children to shoulder the responsibility to do the housework.
As students' time is limited, when they spend more time working they must soend less time studying.
Unluckily, there is an old chinese saying" no pain no gain."
I t means that if a person does not spend enough time studying, he would fail to succeed in all likelihood.
Then, it increases teachers' pressure because they need to devote themselves more without parents' support.
In a word, educating children is a easier task today then it was in the past considering the more time they take and the more different ways for learning.

so, doing many tasks a day is quite useful for one to establish relationship with others and get negotating ability improved because one may have to deal with people with different interests or habits

Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated topic among people: which expenditures should be reduced by goverments during economic crisis, library, police or public transportation?
Opinions vary from person to person.
Some people claim that the spending of police or public transportation should be declined.
However, I would stand on their opposite side and I believe that the expenditures of library should be decreased.
My viewpoints can be elaborated as follows.
Firstly, library have already complete system and there is no need to put as much spending as before into the library during economic crisis.
Nowadays, a regular library have owned abundant sources of books.
If people cannot find the book which they want to read in the library, they could surf the Internet and they would get the book easily.
As for the staff which work in the library, they would not put much strain on the library budget because not many people would come to the library to read.
Thus, library could not employ many staff to work there during ecnomic crisis.
For example, our country suffered an economic crisis then years ago and our government asked half of the library in our country to close.
Then our government saved one million RMB each year which helped our country a lot at that time.
Secondly, the spending of police should not be reduced because the safety of citizen is the first aim of governments.
Only if the safety of citizen is promised, can governments to deal with the situation of economic crisis.
If the government reduce the expenditures of police, citizens would be worred about them safety.
This is not good for handling the economic crisis because the government would lose some control on public, let alone the entirly ecnomy.
Finally, the public transportation is also important for everyone especially during the ecnomic crisis.
There are lots of traffic tool that people will take.
If the spending of transportation is reduced, it would cause the mess of the transportaion and people would not work on time.
Therefore, it would influence people's life siganificantly.
All in all, I firmly think government should reduce the expenditures of library during the economic cirsis.

During the study, we always have some puzzles about the things we learned in class.
We have many methods to solve this such as asking the teachers or classmates.
However, there is a controversy that when your friends is needed someone to help with his study while you always get good grades in your class, would you help your friend or let him to find a tutor?
If I were you, I should teach him by myself.
To begin with, this action can strenghen the relationship between each other.
Since you help him to solve the problem, he will be appreciate and do something to pay back such as sending agift for you or invite you to have a meal.
Take my experience for example, I am good in math and one of my classmates is not.
Once, he asked me to explain how to solve a tough question.
I try my best to interpret three method of this question and he saw it.
After that, he no longer makes any mistake about this question.
In return for my effort, he invited me to  the entertainment park to play and we build deep friendship.
Second, helping others is also an effective way to exercise our communication and expression ability.
When you explain the methods of the questions, you should interpret briefly and clearly enough and use some examples to illustrate it,so that your friend can easy to understand what you just said.
And before you start, you should have clear and effective logic in your mind so that youcan express logically.
Third, helping others with the questions is a good method to review what you learned.
Because when you teach others, you must understand  this question completely and can solve this within a short time period.
As you interpret the reason of it, you will also explain the equation and formula that used in this.
Therefore, you review this konwledge again.
As for me, I always do this and I hardly ever making mistakes in the examination about the quetion I have interpreted to my classmates.
To sum up, from my point of view, I prefer to help friend by self which has a lot of advantages.

Nowadays, the high grade students get in the school is really attractive to parents so that it drives many parents to use any way possible to enhance the grade of their children in the school.
Offering their school-age children money for each high grade they get in school is a general idea to reach this goal.
And in my opinion, this is a really great idea for parents to utilize to make their children get high grades in school.
The reasons generalized below.
Firstly, children dosen't have much concious about how important the high grade they get in school means.
We rellatively older people know that high grades mean great recognization and agreement by society, which further gives us more chances to succeed in the future life.
But children always don't understand this, they love easy and funny things like playing.
If parents don't do something to inspire their children to study hard in school, many children will just play too much and be the terrible students in the school.
So ways like offering money for their children are gread things to consider for parents.
Secondly, It is a very useful way to help children to get good grades in the school.
I have an experience about this.
When I was young and was in the primary school.
I had a very good friend who was my classmates.
My mother used to offer me a little money for each high grade I get in school.
So I always had great passion studying.
Although my friend and I usually played together, he did not like studying at all.
When I asked him why he did not finish teachers' works, he said: 'It is too boring'.
However, today I just go into a pretty good college in a big city because of my good grades.
He still stays in his little village to struggle for life everyday.
So after my own experience of such idea taken by my parents, you see, it is really effective for this method for children's good grade.
Therefore I think that offering children money for each high grade they get in school is a completely great idea.
Through this way can you get you children a better grade.
And for more, a beter life

Taking account of the mentioned factors, we can safely arrive conclusion that the best way is to correct the mistake right away when teachers says something incorrect in your opinion.

In our society, people are compelled to cooprate with each others in oder to be more aggressive.
Recently, a heated debate has been aroused among people whether colleagues or classmates should communicate personally than through emails in order to work a project.
From my perspective, I firmly believe that it is better for colleagues or classmates to talk face to face.
Here are some reasons and examples that supported my viewpoints.
First, communicating with each other in person can increase the relationship and thus people are more likely to devote himself to the project.
Since people talk and exchange ideas personally, everyone can see each others' face and thus know each other's feeling.
someone who might not have passion in that project might affect by others' passional talking.
Therefore, the team is in a good and active atmosphere which everyone is willing to do his own work perfectly.
But if people talk through emails, people cannot see other's face and cannot know each other's feeling, resulting a bad mood in the team.
For instance, when I was in a project needed three people, I firstly suggest that we should find a nice place and share our own viewpoints freely.
Everyone agrees with that and we finally make a wonderful talk even including our own life, our experience recently and our novels or movies we read.
At last, everyone finish his own work perfectly, and we get a good grade due to the success of the project.
Second, it is more precise for people to communicate personally so the project can be continued soomthly.
Since people talk to each other in person, they have lots of time to express their idea or demand precisely.
With less mistakes, people can do a better job in the project, leading a good result.
In the constrast, people have to type their emails and might make mistakes when typing.
Moreover, the people who read the emails might misunderstand the context in the emails and they might not find they are wrong, which cause great difficults for project to continue.
For instance, when I was in a project I do not had time to meet the colleagues so I send him a email annoucing him some details in our peoject.
He seemed misunderstand some information such as the demand for the project.

As the world is developing at a fast pace, many children can get in touch with technology earlier than children in the past.
Although technology can bring benefits to human, many people are concerning whether the techonology has made children less creative than they were in the past.
As far as I am concerned, technology didn't make children less creative than they were in the past.
To begin with, technology can provide children with a series of tools to access information that they need to create.
With the wild spread of electonic devices, children may use the computers, pads, and smart phones to get information.
In this way, they will have more ways than they were in the past to learn by themselves.
As far as they learned a certain amount of knowledge, they can have a lot of ideas easily.
Also, with the ideas and information, they can create something by themselves.
On the contrary, children in the past get less information than children now, so it can be difficult for them to be more creative than children with more ideas and information.
Then, technology can help children create things easiser.
With technology, children can save a lot of time and energy that children used to spend on constructing.
In the past, if children want to create something, then they have to find materials and make them all by themselves.
However, children now can just find a machine to automatically create the things they want.
In this way, they will not give up create things easily.
For example, my brother likes car a lot, and last summer he came up with a creative idea to build a toy car that can be fold into a suitcase.
And he made the components with the 3D printer, and finally he did it.
Ever since then, he has a sense of achievement, and couldn't help coming up with more creative ideas.
So technology can also cultivate children to be creative.
Last but not the least, I admit that children can rely on and be distracted by technology sometimes, because they are too young to control themselves.
However, parents can help to control them.
And In another word, just because the existance of technology that children can get in touch with so many things they are interested in, and learn them in a fast and interesting way.
Just because of this, that children are willing to study the things they are curious about by themselves and try to create their own things.
To conclude, I don't think technology has made children less creative than they were in the past.
If the development of technology limited childrens' development, then why people are continuing develop technology?
Nowadays, in many schools, there are two different types of ways to study, on is study in a group, and the other is study alone.

But, some people believed that students will be more effective when they are study alone, because they can be participate more on their recent project.
However, in my opinion, I suggeat that students would be more effective while they are study in a group.

Because when teacher gives a project to students, there must be lots of work to do, so students in the study group can divide the task in servral parts for each people.
So they can concentrate on their own work.
Compare to study alone, a single student have a limit capacity of study, so they can't do a lot of work as a group can.
In addition, it also can develop student's ability fo teamwork.
In the group, every one needs to work perfectly with their onw part, so that the whole group won't be disorder.
Second, in the study group, when a student is facing a diffcult problem, rest of the group members caould help him to solve the answer.
In the group, every one helps with each other, they can solve the problems correctly without cost lots of time.
But if  a single person faces with a problem, no one could help him.

Once in the math class, teacher gave us a project.
And soon some student who are confidetn they work alone, I work with my friends.
When the results came, our score was much higher that single people.
Third,although I admit that work alone can be more focus on their project without distraction, but work in a group can develop people's avility of creative thinking.
When students are taslking with each other, they mix up with different thinkingso that can develop student's mind.
They can be more creative than they was.
In conclusion, I agree with the statement that students work in a group, because it can be more effective, and it also can develop student's creative thinking.

Some people in society think that watching a movie or reading a book is better than relax through doing physical exercise.
However,I have a different idea.
When it comes to the statement that playing sports is more helpful for people to relieve stress than sitting in front of TV or computers,I strongly agree.
There are some reasons why I feel this way:exercise not only contributes to relaxing brains but also is able to help ease body.
First of all,playing sports is so much the better than watching a movie or reading a book because during which time people can empty their brains and stop thinking.
In any sphere of life,people have to keep considering many kinds of issues like schools,jobs ,families and so on.
Howerer,while playing sports,people can follow their body,doing whatever they want without thinking.
In contrast, watching a movie or reading a book plays no part in this situation.
Although they can help people stay away from vexed issues in reality,people still have to think over things in virtual world.
In addition,doing physical exercise is more helpful for relaxing body.
People will sweat while they play sports which may help their bodies expel toxins.
Meanwhile,by means of running,jumping and stretching while playing sports can ease their muscle which are conductive to avoid some body diseases such as cervical spondylosis and so on.
Nevertheless,we have to keep one posture when we choose to watch a movie or read a book.
Therefore,our bodies can not relax at all!
In summary,doing physical exercise are absolutely essential in order to relax not only our brains but also our bodies.
For these three reasons,I agree with the statement that doing physical exercise is better than relax by watching a movie or reading a book.
As far as I am concerned, It's a good idea to offer the children money if they get a good grade in school.

In the very beginning,parents use the way to express their encourage of children's hard work,but with the method becoming common,things would change.
This kind of award is based on a belief that both parents and children are honest and responsble.
For parents,they should make the rule clear,like what grade is the average or how extra grade is rewarded.
And for children,who might not understand the importance,they should promise every grade they give to parents is true.
If the requirements mentioned are not all satisfied,things could be a mutual cheat between parents and children.
Worse,children might get the bad habit of cheatng in order to get the little award from adults.
But I don't think that using awarding is a bad idea to help children improve,this may even increase their interest in study.
But parents should find the best way of awarding.
For example,the award could be other things,such as a big meal whith parents or a tool if child had a 90 grades for 5 times.
And there could be some punishment rule:if the child fail,he or she must help parents do the laundry or clean the bathroom for a week.
I think there is no much advantage to connect grade to money for children.

I have seen many families in this condition:the parents are very generous in giving money to little chid,but the child hate study and fail every important exam,then their parents would be angry and stop giving money to punish them.
The fact is,there is rarely a kid would work hard to gain their money from parents.
So I guess the point in the "awarding money for high grade" is the interaction between children and parents rather than the amout of money awarded.
Maybe the most effective way to improve grade is to spend more time to be with kids and family,I think.
Nowadays many people think that money is detrimental to children's development because too much extra money may lead their kids lost in this colorful world.
I agree that money may have some negative influence to some extent.
After all, many playboys are always showing off or comparing with others.
However, in my opinion, I still think offering suitable money to kids for their good marks is beneficial.
To begin with, kids are under too much pressure these days for the restless homework, difficult exams, and targets set by others.
They probably feel exausted during the limitless studying period.
So the reward is needed, which may facilitate children to study in delight and encourage them to achieve higher achievements.
My little brother, Johnson is totally agrees on that.
He is a primary school student.
Every weekend he will have a test from school, that sounds boring, right?
However, when I asked him whether he felt tired due to this pressful test schedual, his answer completely surprised my.
He said that he was desirable for each test because his mother told him that he would get an extra pocket money if he achieved some goals in tasks.
After that he can use that money to do whatever he likes.
As a matter of that, money can also beneficial to children's study.
Besides, rewarding money to kids is also educational.
This method can teach them the difficulties of earning money.
By reaching the high grade, students must concentrate more on class and pay more painstaking effort to learn the knowledge.
During this period the children will figure out how hard their parents earning money will be, and moreover, they will become more mature as well as more cherishing in money.
Bill Gates, is the best people can reflect on this.
During his childhood, his father just designed a rewarding mechanism on him, so every time Bill would study much harder to get the awards.
After years when Bill retrospected, he said that it was his father told him how hard to earn money and taught him to value every dollar.

In conclusion,  whereas there is still an argument for not rewarding money due to high grades to children, namely worries upon the money might lead them into astrays, encouragement, coupled with educational aspects, makes a strong case of supporting rewarding money to kids.

Issues related to studying have never failed to attact people's attention.
When it comes to the compulsory courses, recently a hotly dabated topic has aroused among the public: whether the students should be required to take history coursed whatever their major is.
Some may insist that learning the history is neccessary, so the history class should be required.
However, as far as I am concerned, I believe that the studetns who are not in the field of history should not take the course.
My points of views will be illustrated as follow.
First of all, requiring the students to take the history couses, to some extent, is wasting their time to focus on what they like.
To be specific, in university, studetns are busy with a lot of stuffs, not only learning but also something they are intrested in.

However, the history courses take a long-term learning period for students to pay their attention to and besides, studetns have to spend a lot of time to memory and review in order to get a good grade due to its difficulty.
As a result, they lose the time and opportunity to choose the elective courses or take part in some activities they like, which waste their time to enjoy the happy university life.

For instance, when I was a freshman in university, I had intended to choose the psychology as my selective course because of my interests, however, my school required us to take the history class which time conflicted to the psychology's.
Therefore I had to give up to learn it during the first year, which really waste my time to do something I like.
On top of that, for those who are not interested in the hisory students, the course is useless.
In details, the sudents who do not like the subject will not take efforts on it, which means that during the class they will not follw the teacher's teaching but finish their own work.
And after the class, they will not seriously finish the homework and they will not prepare well for the test but just pass it.
As a result, opening the course cannot reach the original intention, because many students who do not like the course will not learn it hard and they cannot aquire much knowledge from the course.
For example, my uncle is a headmaster of a university.
Last year he implemented the requirment of taking history courses to his school.
However, after one year, the results is that rare students really did well in the final tests.
And after investigating, he found that few studetns were familiar with what the teacher had taught during the class, which means the courses were useless.
All in all, judging from all above, I strongly disagree that the university should require all the students to take the history class.

Whether or  not students can learn much more effectively when they work in a group than when they work individually is a controversial issue that deserves to be researched.

As team work can help students to better sovle their problems as well as to obtain creative ideas, from my perspective group studying does exert more positive influence on students than studing by oneself does.
First of all, working together is beneficial for students to better manage difficult problems they face.
This is because a group of people, with their gathered wisdom and resouces, can have a great variety of solutions in a relatively short period of time.
For instance, I joined a biological study group in college and every weekend we would get together to discrss the sophisticated problems which we could not figure them out alone.
It is by working together that we can always find a better solution.
Secondly, group study is conducive for students to obtain more vreative ideas which are particularly significant in our study.
To be more precisely, by communicating with team members, people are able to share their different thoughts and ideas arise.
For example, in our buisness calss in the unibersity, we often have brainstorming meetings where every gets the chance to speak out his or her ideas and communicate them with other people.
It is by this brainstorming meeting that we put forward a lot of igenious ideas and thoughts which contributed a lot to our academic studies.
It is true that studying in a group may seem difficult to some prople, who are ingoing and do not fare to speak in public.
This is because some people are scared of making mistakes in front other people or simply because they are inborn more shy than other prople.
However, it is by workong together with group members shy people gain precious opportunities to learn how to speak out his or her ideas and how to vommunivate with others more efficiently.

To sum up, I have demonstrated that studying in a group can not only help students to better solve their problems, but it can also facilitate them to acquire vreative and original ideas whicah could greatly invrease their academic competition.
Therefore, it is definitely a wide idea to let students participate more in group study so they can gain more benefit and thus be better equipped for their future development.
Famous entertainers and athletes are always envious of their reputations and glories, and people are always curious about their daily lifes.
Not only are their charaters on the screen concerned by people but also their private life.
Nowadays, some people think celebrities should have more privacy than they have now.
I can not agree more with it.
First, to reduce famous figures exposure of daily lifes can protect them from zealots.
Take John Lennon as a  example, he is a member of a rock band named The Beatles and he is considered as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century.
He was shot by a fanatia fan who had mental disease and died in December 8,1980.
It was a tremendous loss for music which made people to reconsider the privacy issues of the celebrities.
Sometimes fans will wait in the airport to pick up their idols and this action will lead to  a jam which may cause a stampede.
It not only does harm to famous people, but also is detrimental for the fans.
Second, everyone needs rests.
Like the actors who had just performed a program, the athletes who had just finished a competition, they had been exhausted and had to take a rest.
But they could not have a rest when their houses and hotels was exposed to the public because fans would wait there and try their best to draw their idols' attention.
If things continue this way, it is harmful to the health of those celebrities.
Last but not least, the inconformity between the role in play and the character in real life may disappoint the audiences.
Whether the moives or the TV series, they are fake stories indeed.
Enthralling in a virtual role and imposing the illusory on the actor, people may come across a conflict between envisions and facts which shometimes lets pople down.
In a word, it is better for both the celebritied and the public not to focus on the privacy of the famaous public figures.

I'm afraid I have to say I disagree with this statement .
Personally I always find physical exercise more relaxing than watching a movie or reading a book .
I wouldn't like relaxing by watching or reading;they are both consuming tasks .
I have to take in information ,process it and argue about it .
When reading books information is provided by means of words ;when watching movies ,by videos and audios .
All ways require me to combine and compare the information given right now with the information I have absorbed in previously ,which calls for full-load usage of my brain .
This can hardly be seen as 'relaxing' .
Moreover ,for us students we are daily dealing with books ,which again makes the idea of  relaxing by reading books less reasonable .
I would prefer relaxing by doing physical exercises .
Running ,rope skipping ,muscle trainings ,swimming ,or even ball games ,they all sound great when it comes to relaxing .

Of course exercising means you have to deal with problems like panting for breath ,sore musles (or even a sore throat),sweat all over your skin ,and some other unmentioned problems ,yet they simply can't conceal the fact that physical exercise is a great way to save one's mind from heavy mental pressures .
Scientists have found that physical exercises ,regardless of which type of exercise you choose ,will help your body secrete hormones that can lift the stones of your mind .

Of course ,watching movies or reading books may also be helpful for relaxing ,for example ,if you choose sitcoms ,or other materials that do not require much consideration of problems you might encounter in the books or movies ,yet this doesn't mean processing with the information is not a consuming task ;it still is .
With this in mind ,I guess I would prefer watching movies or reading books when I seriously wish to think over the topic ,instead of seeing it as a choice of mentally relaxing .
Physical exercise will be my safe choice

I think parents offer their school-age children money for each high mark is a good idea.
There are two reasons.
The first one  is that giving money can stimulate children to put  more effort on their school work.
Generally, children dislike boring school stuff, they will not be interested in it unless they get something.
However, parents are not god, they don not know their kids as well as the kids themselves.
Giving money is a great method rather than offering other objects directly.
Parents do not know what their chidren really want.
kids can cost the money on things they demand without telling parents because some parents don't allow kids to spend on the things that are not related to schoolwork.
For example, my best friend loves buying dolls such as teddy bear or barbie series.
She dares to tell her mom that she wants to buy those dolls because dolls are too childish for teenagers.
As a  result, every time she asks me to buy her dolls.
This makes her family relationship nervous.
She is rewarded with money due to her high mark on tests, however, she can't cost money freely without parents' permission.
Another condition is that some kids can save the money in order to get a big acheivement.
For example,some boys like buying electric airplane models which are not cheap at all; Or girls like buying gorgeous dresses and famous make-up brands such as Channel and Dior.
Many kids do not really care about their grades themselves, the ones who care are their parents.
Some parents are very competitive to other parents.
Knowing their own child gets higher grade than other children can satisfy their vanity.
This can be regarded as a teamwork.
The higher mark children earn, the more money parents reward.
Parents and children can both be happy if they gain what they want.
Thus, offering children money can improve the relationship between parents and children.

Recently, an interesting question has aroused a heated debate: in order to attract tourists, whether government should hire more police to improve the safety and impove the old buildings and streets to enhance the appearance.
Answers vary from person to person, some people claim that we should actually do this.
However, I will stand on their opposite side.
This is because I believe that we have
Firstly, government can increase the advertisement for the city to attract more tourists.
This is beacuse we are willing to go to a city for sightseeing because we have some knowledge of the features about this city.
So the more expose of the city, the more tourists will come.
On the contrary, if the government do add the advertisement for the city, the tourists would not choose this city for traveling because of lacking information.
For example, Chengdu which is the big city in the China makes numerous advertisement about the city which is the home for the panada.
So many tourists from all over the world would go to the city for seeing the panada, which help the government attract many tourists.
Secondly, government could establish many theme parks to attract more tourists.
As we all know,modern people have a great amount of pressure in the life and work.
So many people want to relax themselves by playing entertainment facilities, which are the part of the theme park.
So the government could build theme park to attract more tourists.
In contrast, if the government do not do this, many tourists would choose other place to release their pressure.
For example, Disney park can attract many tourists from  different places.
Shanghai builds a theme park, which would increase the tourists number about fifteen percents every year.
To put it in a nutshell, I firmly disagree that government should hire more police or improve the old buildings and streets to attract more tourists.
This is because we could increase the advertisement and build more theme parks to attract more tourists

There are many things to consider about achieving success, while different people may have different ideas about the way to achieve success.
Some people think that we should alway follow our dreams even if the dreams are ambitious.
But as far as I concerned, I firmly believe that we should just focus on achieving realistic goals.
My reasons are as follow.
To begin with, many dreams, even looks like ambitious, are very difficult for us to achieve it.
This is because  most of times, dreams are just inner thoughts that people hope to realize and they are not realistic.
For example, to people born in the poor families, what they really want to achieve is usually to become rich person and change their fate.
However, with the rapid develpoment of society, the social status have formed, which make it difficult for themselves to achieve their abitious goal.
To contrast, if their follow the realitic goals, just like to be a good man and keep good relationship with others.
it will be more accessible for them.
In addition,  any great and ambitious goals consist of some small and realistic goals.
As a chinese proverb goes that if a person cannot clean one house, they will not clean the world.
Literally, it told us that if we want to reach some ambitious dreams, we should take several steps that is essencial to dreams.
There is no doubt that greatmen might not know what the person they would become.
It is due to their hard work and achieve their realistic goals one by one that they finally reached their life peaks.
Take chinese famous scientists, Qian Weichang,a famous physicist in th world.
However, opposed to common thinking, Mr Qian was not good at physics, let alone became a scientist.
Through his several years hard working, they made a great progress and achieve a lot of so-called realistic goals and became a great scientist.
All in all, I firmly believe that we should be more realistic and just finish the goals one by one.
Finally, we can achieve our special sucess
Today, there is a hot topic: whether people can get leadership by learning.
Answers varies from people to people.
Some people claims that no person can learn to be a leader.
Contrary to their opinion comes my concept that it is possible to be a leader by learning.
To begin with, being a leader require amounts professional knowledges which can be get by learning.
It is acknowlegded that people who owns professional skills or knowledges make better decison in a shorter time than other people do.
This capability make subordinates be willing to follow the person possible.
Since everyone is able to get expertise by learning from books, teachers, and diverse sources, people can obtain leadership by learning.
For instance, when I entered university, I had no experience of being a leader, even being a study group leader.
I spent 10 hours every day in doing researches and writing relevent paper during a year, I got the highest academic performance in my class.
The professional knowledge I earned helps me to be the leader of the research group.
ecendly, people who is adept to relate other people would likely to be a good leader.
Since social skills can be learned by practicing, people obatain leadership by learning socal skills.
If people is good at relating to other people, he or she would attract more investments, customers as well as employees, which would help him or her to be a good leader.
In general, I think people can become a leader by learning.

Nowadays, people are under more and more pressure in the rapidlly growing society so many couples are not even able to take care of themselves well.
Under that condition, giving birth to a baby and carefully raise up a baby can be really hard, so parents should come up with more efficient ideas to teach thier child how to grow correctly.
Among those stratigies, letting children make mistakes and learn from them can be very useful and effective.
So I would agree with the statement.
Here comes my own idea about the statement.
First of all, rasing a child is a work that demands a lot of attention and time, and no one wants to waste the precious emotion and time.

Letting children do thier own things means that parents can have more of thier time instead of spending all their free time with children, or in other words, they can do other things they like, not trapped in the babysitting work.

And while children can learn form their mistakes, parents can do less things such as teaching children lessons which they might not be interested at all and telling children what they can do or what they cannot do.
Secondly, as for the children themselves, growing independence is always a progress they will have to experience.
Every child will become an adult one day and the society is unlikely to accept a person who cannot deal with his or her own private things.
So it is essential for a parents to foster thier children's ability of independence in case that they cannot fit the surrounding enviroment.
Still, we always find that learing through our mistakes is a very efficient way to improve ourselves as the impression is usually very deep in our mind, different from the lessons other people teach.
Take that into consideration, learning from our own mistakes is very benificiary.
Admittedly, parents should prevent thier kids from suffering and not a parent want to see his or her child crying for making mistakes.
But as the saying goes, no pain, no gain.
Only with the baptism from distress can we become stronger and stonger.
So parents should sometimes let their children go for a while, let them jump into the ocean of real world and get touch with the mistakes and pains they get.
Only with these setbacks can a child grow more healthier.
To draw a conclusion, I would say that letting children make mistakes and letting them learn from thier own mistakes is no doubt a good direction for parents to follow.
The child growing with mistakes and then trying to avoid mistakes the next time is always better than the child growing in a green house and being treated like a flower.
Mistakes can make children grow independently, so just let your children make thier own mistakes and try to fix themse
In the wake of globalization, we can have easier access to the relevant events happen from home and abroad.

From my perspective, I firmly contends that it is of great significance for us to know what is happening around the world despite that they have scarce influence on our daily life.
First and foremost, knowing current news can broaden our horizons.
Events happen around the world can guide us into knowing some extotic things and have a better and well-rounded knowledge of foreign countries.

Although the political issues may not involve with our daily life, discussing about them can add colour to our spiritual world and make ourselves mature more quickly.

There has been a controversy about whether leadershing comes naturally or can be nurtured.
There do exist some people  who are naturally qualified to be a good leader.
However, it does not mean people can not learn to be a leader.
From my perspective, most leadership is learned except some specialist.
Leadership evolves managing people around, which means you firstly had to have a proper relationship with people around you, including your own leaders.
Relationship will not come naturally, so will the leadership.
Moreover, as a good leader, you have not only care about the effectiveness of the work you superiors are doing, sometimes, but also the emotion about your workers have.
Which indicates you to care both the work and the life of them.
all of those have to be learned before you become a real leader.
As I mentioned above, there did exist some people who become leaders easily as naturally.
It seems that they have already the ability or quite quilified to be a leader.
There is no doubt that some people have the talents to be a leader, those talents still have to learn both skills of dealing with other people and managements of a comapany.
They just learn things more naturally and quickly than normal people.
This may make us think that their leadership come naturally.
Further more, good leaders are always good learners.
They have to consider different things people from various aspects.
it is certain that a leader do not like learning will last long.
Everything should be learned, including leadership.
it just all depends on the amount of the time and efforts one have made to become a good leader.
for talented people, they do learn things qulickly, however, it does not mean that normal people could not become a leader.
in conclusion, leadership does not come naturally, but learned.

Porject is the way that students learn the knowledge, and teachers now tend to give to ways for students to finish a project.
Views went differ when it comes to the question whether students can learn much more effectively by working together than by working alone.
From my perspective, I think the students can benefit more from the teamwork.
To begin with, work together means more poeple paticipate in the project so there will be more ideas.
It takes time when a person try to decide the best way to work out a project, but for a team, it's much easier.

Imagine that there is a project requirres students to finish it in different ways,virous ideas can be came up thus the group members are all benefited because they can exchange the idea and learn more about the knowledge through the group discussion.
In addition, working in a group can save time because people can have a devision of the work.
Students can devide the work apart so  the learning can be much more effective.
For, example, last month my history professor ask us to write a pappe about the recent mucis history.
I gathered other calssmates to finish the work together, and each of them has his or her own expertise.
For the interview part, we choose the student who is good at communicating to interview an musician, and for information collection part, the students who masters the computer was assigned.
Finally we are the fastest to complete the professoers' assignment, and we used the rest of time to deeper study the mucic history.
Admittedly, working alone on projects do have some benefits such as the quiet environment.
But there are still many difficulties which can't help studetents learn effectively.

Take all above into consideration, I still believe that when teacher assign the projsts that requirres students to work together, students will learn much more effectiely, since group members can obtain different ideas in a short time, and save time to study more about the course.

There is a widely discussed topic nowadays about how people nowadays are less happy or less satisfied with their lives than perople were in the past since the world is changing so quickly.
While most people might have agreed with this statement, I hold a rather different thought.
It is true that our whole community, from working to living environments are moving rather fast right now, and we all have to speed up our paces to go along with their world.
Whether people are less happy because of that is yet to be discussed, and my reasons why most people are still happy and passionate about their lives are as follwing.
To start with, since the world changing so fast, new inventions and technologies are been developed fast as well, and those have brought us countless convience and enjoyment.
Back to the old days, by which I mean before even the camera is invented, not to even mention television and smart phones.
We might have seen from the documentary film about the life of people back in the "non-elecctric" days.
For ordinary people, what the male do all day is just farming, planting while the female will just do some tapestries at home.
The only way they can entertain themselves is to drink, to dance and to chat with other peole.
While most of the peasans do not know how to read, they can not even enjoy reading.
The aristocrates seemed to have a little bit more fun with the social events.
but that doesnot seem to be enough.
One of the most common scene I have see from the films is when the aristocrates seems in their giant meeting room boredly, playing their cards endlessly and always discuss what they can do next.
Do we want that kind of life?
I don't think so.
Nowadays, with the inventions of  television, smart phone and mainly more entertatinments, we have so much more of entertainment.
Since we are all loaded with works during the daytime, we can completely relax ourselves from those entertainment.
If you want to read, you can just search the book on my phone, and  read whatever I want.
How convenience is that?
So while the world is changing fast, it has brought us tons of entertainments and benefits that we are happy about.

The second reason is that, while the world is running fast, giving us new chllanges and lots of works on a daily base, we should take it fopr granted, and embrace these challanges to achieve the sense of satisfication.
Take myself as an example, as a teaching assistant in the New Channel right now, I am facing a lot more challenges and obstacles then what I have expected.
Before I entered this field, I though the only thing that teaching assistant needs to do is to tutor the students, and help them achieve their goals.
However, that is obivously not the case, I have to deal with so much more.

While been a good tutor who can truly help the students academically and mentally, I have to also deal with the communication with the parents, and manage some side business that I was definitely not familiar with.
In the beginning, I was busy all day, I was so stressed that I am quite unhappy about my life.
But I just do not want to give up, I do think the sense of obligation and challenging is helping.
Now being good at whatever my duty is feels so good, I do feel the obstacles I had in the beginning has let me to fully appreciate my life right now.
While the world is changing so fast, we should embrace the challenges to live a happier life.
I do understand how people are less happy becuase they think the world is changing so fast, and they can not keep up with the pace of the world.
They are under lots of pressure, lots of people even break down since they do not know how to deal with the challenges.
While I do agree with this symptom, I don think they need to be strong.

Overall, as I mentioned above, even though there might be some peole are now less happ or less satisfied with thier lives than people were in the past since the world is changing so fast, there are always something that we can appreciate and enjoy from.
With the development, we have so much more to enjoy ourselves, even the challenges.
So I definitely think people nowadays are happier with the world changing.
Nowedays, with people's living standards continuous improvement, many problems follows.
Some parents offer their young children money for each high score they get in school.
But others disagree with this point,so do I.
First and foremost,school-age children do not have a mature adn sound consumption view.
Once they got much money from their parents, they are more likely to spend their money without any limit before they have a consideration.
They may form a bad habit of spending money.
Take my cousin as a good example.
He always have a good academic record and his parents gave him about 25 dollar for every subject that he got high grade.
As a result, he has been spending money with money.
In addition,material rewards should not be the best way to encourage school-age children to get a better performance.
Parents have the obligation to let their children know that only by their hard working,can they achieve good grades in examinations.
And marking efforts in study is all for their own choices of their future.
Last but not the least,parents' behavior of offering money for their children's each high grade in school maybe will make their school-age children get misunderstand that grade or mark.
It is the most valuable standard to measure their academic performance.
They have an alternative to tell their children that the process of acquiring weighs more and they always understand them during the way of learning.
Such as, the frequent communication and participation in their children's learning activities.
All in all,I think parents would better not offer their school-age children money for each high grade they get in school.
Instilling the right idea of learning and how to use money is what parents should do.
Many people have their own dreams since humans existed.
And people's dreams might be differed with each other drastically.
Some of their dreams are ambitious, while others might be more realistic.
In my opinion, we should have some more realistic dreams.
This is because realistic dreams can make us more moticated compared to the ambitious dreams, they let us focus on the things we need to deal with recently.
Also, the great ambitious dreams might be easier to achieved by attaining many relative small realistic dreams.
First, the realistic dreams can let us be aware of the goals we need to accomplish in the short time, through which we can be more motivated and encouraged.
On the contrary, the ambitious dreams some times might be too far away from us, having to much gap so that we mgiht be confused on the process of persuing them.
Taking my younger cousin for example, he used to dream of becoming the astronaut when he was in the junior high school.
Such an ambitious dream he had that his parents once took pride in him.
But actually, he didn't know how to achieve that, also he didn't know how he could find the channel to approach that.
Thus he had no targets and were occupied by variety of non-sense things everyday.
Now he has become an adults, living in a small town like other ordinary persons.
Second, we should be aware of that the great ambitious dreams are always achieved by attaining many small, even tiny accomplishments.
This is what we should pay attention on, we will not accomplish anything if we don't begin with realistic and small dreams.
Taking myself for example, I major in the design, I can still remember when I was in the college,  I had made the decision to be admitted in the ACCD in LA.
The goal might be a little far and ambitious, but my professor told me that I should divide the big goal into many small, realistic goals.
With his guide, I have planned the specific goal everyday, dicided how many sketches I should make everyday.
Than I could feel that I made the progress gradually.
Finally, two years later, I was admitted into that famous college.
As I dreamed of.
In conclusion, we should start the big goal by beginning with small and realistic dreams.
Only by this way can we be aware of what we shoud do.

As the population of human growth each year, more and more couples having problem about how to educate their chidren.
Some parents believe that kids should be well behaved without making mistakes on everything, while others hold the perspective that children are able to gain experience from their mistakes.
In my opinion, children are ought to make mistakes.
First of all, mistakes can not be avoid.
As all we know, everyone will do something wrong nearly everyday, even adults sometimes make mistake by accidents.
Therefore, punishing children who make mistakes seems not fair.
For instance, when I was four years old, my mather asked me to hold a bowl of rice for her; however, I broke the bowl because I did not expect the bowl to be so heavy.
My mother did not blame me for that, she said I did not do it on purpose.
After that, I remembered that a bowl of rice weight like a huge rock, so I use my whole strength to hold it ever since.
For the above reasons, parents should forgive their kids when they make mistakes.
Secondly, when children learn lessons form mistakes, they will have a deeper impression because they tried.
In schools, teachers usually let students to do practical work after teachers teach them the theory.
It is the same when the young make mistakes.
Even if a child do not believe parents' words about what they should not do, they would quickly understand if they tried and failed.
My uncle told my cousin not to play with electricity, but my cousin did not listen to him.
One day, my cousin put his thumb in to the plug, he was shocked by the electric current and sent to the hosipital.
My uncle told me that my cousin would never get close to the plug after he retrieved.
Last but not least, parents who allow children to make mistake usually have a harmonious relationship in their family.
Teenagers are usually curious and rebillious, so they seldom follow their parents' words.
Teenagers usually do things that their guardian prohibit them from, and when their parents find out, parents would only accuse them for doing it.
As a result, their relationship get worse and their children still do not listen to them.
In this case, if their parents allow them to make mistakes, they will turn over when they fail or hurt themselves, and they would follow their parents with out having conflicts with them.
All in all, permit children to make mistakes is vital in parenting.
It helps parents to be strongly bonded to their children for not following parents' words seems unwise after children make mistakes.
Children can also benefit that they can learn lessons from it.
I think this is a good idea.
Parents offer the more money for their school-age children,it's use improving their indipendence and management of money if they theach their children to profit money reasonably.
On the controry,children may want to more money and try to get it by the unormol way,even sometimes they will argue with parents,or stole money from parents or somewhere else.
So just parents have a good education and a tempered attitude,it will be ok.

Despite the rapid development of society, education is no more than a commonplace.
Recently, an interesting question has aroused heated discussion: Should teachers expose their social views to students during the process of teaching?
Some people think teachers' social and political views is also a kind of instruction.
Others claim that teachers would better only impass knowledge and not influence students' political views.
From my perspective, I agree with the statement that teachers should make their social or political views known to students.
My reasons are as follows.
To begin with, expostion of teachers' political views is kind of instruction to student, which leads to students' forming political conceptions.

It is a common phenomenon in my city that students are busy with their study tasks whole days with intensed nerves thus ignoring the knowledge of policy which is significent after graduating from school.
On the contrary, if the teachers expose the political views on specific things in the society, students will form political conceptions.

With the political knowledge, these students can paticipate actively in the conditions like voting for the leads of the city and affecting other important decesions which influence the future of the city, which is beneficial to both the development of the city and individuals.
On top of that, teachers' social views can prevent students from affecting by harmful views.
Becasue of the immature mental condition, adolecents are not able to identify the harmful views in the society.
They are likey to be influenced by the wrong views without protection and instruction.
However, teachers social views can play the role of correcting wrong views.
Knowing the political views of teachers, students are prone to compare different thoughts of policy thus finding the harmness of the wrong views.

For example, when I was in middle school, my math teachers liked to show her political thoughts of peace in classes, which prevent the thoughts of violence to influence students because students' comparing different thoughts.
Admittedly, there are some disadvantage of showing political views.
Because when teachers' political views are different from views from parents or the mainstream of society, the students will become confused, which is not good for personal development.
However, it also has some advantages like aftering reviewing different kinds of views, students are more likely to have they own conception of policy and society.
To put it into a nutshell, I agree that teachers should show their political or social views in the classroom.

Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate during the students:whether the teachers should be paid at least as much as doctors, laywers or business leaders are paid.
Opinions vary from person to person.
Some hold the opinion that the teachers should not be paid that high salary.
However contrary to this point is my perspective that the teachers should be paid in a salary as high as doctors, lawyers or business leaders.
My point can be elabrated as follows.
First, as we all know, the doctors, lawyers and business leaders are paid a high salary for these people are rare.
You need to be talented enough and spend a lot of time studying and practicing before you become a real doctor.
The teacher is also like this.
If you want to become a good teacher, you need to get a good grade in your final test of high school and go to a good university.
And if you want to teach students in a university, you even need to get a doctor degrees.
After graduted, you cannot become a teacher at once.
You have to face many tests before you enter a school.
You need to spend nearly the whole first year just listen how other teachers teach.
Then you can become a real techer.
For example, my father is a professor in the THree Gordes University.
He graduated from the WHU when he is only 19 years old.
After he became a doctor of physics, he also spent half a year to prepare for the class and listen to other professor's lessons.
Second, the teacher are important to the whole society.
As we all know, the students nearly spend 12 hours in the school.
So in some ways, the children even spend more time with their teachers than their parents.
And also, we all know that the teacher no only teach the students about the knowledge, they can also become the leader to the students and help the students become a kind and selfless person.
Contrary to the view, if the teacher is not paid in a high salary, there will be less people with good quality who want to become a teacher.
And fianlly, it will influence the children's quality and then influence the whole society.
Owing to the point i have mentioned above, the teachers should be paid in a high salary.

There is an increasing concern on whether the ability of arrangement ,or in other words, leadership is endowed with or not.
People form diverse backegroud hold mixed views on it.
As far as i am concerned,  desipte that those may have advantages of being a leader if they have talent in this aspect, it is possible for those without the talent to be  excellent leaders.

First of all, it is not a matter of being a leader but a good leader who has the ability to convince the group members and creat sense of belonging to the members if you say a person has leadership, which requires your perseverence.
Imagining you are working in a company, you must have a leader.
He may be an experienced manager who you worship very much.
However, there must be some new learders who may leave a negative impression on you at the begining.
But this is how the company works, the seniors leaders teach the fresh leaders how to guide the team.
During this process, a fresh leader can turn into a sophisticated manager,too.
I would like to illustrate it by giving an example of my collegues, who become my leader two weeks ago.
She entered to the company one year ago,and we just didi the same thing.
Thanks to the cultivation of our leaders, i witnessed how she learnt to bear responsibilities and how to became the core of our team from a freshman in the career.
Thus, leadership can be cultivated if you want to and you insist to it.
Adittionally, even for those who are born with mastering leadership, they have learned this from their parents or teachers.

If you are talented in this aspect, your teacher may let you become the monitor of the class, and your parents may let you arrange a family tour, which enrich your experiences of how to be a good leader.
This can be proved on myself.
I am regarded as a leader when i am in elementary school.
My teacher give me more chances to practice myself.
Some times i did something wrong, the teacher would teache me patiently.
Noting having provided this, no matter how talented you are, you may be a unacceptable leader in your class or in your group.
Admittedly, a person who masters leadership naturally can be a good leader easier, but he still needs to learn from some experiences to be an outstanding leader.
And there is no doubt that everyone can learn to be a leader only if he wants to be.
To conclude, not everyone is so fortunate to have leadership naturally, but everyone has the chance to learn how to be a leader.
Only if you can persist and learn from the daily experiences, you can be a leader.

Nowadays the economic crisis has been a topic for many people and it causes a topic that in order to reduce the expenditures,which kind should be reduced: police, library or public transportation.
This topic has divided people into three different camps with opposite opinions, and some would like to hold the opinion to reduce the expenditure of library or transortation.
However, when it comes to me, I prefer reducing the expenditures of police, and there are some reasosn and examples that can illustrate my opinions.
First and foremost, with the economic crisis, people will just put more energy in work in order to maek more money, then less criminals will be there.

To be more specific, since with the economic crisis, people will have less money as payment but they still have to pay for their food or gas fee, so they will just spend more time to find more jobs or just work harder, then people just have less energy to rob or do bad things, then in this way less police will be needed so the police can just be reduced.

In opposition, if there is still many police, the government have to pay for the salary of the police, and the police will not be busy but be free for most of their time since there are not many accidents waiting for them to deal, then in this way this kind of expenditures can be a waste.
In the second place, economic crisis makes it possible for the criminals to know that they don't have much chance.

sicne the biggest problem the police has to deal with is caused by thieves or robbers, but since it's economic crisis, the thieves or robbers know that there are not many chances since people will improve their ability to prevent robbing in order to decrease their living expenditures, then in this situation, thieves or robbers will just turn to find a job since in this way they can earn more, so the police will be less needed.

On the other hand, if the government spend the money on library, then people will have a better to study and their education degree will be improved, then the economic crisis may be solved more quickly since people are able to help the country get out of trouble by the knowledge they have acquired.

Granted, it may be reasonale and attractive that some people claim that the government should decrease the expenditure of library or public transportation, since with the economic crisis, people will be more likely to stay at home in order to save money, so the library or public transportation are not necessary.

However, it can not hold water, since people will just be more inspired to make money when ecnomic crisis comes, so people will need the library to hold a group meeting and they will take the public transportation more in order to find a chance to invest or find a job.
So I am still convinced by my standpoint that the government should decrease the expenditures of police.

Nowadays, an interesting discussion has arisen among the public: which career should people choose?
Following an ambitious dream or focus on achieving realistic goals.
From my perspective, I choose the latter one undeniably.
Here are the reasons I will explain.
Firstly, realistic goal is practical that people can make a detailed arrange.
As is known to all, everything starts from scratch.
To those people who want to chase their dreams, they have to make sufficient preparation.

A realistic goal is often accompanied with former experience and matural methods, whereas to chase an ambitious goal, people often have to deal with lots of unrealistic problem, which is hard for people to make a detailed arrangement.
For exemple, my uncle, a successful businessman, always focuses on a practical business.
He never tries to achieve any ambitious business, which is hard to make a percise plan.
Secondly, it is easier for people to abtain success if they choose realistic goals.
As I mentioned above, the realistic goals are easier to arrange.
It is also easier for people to abtain success, because the work for these goal is not challenging and people can follow the procedure patiently.
For exemple, many employees who have ambitious dreams are willing to challenge themselves to do marvellous projects.
When they are actually engaged in these projects, many of them are confused about the procedures and the direction of their progress.
So to make sure that one could finish the task and achieve the goal, it is better for him to choose a realistic goal.

admittedly, an ambitious dream seems appealing to people, however seldom people have made those dreams come true, at the same time, the feeling of failure will distroy the spirit of them which may result in more serious problems.
Taking everything in a nutshell, making a realistic goal is essential for people not only because they could make a detailed arrangement but aslo for a easier way to achieve success.
And making a realistic goal could make sure one would not make more serious mistakes.
In this day and age, some parents tend to praise their children's grades by using money since they will work harder in order to get that money.
However, from my own point of view, I do not regard this as an understandable behavior.
My opinion will be amplified by the following reasons.
First and foremost, money-praising method may be harmful to students.
This ia mainly because parents cannot control the flow of money, leading to students spending on smoking or even drugs.
This is extremely harmful not only to the student himself but also to the whole family.
A salient example of this can be seen in my friend's experience.
His academic performances were extremely perfect so in order to praise him, his parents gave him a large amount of money.
He studied in Harvard and during the summer session, he chose to study five courses only in two months.
So under mounting pressure, he had to rely on drugs.
But taking drugs spent him somuch money that he could not even afford the tuition in Harvard and now he dropped out of the classes and worked outside.
As the instance reveals, using money to praise children can lead to terrible consequences.
In addition, students may not work so hard in the future if their salary is not so satisfying.

This is largely due to the fact that students during their junior and senior high schools may depend heavily on their parents' money so if they could not land a great job that meets thier requirements, they will not pay much attention to it.
For example, one of my friends had abundant money when she was still a child since her parents would reward her by money.
But after she grew up, her abilities could not fit with her education, so many companies refused her.
She had to work in a small corperation where she could not get satisfying salaries.
As a consequence, sometimes she could not even meet her own needs, not to mention the heavy house rents in China.
Therefore, it is not a good idea to provide money for students if they get high marks.
It is true, to some extent, that it is a motivation for students if they get rewarded.
However, parents can offer them other choices to be rewarded, such as travelling.
My sister likes to travel, and every time she goes to a new place, she will gain.
Hence, she now is hired by a multinational corperations where she designs the front cover of the magazines.
In conclusion, students should not be rewarded by money, not only because it is harmful to them, but also due to the fact that it may influnence their future work.
If parents really want to reward them, they can take their kids to travel to enjoy the beautiful scenes and broader their horizons.

I aggree with the idea that workers are more satisfied when they have may different types of tasks to do during the workday than when they do similar tasks all day long.
This is based on my personal experience.
Admittedly, doing similar tasks all day long is easy for the workers and efficient for the employers.
A person doing one task learns and masters this job more easily and they can be quicker because they get more practice on one certain thing.
For a few pople, this may sound good because it is easy, it requires less thinking.
But are you still pleased with the job after doing the same work for a week, a month, or a year?
People will always get bored when doing one task repeatedly.
Although this is a quick and easy choice, it is not necessarily satisfying for the workers.
However, what if the workers are given different types of tasks to do during the workday?
I think it is even more efficient.
When I first entered high school, I piled all the reviewing job before the tests, in this way I hoped to concentrate on just one subject before the test.
However, I found it inefficient, because when I study for one topic without stop for a long time, my memory is used up and I cannot think.
With such a full mind I always get bad sleep before the test day and I cannot do my best during tests, due to lack of aleep and too much thoughts jammed into my mind.

After doing this for several times, I tried to spread the reviewing job into several days, and when I felt tired I can do some homework from other subjects to change my attention, and when I go back to reviewing I can learn more than before.
During the test, the brain is working better and the result is better than before.
I am still using this technique on my schoolwork and daily life, it is the best and most pleasant way for me.
Moreover, doing different types of tasks during the work day is challenging and creates a feeling of satisfaction.
For a worker, doing different tasks are more difficult than doing just one, because they don't get that much practice and therefore not that much experience.
They need to think: what should I do now?
What should I do next?
What can I do to become faster or better?
These are the challenges.
With those challenges the person will act more possitively, a better job will be done, and most importantly, finishing a challenge will bring a happy mood, so the workers will be more satisfied.
This is the same feeling as the pleasure of finishing a difficult math problem.
