For the chose between the two things I will chose the first one to play games or sports with children because to these things not only good for their healthy but also will bring many benefit to their social skills.
Firstly, playing games or sports will make the children's body become more healthy and cultivate the habbit of doing sports.
A lot of research shows that playing sports will stimulate the cycle of the blood and let the children eat much more than before.
By this way they will have enough nutrition support; so they will have very good sleeping.
In the next day, they can be concentrated on study and learn more useful information on the class.
Take my brother as an example, his parents was very busy and if they have time they, will take him to play some sports.
So my brother had the habbit to play sports and he was the tallest boy in the class.
Moreover he was the most exciting boy during the class.
Thus, I think play sports and games will bring a lot of benefits.
Secondly, playing games or sports will let the children know how to communicate with other more efficient.
A lot of games or sports need a group of people to coorperate, like basketball or football.
All of these games can not win by just one person.
By contrary, every member in this group must work hard and believe each other to achieve the goal.
So they must learn how to communicate with other very efficient; everyone must know what they should do, run or defent.
Some suggest that it is unnecessary for the old to study or learn new things like younger people do.
Personally speaking, I totally disagree with this statement and my viewpoint is based on the following reasons and examples
To begin with, if old people learn new things, their life will be much easier.
The development of advance technology significantly change people's life and make it easier than before.
However, most old people still stick to their old living habits which may cause some troble to their lives.
If the old can keep pace with the new technology, it will be much more convenient to their daily life.
Take my grandma as an example.
She is already seventy years old and never tries to learn new things.
As a result, when she wants to communicate with her old friends, she would write letters instead of using a cell phone.
That means that every time she needs to do a lot of stuffs, like writing the letter and going to the post office,  which is absolutely not a easy thing.
However, if she learns about how to use a phone, it will be much easier.
In addition, after studying the new things, the old will have more chances to enjoy their lives.
It is a common thing that nowadays plenty of old people suffer a sense of loneliness since their chilren rarely come back home.
Finding something that they really interested in can be helpful to reduce such feelings.
As a consequence, there is no doubt that it is important for the old to learn something new.
This point is beat illustrated with the example of my neighborhood.
He is not    such old man that we usually meet, who is already out of date.
I have to say that he is really a fashion person since he has a website in which he send his picture everyday and those pictures are really cool.
To put it in a nutshell, I am firmly in agreement with the claim that it is as important for older people to study or learn new things as it is for younger people.
This is because that it can help those old avoid the sense of loneliness and enjoy their lives.
Money incentive: a way-out?
Money incentive in education should never be encouraged.
In my opinion, if parents rely on this kind of way to get their kids to the study table, even though in the short run it may work; howerver, in the long run it will bring a lot of consequencies .

so far as I am co concerned, the high grade cannot represent all of the ability and poential that a student may have , it could be concluded that it can be for sure that grades determine and tells everthing about students.
The essence of the test is to measure the temporary study progress every student make in a certain period.
So firstly int his layer, it will be meaningless for parents to highlight the grades over anything else.
Secondly, I do think the money incentive is a bad idea for helping students to learn better or learn more.
The students who sometimes may cheat if they ernestly want the money from their parents, which will definately cause a ruinous cycle in the long run.
What's more, this kind of incentive will leave a bad impression on the students, they will unconsiciously think that money can buy anything, the purpose of study is to make more money!
How devastating attitude for the modern education career.
Anyway, some pros may state that, the money incentive will help the students to learn more because every student has their own dream which need to be achieved by money.
But I assume that every student dream such as buy a model car,  a pair of crystal high-heels, or a fantastic series of Harry Potter...
These things do have some connections with money,  but parents should never educate students to form a kind of "money-worship"attitude in a very young age.
They can change the reward method by directly give them a dreaming book or a pair of shoes instead of counting every score by money.

From these aspects, it may concluded that the parents are supposed to exert themselves to encourage their kids to study but I personally think that it never could be a good idea for them to offer school-age childern money for each high grade they get in school.
Although there may exist some reasonable points about give money reward, however, the disadvantages overweigh the advantages.
Money incentive is not a way-out, however, it will worsen the situation.
As society develops and civilizations moves foeward, one would expect to see more and more acts of kindness between strangers.
We would all like to think that people are growing more compassinonate.
However, this is not the reality we live in.
Compared to the past, I think today's people are less willing to help the struggling strangers.
Firstly, more and more people live in big cities nowadays.
Big cities train us to stop seeing others as human beings.
We encounter hundreds of people just taking the subway in the background.
Others may stand out as obstacles: the person who dones't let you pass on the escalator, or the begggar who asks you for money every time you're walking home tired from work.
Most of the time we are desensitized to those around us.
As a result, fewer and fewer people are willing to help strangers.
Secondly, people have to work harder for less money nowadays, so they're much less willing to part with their hard-earned cash.
For one thing, there's the recenty economic recession-a lot of people were recently laid off their jobs.
Those that could find often had to settle for work outside of their preferred fields.
So when people struggling to make ends meet are asked to help others, they may react negatively.
Granted, sometimes people today do demonstrate kindness towards others.
However, this is only really prevalent in smaller communities where people are more familiar with each other.
For instance, the other day, I forgot to bring my wallet while grocery shopping, and the owner of the store told me I could just pay her back later.
I am a regular customer at the store; if I were a stranger, I wouldn't have gotten the same treatment, since no store owner would trust a complete stranger to pay them back later.
People today are desensitized to others.
Due to recent economic troubles, they're also more likely to be only looking after their own interests.
Small acts of kindness may still be found here and there, but only if people are at least somewhat acquainted.
Nowadyas, people live in high-tech and high competitve life, people have a lot of intelligent equipments, such as moile phone, television and computer.
People are paying an increasing amount of attention to effects of movies and televison, people usually exhibit an air of uncertianty.
In my opinion, I think that movies and television have more positive effects than negative effects on the way young people behave.
First of all, young people watch moive and television can make them release pressure after work and school.
Their pressure comes from the competition their classmates and collegues.

Recently, there is a heated discussion regarding whether the celebrities' opinions are important to younger people or older people.
Altitudes towards this issue vary from individuals to induviduals.
There is a common conception that the opinions of celebrities play a more important role in older people.
However, from my perspective, I strongly believe that the  celebrities' opinions are more significant to younger people.
My view will be explained by analyzing the following reasons.
One reason why I am in favor of the point is that younger people are tend to follow the famous celebrities' opinion without any identification.
This is largely due to the fact that the famous entertainers' decent looking will confuse the younger's sights.
They will take some actions to reply the celebrities' opinions, even they will asked to take drugs.
Taking my sister for an example, when she was in middle school, she liked a famous singer and became a fan to the singer.
Unfortuntly, the singer always put some pictures on Weibo and claimed many beneficials to take drugs.
As a big fan of the singer, my sister started to take drugs.
As a results, she dropped out from her school and missed the time to study.
As the example shows, younger people are more easily to accept the opinions from the celebrities without any thinking.
Another reason used to support my opinion is that younger people have more opportunities to contact with famous people.
It is because the sciences and technologies have developed rapidly.
Younger people are allowed to kown the celebrities' opinions immediately.
For example, the applications like WeChat have some abilities to create a group talking between the younger people and the famous people.
If younger people have some troubles to deal with, the famous people will give some advices to them immediately.
In addition, younger people always trust the celebrities and are more willing to listen to the opinion from the famous people.
Admittedly, the opinions of celebrities have plenty of effects to older people.

However, older people have experienced something in their daily life and have the abilities to identify which the opinions they accept, which allows they to absorb the merits from the opinions and avoid some drawbacks from the opinions.
Therefore, the celebrities' opinions are less important to older people.
To sum up.
the opinions of celebrities are more significant to youner people.
Not only will younger people accept the opinions without identification and imitate easily but also they have more medias to be touch with the celebrities' opinions.
It is well-advised that younger peope should be more carefully when facing the opinions of celebrities and choose the advantages of the opinions to learn.

Parents all expect their chidren are mature and responsible enough to pursue a happy life.
To be mature and responsible, there are supposed to be a self-reform stage,which usually begin with mistakes.
Some parents are willing to let their children fall and let them learn from their own mistakes, while the others are trying to prevent the mistakes from happening.
As far as I am concerned, letting children err and letting children learn are definately the effective way for them to grow.
To start with, it is the approriate opportunity for chidren to reflect on their own behaviors.
Everyone makes mistakes.
Mistakes ,in most cases, can also brings value such as practice experience as long as children can have a thorough consideration about it.
No matter how much parents tell to their children, it is less efficient than learning from their own errors.
For it is the real case that happened in their real life, they can imerge themselfs into the circumstance to have a deep insight of the whole mistakes.
Moreover, it assits children to accumulate the experience for the future events.
Sophisticated adults are experts for handling tough daily issue due to their abundant working experience and life wisdom.
Children has to prepare for the challenge the society provied in their coming years.
By making mistakes and learning from it, children could figure out the rules existed in the world and the solutions to the similar situations, which is only beneficial to their future life.
However, some may question the probably severe impact of mistakes on the  children and also the necessity for parents' guidance.
In my view, children shall learn to deal with their own mistakes independently for it is a step for them to grow as well.
After all ,the life path ahead of them is their own way that cannot be changed by the force of parents.
To err anf to learn is the preparation they have to finish by themselves to face the larger burden of responsibility in the later time .
Gothe onces said that man errs so long as he strives.
Learning from their own mistakes is the first step the children shall know in their life.

Issues related to work style have never failed to attract people's attention.

Recentlty, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among people whether it is more important to work swiftly and take a risk making mistakes than to work slowly and make sure everything is alright.
Answers vary from one to another.
Some people claim that peopple should work quickly and it is worthwhile to take risks.
However, contrary to their view comes my own perspective that people should take it slowly and ensure every part of the things functions right.
My view point is based on the following points.
First,working slowly to make sure everything is alright could actually save time and then increase their efficiency, which indeed promotes the success.
To be more specific, ensuring every part of tasks functions correctly could definitely decrease the mistakes duting the work.

Under this circumstance, avoiding making mistakes could certainly save the time spent on correcting the errors which results that people could work more efficiently than their opponents and  realize their goals earlier.
However, those who work fast cannot guarantee they could not make errors.
Despite that they seem to have faster completion than others, they may spend more time fixing the mistakes, which actually decrease their efficiency.
For example, I have formed a habit of examing every questions after I figure it out when I deal with my math exams.
It seems slow and a waste of time at first but actually it could apparently enhance the rate of rightness and decrease the time speent later Ireexamine
Second, working slowly and making sure everything is correct could also help people accumulate good reputation, which would promote their success.
Specifically,  the outcomes or products made by those who work slowly and carefully examine every stage of producing process are generally of good quality.
In this way, the products of good quality would gradually set a good industry example in the consumers' mind, which would accumulate the companies or individual's reputation.
Consequnetly, their work would be popular or thought highly by others.
For example, my uncle owns a company which sells some particular artworks.
My uncle's company produces only a few pieces of artworks every month because my uncle wants to guarantee the quality of his products.
Although it seems too slow to do this busineess, his company gradually accumulates great reputation for its beautiful look and durable quality.

In conclusion, people should work slowly and assure everything is correct, which could not only increase work efficiency  but also help people accumulate good reputation, which is conducive to their success.
Personally I agree that parents should let children make mistakes and learn from their own mistakes.
There are two specific reasons that present my opinion.
First of all, making mistakes is the way to understand your own disadvantages.
There are not any children that are perfect in the beginning.
Children are full of passion to try new things and keep reaching their own climates.
During this period, they will fall or slide down like climbing mountains.
Making mistakes let them know that they still have space to develop, and they are not good enough.
It is a good way to let them know that making mistakes is not ashmed, and they will get stronger and more resistant by sufferring these experience.
Secondly, learning from mistakes helps them getting better.
As we all know, parents will not stay with their children in their whole life.
So it seems to be more important to teach children how to solve their own problems by themselves, but not helping them to solve all the time.
When children making mistakes, it is good for parents to ask them how to prevent it next time.
For example, if children drop from bikes, parents should not be nervous but telling their children don't cry and stand up.
Learning from mistakes is a great worthy ability for living in the community independently.
If someone only makes mistake but not try to learn from it, then he is the failure.
I have heard someone said, "Making mistakes is not creepy, what creepy is that he just let it go but not to learn from his mistakes."
Every great man had his or her experience learning from mistakes.
All in all, parents are the best teachers for their children to help them being a better man from learning in their mistakes.
In this social,many parents offer money to their children for supportting to get high grades.
They think this is a good way to make their children study harder to have a higher mark.
However, I don't think it's a method to encourage children.
In fact,this behavior will form a really bad habit and give children a incorrect sense of money.
With the development of economy,more parents are able to meet their children's needs by money.
So fewer children can understad the value of the money.
In this circumstance,if parents give money as a gift,when their children grow up,they will also waste money and buy more goods they don't even need because they think they worth it.
Take my cousin as a example,my uncle adore his only son very much,so he give my cousin everything he wanted.
My cousin's grades not very high,in his 40's class,his grade's always ranked 40th.
But sometimes when he got 39th in his class,his father would very happy and give him much money,so my cousin think his 39th worth this money.
Even now,he graduated from college,when he didn't have money, he will ask money from his father.
Why he take it as granted?
I think he consider he successfully graduated from college for his father,so his father owe he this money.
That's why I don't suport this behavors,studying and having high grades are duties for students,parents don't need to force children to study by giving they money.
What parents need to do is letting childrens know that studying is for themselves,not for anyone else like their parents,and they will accomplish their dreams in the future by studing hard.
When seeking for and choosing a job, the content of the is always taken into consideration, especially the diversity of the tasks.
While some people prefer to do varities of tasks to challenge themselves, others would like to do the simple task again and again to make them more familiar with that task.
As far as I am concerned, the varities of tasks wil benifit the workers in many aspects.
Firstly, different types of tasks can be more interesting and lead to the workers happy mood.
Sometimes when workers deall with the simple jobs all day long, they will definitely feel boring, but with lots of challenge to deal with, the workers can fulfill themselves and challenge themselves.

For instance, when my mom got her first job as an editor , all she had to do is to reading writers' passages and correct the mistakes, she felt upset and disappointed though her got a high salaries, she thought it was too boring.
So latter she talked to her boss and the boss agreed  to let her do several tasks together, like taking photos and make some design for the books' cover.
That was difficult for her, but she just struggled to do that.
When she finally did it well, she felt happy and being encouraged by her work.
Secondly, different types of jobs can make workers relax and encourage workers to improve their efficiency.
The monotonous work will lower the workers' efficiency because when people are doing the same jobs again and again, they will be exhausted, and there is more chances for them to make some mistakes.
Different tasks can refresh workers mind.

For me, when I studied English last summer to get a job of teaching children English, at first  I spent all day in reading part, then I felt very tired, I thought my brain was all a mess at last, and I couldn't think at all.
So I changed my methods to spend equal time in reading, listening and speaking, my effeciency was improved that way.
And take this in to workes, I think it works the same way.

Rencently, an interesting topic have aroused a heated debate among our public: whether people should follow their ambitious dream or focus on achieving realistic goal.
The answers vary from person to person.
Some people think they prefer to go for the ambitious dream.
However, I believe that it is wiser to choose realistic goal in my life.
TO begin with, the realistic goal allows people to have consistant passion to go for it.
As we know, the realistic goal always involve our basic demand of life, such as the salary we want to get, the grade that the students want to reach.
Facing the fundemental requirment, we tend to achieve it in the short time and it actually does not hard to get compared with the ambitious dream.
So we are more likely to keep passion untill we reach these goal.
In contrast, if we prefer to go for the ambitious and unrealistic dream, we do not know whether it can come true eventually.
Thus, facing the endless of destination, we are hard to persist it.
For example, when I was preparing for the exam in order to enter an elite university.
In a 3 month, I held the goal in my mind that I can enter the unversity and I tried my best to revise the knowledge.
The result is I achieved the goal after three month.
Furthermore, going for the realistic goal is conducive to planning the next step in our life.
This is because realistic goals always are earier to achieve and when we get them we can set up next realistic goal, which allows us to move forward to have a better life.
On the contrary, the ambitous dreams always are far away from our basic life, including improving our society or electing to the presidents.
For example, when I entered into my favourite unversity, I planned to get high GPA in order to apply for a better graduate school.
It can be imagined that after I enter the graduate school I will plan to search a decent job.
From them on, I will have a high standard life.
To sum up, achieving realistic goal is a wiser opition.
this is because we always have passion and it can lead to a better life.

The past few years have witnessed the fact that the prssure burdened on children have become heavier gradully.
In order to put their children at a priority stage in school, many parents force the kids to spend more time doing homework or engaging in sports.
So here comes a debate that whether children should be given more time doing whatever they want?
From my perspective, I do not think this method is a better choice for kids.
Here are some examples to illustrate my view of point.
First of all, doing homework can help children receive higher grades in school.
Typically, teachers will assign some homework related to the content taught in the class.
When children are doing these assignments, they will try to recall what have been taught during the day, which can enhance their grasp of the knowledge.
So they are likely to get higher grades in examinations.
On the contrary, if children just do whatever they want such as playing computer games or watching TV when at home, they will quickly forget the knowledge taught in the class.
For example, my friend Kenneth used to play computer games as soon as he got home back from school, seldom finishing the homework.
So he always had a poor performance in exams.
However, having realized the importance of study, he managed to give up computer games and do homework on time.
It does not take a long time that he made huge progress in gades.
What is more, participating in sports activites can guarantee a healther body for children.
After a full day's study, students may feel tired mentally.
If they can join a sport activity, their minds can be relaxed and their body can be strenthened.
However, if the let the children do whatever they want, they are likely to choose to lie on the sofar, eating snacks and watching TV, which can do harm to their health.
Imagine that A boy who studies during the school time and still sitting on a chair when at home, he is likey to become fat and get some diseases related to a lack of exercise.
Admittedly, we can not stifle the interests of children.
But that does not means we can let them do whatever they want most of the time.
In fact, parents can set aside some time to let the kids to do so.
In conclusion, I do not think children should be let to do whatever they want

With the globalization of the world and the boost of local economy, travelling has become more affordable for many people.
There are some considerations that every one can take into account when planning their trips, that is, whether it is better to travel in their own country.
Some might contend that travelling in one's own country is more economic and convenient, making the trip more pleasant.
However, I would like to suggest that travelling abroad is more meaningful.
To begin with, toutists can experience distinct cultures by travelling to another country.

Although it is also interesting to look at different local customs and traditions in a single country, there might be different types clothes, landscapes, or even ingredients for food that can never be found in the home country of the travelers.
Hence, having a trip in foreign countries truly reveals the diversity of human civilization and is particularly benefit for boosting mutual understanding between various cultures.
Moreover, the opportunity to practice foreign languages is also a noticeable reason.
At present, it is not uncommon for people to find native speakers as foreign language teachers in their own countries.
Nonetheless, they should always bear in mind that talking to people in a foreign country is a totally different experience.
For instance, when I traveled to the UK last year, I found it is difficult to order food in restaurants, since people there tended to speak faster and less clear in daily life.
If young adults had the chance to travel in a foreign country for several couple of weeks, they would fefinitely make remarkable pregress in their oral language.
Last but not least, economy is an additional argument comes to mind.
In a relatively developed country, travelling can be quite expensive, like booking for hotel or buying tickets.
So it might be a wonderful choice for people to go countries where commodities are not that expensive.
They actually face less economic burden in those countries, and as a result, thay can make the trip even more enjoyable.
However, that is also a good challenge for them to imrove and use the economic knowlege that they learned, provides that they still go to the developed country.
Here is a example given by my friend, my friend was invited to the USA by his cousin.
Firslt, he planed to book the luxary hotel and the vehicle but he found that his father just gave him three hundred dollar as the travelling fee.
So he tried his best to regulate the money.
Finally, when he came back , there were still twenty dollar last.
Due to the aforementioned ground, I firmly believe that it is a wise decision for people to travel to foteign countries, instead of traveling demestically.
Today, there is a hot topic: whether it is neccessary for young people to gain the ability of organizing and planning due to the complex modern life.
Answers vary from people to people.
Some people think that the young are not suppose to learn how to plan and organize things.
Contrary to their views comes my perspective that the ability of planning and organizing plays a vital role in young people's mordern life.
To begin with, being good at organizing and planning helps the young have good performance on study or work.

It is acknowledged that the ability of organization make things in order, which can help people to distinguish the urgent events from unimportant things, thus they can address their assignments effectively and efficiently, then comes the good performance of work and study.
For example, my monitor in high school is a people who is good at organization.
The ability helps him solve problems one by one from the emergence to the normal issues, which makes him be awarded as the most excellent student per year.
Secondly, young people who learn the ability of planning can keep balance of life and work.
To be specific, in modern life, the young is under high pressure of overwelming assignments of studying and working.
A well-organized people can separate the study or work to their entertainment, which benefits he or she to really enjoy their life in each condition.
By contrast, if people cannot plan their life, too much work would let them stressed out.
Their distraction on entertainment prevent them from finishing task quickly.
In this case, they cannot play well or work great neither.
In general.
I think young people should study planning and organizing skill which helps them have a better life in modern society.

Nowadays there is a popular issue that whether it is the core of improving the education of universities by spending more money on salaries for professors of universities.

Some of them hold that colleges should not spend more money on the salary of professors bacause they are already have a higher salary than many peopple in other professions.
In mt opinion, however, it must be difinitely for professor to have a higher salary, and my reasons are given below.

Although spending more money on the salaries for universities professors could cause a problem or even a shortage to the college a economic pressure, this would be still worthwhile sacrifice for a better education of all of students.
First and foremost, the professors would like to have more patience and being more likely to help students.

Maybe it is not sounds good to describe, but it is the fact in such a society.
Because professors will gain more money, they must become happier and merrier and to be positive to do their work and that will must be high efficiency.
And this not only has benefits for professors but also better for all of the students because we can study in a more efficient class.
Moreover, increasing the salary of professors also enable professors have a closer relationship between students.
It is not hard for professor to pay more attention and more time to educate students, and this will enable students and professor to have more time and opportunities to communicate.
Then the whole campus would be a happier college which contains nice professors and students.
From the above illustrations, at the very least, although the conomy of campus is fairly significant, to consider the concept of education, the college should sacrifice all they could pay.

When I was in high school, my chinese teacher leave me a deep impression not for his wonderful aprreciation in articles or  his devote into class but the radical opinion about social or political news.
In my mind, spending lots of time in expressing his own subjective and radical views is waste of time and this behavior will also exert bad influence to students own thinking.
Firstly, spending lots of time in unrelated things is not appropiate for teachers in class.
In China, studying pressures is not only from peers competence but also from the heavy studying tasks.
In a class, only 45 minutes, students may need to learn a whole chapter about caculus or to appreciate a long classic essay wrote by Lu Xun.
Obviosly, it is hard job for teachers and students.
Thus, spending the class time in unrelated topic will lead to negative influence to what they should finish in this class.
Not only students cannot fully undersdand the content which may caus misunderstanding in other topic,  but also they need to spend much more than 45 minutes to learn by themselves.
Just like what my Chinese teacher did in my high school, when he needed to explained the examination or textbooks, he always digressed and talked about his own view about recently social news.
Consequently, the average Chinese grades in my class reduced significantly.
Secondly, teachers own social or political view may be too radical to build right values in students.
When they talke about their own view, they will just express their own intact thought without thinking twice.
It is hard for them to distinct which is suitable for students and which is not.
Some radical view just present in front of students without screening.
These radical views will influence students own values, such as my Chinese teacher think all crimes shoud be exerted, which is too boo

Admittedly, sometimes teachers social or political view can attract students and even sometimes those view can help students understand social phenomenon and arise their independent thinking about social.
But it is hard for teachers to measure the degree exactly.
To sum, I admit that sometimes teachers own view can help students.
However, that may greatly influence the normal class and even cause negative influence to students own values
I think this is not always a good idea.
It depends on occasions.
And I may explain some of the situations that is easily noticed in my perspective.
If a student can get more enthusiastic in study when awarded money for his grade mark, this method seesms very effective.
But things are not always what we expected.
For instance, If a child is rewarded money in terms of his grade mark, he may try extreme ways in getting a higher grade mark.
He may spend more time in studying how to get a higher paper mark than studying how to get more knowledge.
The extreme ways as I mentioned may go as cheating, such as using phone searches or conspiring with others in an exam.
This is definitely not what the reward is for.
This is just one angle of all the drawbacks of the money-rewarding-encouraging system.
I reckoned that there must be more hidden effects.
You may think it a deal, in which your child pays his efforts and win your money.
You may only judge his efforts by his grade marks brought home in the end of every semester.
But you don't realize that you are teaching him a wrong concept,that studying is not for skills but for money.
This thought may be useful when you are teaching him Capitalism, right?
This method may be improved, as I concerned.
Why use money, a symbol of capital and business?
You had better get your kid know that he or she is studying for him or herself, but not for what he/she gets in his/her hands right after each examination.
Instead I think you can give them reward in spiritual forms.
You may promise a boy a trip into the nature, you may present a book to your little girl that she always wants to read.
In this way, your child can know that studying is for knowledge and skills, with which they're capable for social works later when they enter the society.
I think a rewarding system is necessary in encouraging a child to learn, but you should give them right things as rewards.
These things are aimed at digging out their further interests for the world they are getting to know, but not telling them that they are going for the rewards themselves.
They are going for their life.
Money-oriented minds are what we hatred today, but in this method we may inperceptibly push the idea into our children's minds.
It's a controversial idea.
It is good on some occasions, but on other occasions we must make some special change in the rewards we are giving our children.
It must be an inspiring thing, not a compensation for his sacrifice, as I emphasized.

More and more parents give thier children money to buy what they want,but how much the kids should get from their parents is a little difficult to decide.
Therefore, their parents choose a very fair way that the money is depended on their acadmic performance.
In my opinion, it is not a very scientific means to select,but we can not find another way to decide.
From an ancient time, the workers got their income from the employers.
If the employee finished a perfect job, they could get more than the other who did worse.
This behavior is very fair to the all people,so do the parents.
If the children want to get money to satisficate themselves, they have to work better and their work is to study.
Because the parents can not accompany their kids to study at the school,so they can't spy on the kids to see if they do a good job,but they can judge from the result of the school life.
The result is their grade of each subject they study.

Becasue of the difficulty of each subject, it is hard to study by themselves without listening to the teachers, so if they want to get a high mark ,they need to try their best to follow the teachers every class.
Therefore, the high mark they got is the sign of working hard.
And they are supposed to be awarded for their hard working.
Meanwhile, it also teaches their kids that if they want to own what they want they have to work hard.
It is not impossible to achieve their dreams,but if they do not try their best, they may fail and lose the chance to get higher.

As I mentioned above, offering the school-age children for each high mark they get in school is not very scientific,but it is  the most suitable way for the parents to decide the money and teach their kids the truth of the society.

Energy conserveation has been a concern for many people and it causes a topic that whether the most effective way for goernment is to encourage energy conservation is increasing the price of gasoline and electricity.
This debate divides people into different camps with different opinions, and some people would like to hold the opinion that increasing the price of gasoline and electricity is a good way.
However, when it comes to me, I consider funding researchers on new energy sources is better.
First and foremost, new energy sources makes it possible for people to save more energy.

To be more specific, since there are new energy sources, when people drive their car or take the public traffic, the pollution will be less sicne the new energy is solar and wind power which doesn't have bad effects on the environment.

In opposition, if the government spend nothing on the new energies, people will just use gas as their main sources to drive cars, and thsi can cause great dioxide released by the car will affect the environment a lot and cause global warming.

For example, according to one of my father's friends, who always driving a car that depends on the electricity as power source, he says that when he drives this car, it will releases less carbon dioxide to the environment, and then the environment can be protected in an efficient way.
In the second place, with more new energy sources, the government can get more access to fame that will bring them money to develop more new sources.

This is because when a country and other countries will pay them a lot since this technique can protect the environment a lot, they then will have mroe money that can not gain more fame, but also they can use this money to develop even more new energy sources that can protect the environment.

This pattern will finally lead to a good circle that can help spend no money on new sources, then when other countries have developed the method to utilize the solar or wind energy, they can just play to use this, in this way it will even cost them more and bring a heavy burden to this country in the long term.

Granted, it may be reasonable and attractive that some poeple claim that the goernment should encourage energy conservation by increasing the price of gasoline and electricity, since if the price of gasoline is increased, then less people will drive a car to go out which will be beneficial to the environment a lot.
However, it cannot hold water, since nowadays people's lives are really busy, so some poeple will still dirve a car to go out.
So I am still convinced by my standpoint that  funding researchers on new energy sources is better.
Nowadays, most workers are under much pressure of  work everyday.
Some people claims that they might feel more satisfied when they have a lot of different types of tasks to work on in the workday than when they do the same works in the whole day.
On the contrary, other people disagree with this statement.
In my opinion, it is more beneficial to workers to do many different tasks all day long.
Admittedly, doing the tasks during the workday also has advantages.
workers could be able to have a lot of spare time to do activities they want.
They can watch movies, play computer games, watch TV programs and so on.
But in my point of view, working on the tasks all day long has more benefits for workers.
First and foremost, doing the works in the whole day could enable workers to finish their tasks better.
This is because they have more time to work on their works.
For example, I have a aunt who is a middle school's teacher in my town.
She works very hard everyday because she needs to prepare her teaching tasks and correct students' homework.
Because she does these things all day long, she is able to do these things very well.
As a consequence, she could attain much more salaries than other teachers.
So it turns out that doing the tasks all day long could allow workers to finish their work better.
Secondly, working on the tasks in the whole day can also let workers relax themselves.
This is because it is not too tired if workers can do their work slower than those who works only in the worktime.
For instance, I have a cousin who is a computer programmer.
He is required to finish numerous tasks everyday.
However, he does not have to do all of them in his worktime because he always does them in his whole day.
Consequently it is not too tired.
So in my opinion, doing the works all day long could allow workers to relax.
In conclusion, I firmly believe that working on the tasks all day long is very beneficial to workers because it could let them relax and do their tasks better.

Nowadays friendship has been a concern for many people and it cuases a topic that whether compared with the ability to make new friends easily, the ability to maintain friendship with a small group of people is more important and decides your hapiness.
This debate divides people into different groups with opposite opinions, and some people would like to hold the opinion that making new friends easily is more important and decides hapiness.
However, when it comes to me, I consider maintaining friendship with a small group of people is more important is more important.
First and foremost, maintaing friendship with a small group of people makes it possible for people to be happier because of they help they receive.

To be more specific, when people have a small group of people, they can spend most of time together, then they can get to know more about each other, so they will have a good friendship in the long term, so everytime when they meet trouble or want to go out for fun, their frineds will always be there and can help them a lot or go out to play with them together.

In opposition, if they have quite a lot of friends, then the time they can spend with every friend is actually very few, so they may know very few about each other, and they can not get help at all when they meet some trouble.

For example, one of my my friends, who only has a small group of friend, he can talked a lot with every of his friends, and once when he lost some money and need to borrow money, he borrowed money from his friends and his friends are all willing to lend him becasue they trust him.
In the second place, with a small group of people, people get more access to better study in order to help them gain happiness.

This is because when people only have a small group of friends, although they may spend a lot time with every friend, but since the total number of friends is not much, so they will have more time for studying, and which can help theml learn a lot and find a job easier in the future, as a result of that, their happiness in the future will get increased.

In opposition, if they have a lot of friends, they may spend too much time with them which leads to a bad result that they have no time for studying, so they will learn much less than those who has a small group of people.

Let' s take one of my father's friends as an example, who he was in colledge, he only has a small group of friends, so he spent less time with friends and more time to study, as a result, today he lives a very good life.

Granted, it may be reasonable and attractive that some people claim that the ability to make new friends easily is more important, since with more friends, they will have more chances to start a business or make an investment in the future.

However, it cannot hold water, since their new friends only known them for a small amout of time like a few months, so their friends are unlikely to give them chances to make an investment and start a business together.
So I am still convinced by my standpoint that maintaining friendship with a small group of people is more important is more important.
There are a various rangs of jobs in the world.

On the other hand, different types of tasks are interesting and fresh for workers.

My View on Prarents' Way of Rewarding Children
Praise is a good way to motivate students.
Many parents have their own way to encourage their children to work hard on thier study and make great success.
There even some parents offer money as a praise to their school-age children.
As far as I am cincerned, money can never be a good way to motivate people.
The reasons are as the flowing:   First of all, giving students money may makes them feel that money is of great importance.
It will not help them to cultivate a proper and health outlook of money.
On the other hand, students may spend  the money on some useless or unnecessary things.
Secondly, students may not fully motivated just by receiving money and if they don't want money, they will pay less attention on their study.
Thirdly, there are many ways of motivation, for example, we can take them to a place they have been longing for a long time, or we can ask them what kind of gift they want most.
In this case, students will work harder and harder in order to get what they want and at the same time they will relize that their efforts is rewarding.
We all know clearly that money is essential to everyone's subsistence.
We can not deny that giving students money can stimulate them to pay more attention on their study to some degree.
However, from a long term, we need to come up with a more attractive and meaningful method to boost their learning.
That means patents should always care what their children needs and never use simple but useless or even harm ways to encourage their children.
Parents should help students foster a right attitude towards money and give more help and guidences on their study.
Nowdays, there is a kind of phenomenon that children are receiving money from their parents.
I often hear from the disagreement to this fantastic idea, for they think children are too young to own money.
Indeed, they should not possess much money, but they can benefit, if they gain little money for high grade.
Thus, I prefer to agree with the good idea that parents can offer their school-age children money for high mark.
First of all, children will be encouraged if they receive rewards like money.
During teenage, children are at the time when they are willing to study for the interest.

Imaging that if a child always gets the best grade in his class, but receives no rewards or the ones that do not fit him, what will he feel, and what is the motivation for him to continue to study hard?

Parents are always considering that they understand their kids enough, but the fact is that parents merely know what the kids really need, because the choices of themselves are something they really want.
Therefore, it is better to give their money to buy what they really want instead of giving nothing or making the choices by parents themselves.
Moreover, giving the money to the kids can help children develop the ability of financial control.
One day, children will become adults, so they will face the problems that how to earn money and how to save money.
If parents give the money to children as the prize, they will regrad these money as something they earn.
As long as parents teach them some financial skills, they will cultivate a good view of money.
Since only after experiencing the difficulties of earning money, children will understand how important to save money, and this virtue will help them become successful.
To sum up, although giving money to the children as rewards will bring some disadvantages, there are more benefits than we normally expect.
It is compelling that if parents and children carry out this behavior in a right way, children will derive tons of advantages in their future life.
I agree with this stastement, as we all know everybody make mistakes.

This is a epoch that goverments play a more and more important part in daily routine.
And there are a lot of fields that needs governments' financial support to push the program to a further way.
When it comes to goverment,we have to talk about how the government to spend their money.
There is a specific question whether it is more important for government to spend money on improving the Internet access than on commual transportation.
From what I have been through,I firmly hold the belief that it's important for government to better the Internet access.
The reasons are as follow.
The construction of Internet will cost a lot of money.
The better the Internet access is,the more information everyone will get from the computer,And with more information people get,they can enhance their skills and knowlege.
In this way,they can harvest the apple from the peak of the successful tree,Taking my friend,Josh,as an example to illustrate my perspective.
He is man who usually uses computer as a tool to gain the information he needs.
When he was a child,he used to go to the library to learn something that could not learn in school.
But the update of information was too fast to follow by only using the resource in the library.
When he grew older,he found that using Internet to learn something new was a more convenient way and the Internet could provide something library could not provide.
Up to now,he likes to using computer to serach the information,but he thinks there still are a lot of improvement people can do to make the Internet better.
The another reason for my opinion is that Internet access construction is a huge program.
There is few corporation has fund and time to make endeavours to improve the Internet.
Moreover,the better the Interner access is,the more people are willing to use it.
In this way,government can increase their revenue by improving the Internet access.
For example,in the past,when the Internet came to China,there were few people to use it and the profit of this industry was low.
But,things change a lot.
Now,there is an increasing number of people who are willing to use compuer at home.
So,if the government can improve the access of Internet,it will increse the user of computer and more and more people will spend money in computer.
And then the government can maks a profit.
From what I have refered above,we have to admit the fact that it is important for government to improve Internet access and it is more significant than public transportation.
There is a saying goes nowadays that people today are more willing to help the struggling strangers.
In the newspaper or on the TV, we can often see some reports that a boy jumps into a river bravely to rescue someone who fell into the river carelessly.
We also see some news that one man gives all his money to the students who can not afford to go to school.
I agree on this statement for the following reasons.
First of all,we can see that the amount of people willing to help others increased greatly in the past ten years.
Take NGO for example.
There are many None Government Organaization nowadays,who are determined to help people in need all around the world.
They help African children by offering food and water.
They give medical treatment to people who live in less developed countries for free or charged very little money.
They try their best to save endangered animals like tigers in Asia so to protect the environment,which is vital for every one.
The amount of this kind of people increased day by day,we can see there are more then a hundred NGOs all over the world.
I am often deeply moved and encouraged by those person,because they are selfless and always willing to help.
This is the most obvious evidence for the statement that people today are more willing to help the struggling strangers.
Secondly,with the great development of the technology and economy,people today become more abled to help struggling strangers.
We can not only offer other money or food,but also provide technological services.
For example,when someone get lost in a strange city,if we don't have a smart phone,it will be very hard to show them the way.
But with the development of varies APPs,wecan easily show them a picture or map of the city,so that he can find the way easily.
In the past,many people were willing to help,but they didn't know what to do.
Nowadays,there are many ways and methods to help others,so people are more inspired to help strangers.
Lastly,with the development of the internet,people can share their experience of helping others on the social net work.
This can help a lot to encourage people become more kind-hearted.

When we see what people do on the internet,like helping an old struggling lady or a missing child who can't find his parents,we are often deeply moved and begin to consider what we can do in our daily life.
Take a story in wuhan for example.
A girl posted a picture of an old lady sitting near a trainstation,whose daughter were badly injured in a fire.
The old lady makes flowers and dolls everyday,trying to sell them to get her daughter cured.
But she can't find a good way to sell them and has a miserable life.
However,after the girl posted the picture of her on the internet,many people are willing to buy those flowers and dolls online to help the poor lady,so she sells about a hundred flowers now everyday.
This story are a very good example of the benefit of internet in making people more willing to help.
Althoug many people argue that the many people are selfish nowadays,I still believe that there are more people who are willing to help.
And I will also try my best to help the struggling strangers around me.
Maybe I can started by offering some food and water to the homeless people who can only sleep in the park and sleep on a newspaper.
Now I am a student,but I believe I can do more things when I go to work.

Is it a common scene to you that crazy fans tend to endeavor to defend their idols' opinions of all kinds of media like Twitter?
In addition, most of these crazy fans are young people.
Older people, on the contrary, are more mature than young ones.
They tend to have formed their own value systems, which means that they are inclined to what they believe and will be less influenced by the opinions from celebrities.
All in all, I fully believe the opinions of celebrities are of greater significance to young people than old ones.
First and foremost, young people tend to be more naive and more likely to be inspired by the 'nice' words said by celebrities.
On the contrary, older people will care less about what celebrities have said, because they know the opinions don't apply to all conditions.
For instance, there are two basketball players.
One is 10 years old while the other is 20 years old.

If they are both aware that Kobe Bryant once contributed his success to his diligent practice starting from 4 a.m. in the morning, the younger boy is prone to act like Kobe did if he wants to get the same achievements.
But for the older boy, things are differing.

He must have undergone some failures through his sports career and he is aware that there are many other keys to success other than hard work, like genius, innate potential as well as good opportunities.
Therefore, chances are that he will possibly stick to the former training plan which suits him best.
In brief, the younger boy is more inclined to be inspired than the older one.
The similar situation comes to celebrity brandings.
If a product is sponsored by a superstar who people adore, the product shows a tendency to be more welcomed.
When Stephen Curry becomes the spokesman of Vivo, a Chinese mobile phone brand, a great quantity of young girls who adored Curry for his loveliness scrambled to buy the phones.
They'd like sponsor their idol with the purchasing behavior.

Nevertheless, older people are more rational and they are aware that the price of the phone will increase after the introduction of Curry and they are less willing to pay for the plus brought by celebrity charm, so they will turn to other brands with higher cost performance.

With the fast-changing development of society and economy, high-level education has become an increasingly signifcant role, which provides numerous qualified workers and employees for factories and companies.
Nowadays, some people come up with a solution to improve the quality of education.
That is offer more money for university professors.

However, I do not agree with this plan is able to make many contributions to the improvement of universities, because there exist other appropriate options for us: giving more budget to school facilities and students' resources.
In the first place, well-organized devices lay a foundation for a university's educational quality.
As is known to all, almost all subjects are supposed to be equipped with great devices for students.
So they are able to perform well on their fields.
For example, studens who are major in biology are expected to possess their own microscope to research microbes, otherwise they can only study biology from books or the Internet.
It is evident that they are able to learn more knowledgeby perfect equipment than just reading books and original and creative ideas will come into being during the research process.
Therefore, buying more well-qualified devices is obviously a better choice.
In addition to that, universities should pay more money on recuiting better students than salaries for professors.
It is likely that the key to the best universites is excellent students.
Graduated students are people who are able to present universities' apparence than professors.
Therefore, if universities are willing to spend more budget on discovering potential students, like offering promising schoolarship and advertising, universities will benefit more from these actions.
Hence, there is no point for colleges to spend money on salaries for professors.
Last but not the least, universities are probably supposed to use these moeny on courses for professors rather than improving their salaries.
As we all know, universities professors are one of most well-paid and respectable careers in our society.
They already own wonderful lifes that majority of people are not able to dream about.
On the contrary, they are still expected to be trained in some aspects.
It is reporeted that a professor in a Beijing college abuse his students, which is totally unacceptable.
So we should spend more money on professors' training program.
To put it into a nutshell, spending more budget on professors' salaries is clearly not the best option to improve the quality of education.
We can put more money on devices and students
Recently, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among people: which goals should we foucus on, ambitious dreams or realistic goals?
Opinion vary from person to person.
Some people claimed that people should concentrate on achieving realistic goals.
However, I would stand on their opposite side and I believed that people should seek for the ambitious dreams.
My viewpoints can be elaborated as follows.
Firstly, ambitious dreams can cultivate a desire to advance.
If people have an ambitious dream, people would be careful to do anything in daily life and foster an attitude to win.
Then they will be more motived and more easy to achieve the dream.
When people meet troubles, they can overcome them quickly.
The reason is that they think they can achieve the anbitious dreams in the future, these problems are not a big deal.
Once they ahcieve the dreams, they will feel a sense of accomplishment and they will achieve higher goals next time.
For example, I was a shy girl in my high school and I was so normal that my classmates didn't notice me too much.
However, I set a dreams that I must get the offer of Wuhan controversary of Music.
After that I studied became harder and I was very strict to myself about the time of practing.
Because I told me my goals every second.
I felt very energetic and finnaly I got the offer and frist prize of the context of piano.
Secondly, ambitious dreams can make people suit the social environment well.
It is full of competition in the social environment.
To make people adapt to the society quickly in the future, they should set the ambitious goals.
However, if people treat everything without ambitious minds, they would probanly be ignored in this competitive society.
For example, I had a brother in Wuhan University and his was very clever.
But he was very lazy and didn't want to set an ambitious dream.
He just wanted to graduate and find a normal work.
Finally, when he stepped into the competitive society, there was no company wants to hire him.
They would rather to hire the person who has more ambitious goals.

From my point of view, I disagree with the statement that it is better to relax by watching a movie or reading a book than that relax by doing physical exercise.
Reasonable as it may sound, it is in fact ill-conceived.
My opinions are as follows.
First of all, reading a book or watching a movie doesn't amount to better relaxation or entertainment, it may take much more energies.
Many books are prodigious, like Ulysis, thus requiring much better energy to fully understand them.
Movies, similarly, are sometimes so moving that they make you bale, not relaxed at all.
As is more often the case, you are really engaged when reading a book or watching a movie, and your brain is calculating, imaging and reasoning all the time.
The energy they cost will only be more instead of less than doing physical exercise.
Besides, physical exercise is another effective way to relax as well.
It contributes to fully strech of your body, especially after a tiring day.
When you have finished your work, leaving the table, why not go out and take a walk or jog, which is much more fun than reading a book under the dull light or wathcing a movie in the crowded cinema.
Last but not least, the statement ignores the variety interest of people.
There are people who love reading, and there are definitely people who are opposite.
You cannot expect Tyson to relax better when reading than boxing, or Newton to enjoy more fun when diving than studying physics.
The statement is too subjective and supply no substance to confirm it.
To sum up, wathcing a movie, reading a book or doing physcal exercise, are all good choice to relax yourself.
The preference indeed varies from person to person.
There will never be a guaranttee that a specific activity will lead you to relax better.
Hence, unless it provides more evidence, I'd say it is intenable.

I think offering school-age children money for each high mark they get in the school is a good idea.
First,it is a good way to praise the children.
Money is an actual thing that is useful than a couple of words like "You did a  good job".
For children,it is also a way to show that they are equal to their parents--they are respected because they made money by their own hand just like their parents.
Secondly,it is also a good chance to teach your children "no pay no gain".
If you keep this habbit your children would understand that everyone can get what they want by apporppriate hard-working.
That is more effective than parents tell them directly.
Children can go through this experience by themselves and they will remember that for their whole life.
Another interesting thing is that parents can see what children will do with their money.
When a school-age child get the money he earned,he should learn how to use it correctly and usefully.
Parents should observe the altitude and the action of the children when they are going to use the money.
If they are confused or use the money unaproppriately,parents can correct them at once.
Also we knew that some children are self-esteem about their grades or appearance when they are teenagers.
Praise them by money is a good way to encourage them.

When they get upset about their study life or get unsatisfied about their apperance(especially for girls),try to use the money to have a good time and tell them:"What you did earned this money,and you can have fun with your life by using what you gained."
For children that are not so willing to study,parents can count the money once a month and have a great talk with children about their study situation.
That is clear to see how they are going on with their study.
And these are some of my opinons about the offering money to children for their high scores.
I think it is good for children's growth and communication with their parents.
Hope parents can think about more respectful and creative way of family education,for it is really impacful and important fo a child's whole life.
As we know, the advertisements are the best approach to introduct the commorces to all over the world.
We can know the characteristics of the goods by just watching the advertisements.
With the accelerate of the pace of the technology, the advertisements also become better than the past.
However, I think the realistic goods are not such good as the discribtion in the advertisements.
In the first place, the advertisements use a myriad of PS technology and vivid audial mechine make the food material looking better.
For instance, I  am a big fan of the orange juice.
According to the advertisement on the TV, the oranges that were used in making orange juice are so big and vigorous and the farmer directly use the fresh oranges making the juice.
However, I feel not tasty when I get this orange juice.
This is simlar to the other orange juice and I even can stimulate that this orange juice is just made of the suger wather and other materials.
I am highly disappoint with this good and I think I am treated by the advertisement.
This experience teach me that the discribtion in the advertisement is always not true and makes products seem better than what the products really are.
In the second place, a lot of advertisement like to use famous star to attract the fans.
Take myself as an instance, I have watched Kobe's basketball games since I was a little boy and I am a big fan of Koby.
I only by the basketball shoes which is advertised by himself.
Even I feel this shoes has no difference with other shoes, I still think this shoes is better than the others because these shoeses are weared by my favorite star.
In the fact, the star effect can make you feel the products are  much better than the realist.
Finally, a good advertisement obviousely can attract increasing number of people to buy the products.
Nevertheless, the fact that merchants use advertisements to tell lie for the consumer gradually become serious.
Therefore, we need persue the realist in the advertisement when we make advertisements since the trust is the most important thing.
To sum up, I agree with the following standpoint that most advertisements make goods seem better than the realist because the development of medio technology and star effect.
Above all, we should make the more realistic advertisements.

Having a good leadership is important for being a leader.
A good leader can lead the team go further, but how to become a good leader is a controversial question.
Some would say it comes naturally when one was born.
In contrary, I would like to say leadership can be separated by different areas.
Such as: popularity and professional ability.
And my opinion is these can be learn by different ways.
To start with, I believe popularity can be developed well.
popularity is a important factor that determines if a person have leadership or not.
A popular person always have a lot of friends and people prefer to listen to one's word if he or she is popular.
I think any unpopular person can be popular if they want.
For instance, my friend Mike told me his own experience.
He said once he compaigned the position of moniter and he was supported by almost everyone in class.
I was very curious so I asked why.
He explained that he used to be a shy boy so that he didn't talk much in class.
The result was nobody wanted to make friends with him.
One day he started to talk with everybody in his class and always helped other people with study.
Then he became very popular among students.
That's the most important reason why he got everybody's support in election of monitor.
Furthermore, I think professional ability can also be trained as well.
A leader should be have better ability in specific field.
Some people born with high IQ, but most of people are just normal.
So what people should do to have good leadership is working hard to know more specific knowledge.
Here is an example of myself.
It happened when I studied in high school.
Our school set up a math group and I was fortunately selected even if I didn't do well in matt.
By the way, most of the teammates were doing better than I was.
I almost wanted to give up.
However, my parents encouraged me and told me to insist on it.
Then I studied math like crazy.
I spend three hours everyday to do math problems.
And the result was I got the highest score on my math final exam.
Consequently, I became the leader of our math group.
Although I have to say somebody born with great leadership because they were the most popular kids in school when they were young.
Even if they took a heavy responsibility when they worked.
I still have to say that leadership can be improved by different ways.
People can also gain a great leadership by improving their popularity and professional ability.

Why don't they spend this time on studying and improving academic skills?
Although relaxion is necessary, it could't easily make you become successful in your future job.

Also, if people relate well to each other, they might ask others for help as long as they met some problems, this would improve their dependence, and cause them to have a lack of confidence to solve problems by themselves.
They should develop their skills to solve problems independently.
To conclude, I think studying hard in school is more crucial than the ability to relate well to people, which contradicts to the statement.

In the era of information, Internet seems to be a dispensable part of people's life, it shortens the distance between people all around the world by providing large amount of information.
Therefore, this enormous change brings to the society an interesting dispute: some people claim that much information creats problems while others hold opposite opinions.
As far as I am concerned, I agree that people can have access to valuable information from Internet, which will benefit us a lot in the long run.
By searching information available on the Internet, we can obtain large quantities of useful skills, which is beneficial to us.
For example, students who are preparing for IELTS or TOELF, information on the Internet is a treasure for them to explore.
They can gain whatever they are in desperate need for their preparation, such as vocabulary and grammar, which they can accumulate for writting.
Besides, they can also get vital suggestions shared by other students who have already passed the exams.
Therefore, they are able to develop their language skills and achieve their dreams of studying abroad.
Another important aspect is the current affairs.
Internet offers us an opportunity to be aware of the occurrence of many great events all over the world.
For example, we can witness the military parade to mark the 70th anniversary of victory in the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression due to the Internet.

Recently, a dead Syrian child on the beach draw the whole worlds attention, it is the Internet from which we can get information about outside world, this terrible issue then spark the world into action and urge people to pay attention to the refugees.
We can not only be informed of the joyful events but also those horrible news related to our lives through the Internet.
Admittedly, there are some unreal information on the Internet such as the misleading advertisements, rumour about celebrities and false news.
But I don't consider it as a trouble, fake information can be under control if people are critical thinkers and have the ability to tell the truth.
The rumor stops when it comes to a wise person after all.
All in all, the Internet is a great tool for us to be surrounded by a large amount of information, which can broden our horizon and make us knowledgeable instead of being into trouble.
Besides, it is the person who spreads unreal information rather than the Internet should be blamed.

College teachers deserve high salaries and many of them actually need money just like everyone else does,considering the high cost of living today---children' education fee,car,daily family budget,and housing especially.

As far as I am concered, parents should let children make mistakes and let them learn from their own mistakes.
Mistakes   are  a lifelong companion that cannot be avoided.
Parents are not able to help children to face the problems all their life.
Letting children how to deal with mistakes is of great significance.
And they will learn a lot through the process.
In my opinion, when children have made mistakes and they have dealt with them by themselves, they will be more deeply impressed by the standards of the things that they must or must not do.
For example, when students are caught in cheating, they will punished by their teachers.
However, if parents requir the teacher for forgiveness, the children will think the cheating as something with no importance.
Futhermore, I think when children learn from their own mistakes, they will master more skills and thus strength their confidence, which will benefit their independent ability.
For instance, when you make mistakes and no one can help you, then, you will try everthing you can to solve the mistakes.
In the process, you may learn many methods, skills and ideas which you will not master for ever if there are someone helps you.
The learned knowledges will greatly provied you a feeling of confidence and the process of learning will make you become more independent, which are valuable feagures in sociaty.
All in all, I think parents should let children make mistakes and let them learn from the mistakes.
Nowadays, due to the rapid development of society, the issue of whether people should follow the rules that societies today hope the young to follow has become an increasingly controvecial topic.

Firstly, the strict rules can help humans to tell right and wrong.
